<p><a href="/wiki/Barty_Crouch_Jr." title="Barty Crouch Jr." class="mw-redirect">Barty Crouch Jr.</a> (disguised as <a href="/wiki/Alastor_Moody" title="Alastor Moody">Alastor Moody</a>) remarked that Harry possessed a streak of pride and independence that almost cost him the <a href="/wiki/Triwizard_Tournament" title="Triwizard Tournament">Triwizard Tournament</a>, because of his refusal to ask for help regarding the problem of breathing underwater for an hour, that was required for the Second task which took place in the <a href="/wiki/Black_Lake" title="Black Lake" class="mw-redirect">Black Lake</a>.<sup id="cite_ref-GoF34_25-1" class="reference"><a href="#cite_note-GoF34-25">[26]</a></sup>
</p><p>Harry also seemed to have a bit of an obsessive personality, a trait he shared with his arch enemy <a href="/wiki/Tom_Riddle" title="Tom Riddle">Lord Voldemort</a>. He could be somewhat nosy and was known for sleuthing around and getting involved in things that did not concern him. During his sixth year, for instance, Harry became intensely preoccupied with finding out what Malfoy was doing in his free time.<sup id="cite_ref-HBP_31-1" class="reference"><a href="#cite_note-HBP-31">[32]</a></sup>
</p>
<figure class="article-thumb tright show-info-icon" style="width: 245px"> 	<a href="http://vignette4.wikia.nocookie.net/harrypotter/images/5/5f/Harry_%26_Ginny_kiss.gif/revision/latest?cb=20140704030548" 	class="image image-thumbnail" 	 	 	><img src="data:image/gif;base64,R0lGODlhAQABAIABAAAAAP///yH5BAEAAAEALAAAAAABAAEAQAICTAEAOw%3D%3D" 	 alt="Harry &amp; Ginny kiss"  	class="thumbimage lzy lzyPlcHld " 	 	data-image-key="Harry_%26_Ginny_kiss.gif" 	data-image-name="Harry &amp;amp; Ginny kiss.gif" 	 data-src="http://vignette4.wikia.nocookie.net/harrypotter/images/5/5f/Harry_%26_Ginny_kiss.gif/revision/latest?cb=20140704030548"  	 width="245"  	 height="115"  	 	 	 onload="if(typeof ImgLzy===&#39;object&#39;){ImgLzy.load(this)}"  	><noscript><img src="http://vignette4.wikia.nocookie.net/harrypotter/images/5/5f/Harry_%26_Ginny_kiss.gif/revision/latest?cb=20140704030548" 	 alt="Harry &amp; Ginny kiss"  	class="thumbimage " 	 	data-image-key="Harry_%26_Ginny_kiss.gif" 	data-image-name="Harry &amp;amp; Ginny kiss.gif" 	 	 width="245"  	 height="115"  	 	 	 	></noscript></a>  	<figcaption> 		 			<a href="/wiki/File:Harry_%26_Ginny_kiss.gif" class="sprite info-icon"></a> 		 		 		 			<p class="caption">Harry and his <a href="/wiki/Love" title="Love">love</a> for Ginny Weasley, his future wife</p> 		 	</figcaption> </figure>
<p>Harry's greatest strength was his ability to feel <a href="/wiki/Love" title="Love">love</a>, despite having a miserable childhood of neglect. Harry was extremely loyal to and protective of his loved ones, and that love was what allowed him to overcome Voldemort, Dumbledore noting Harry's strength of will at resisting the temptation to act like Voldemort even when granted a direct insight into Voldemort's mind and methods. Harry even claimed that he felt sorry for Voldemort because of his inability to feel or understand love.<sup id="cite_ref-HBP23_32-0" class="reference"><a href="#cite_note-HBP23-32">[33]</a></sup>
</p><p>Albus Dumbledore noted that Harry was unfailingly kind, and he was also compassionate and respectful. This is shown by how he freed Dobby from the Malfoys, and by standing up for Muggle-borns, half-bloods, and Half-breeds, like Hagrid. This is likely attributable to his childhood, during which the Dursleys deprived him of compassion, and discriminated against him due to his <a href="/wiki/Magic" title="Magic">magical</a> abilities. Also, Harry was not a cruel person and he never wished anyone harm. He rarely initiated duels, instead fighting in self-defence. Even after <a href="/wiki/Bellatrix_Lestrange" title="Bellatrix Lestrange">Bellatrix Lestrange</a> had murdered <a href="/wiki/Sirius_Black" title="Sirius Black">his godfather</a>, Harry failed to cast the Crutiatus curse on her; Bellatrix noted the he had failed to cast the curse properly because he had cast it out of righteous anger and not malicious intent.<sup id="cite_ref-OotP36_28-1" class="reference"><a href="#cite_note-OotP36-28">[29]</a></sup> However, he did use the Cruciatus Curse more effectively on <a href="/wiki/Amycus" title="Amycus" class="mw-redirect">Amycus Carrow</a> after he spat at and insulted <a href="/wiki/Minerva" title="Minerva">Minerva McGonagall</a>. In addition, he saved <a href="/wiki/Peter_Pettigrew" title="Peter Pettigrew">Peter Pettigrew</a> from being killed by his (Pettigrew's) former friends <a href="/wiki/Sirius_Black" title="Sirius Black">Sirius Black</a> and <a href="/wiki/Remus_Lupin" title="Remus Lupin">Remus Lupin</a>. Although, this was not done out of humanitarian reasons, but out of the memory of <a href="/wiki/James_Potter_I" title="James Potter I">his father</a>.
</p><p><a href="/wiki/Remus_Lupin" title="Remus Lupin">Remus Lupin</a> once noted that Harry had very good and nearly always right instincts.<sup id="cite_ref-DH22_30-1" class="reference"><a href="#cite_note-DH22-30">[31]</a></sup> Harry had a strong awareness of the incalculable power of certain acts, which is never more apparent than when he refused to allow Lupin to accompany him and leave his wife and child at home and realised that Ron Weasley was meant to destroy <a href="/wiki/Salazar_Slytherin%27s_locket" title="Salazar Slytherin&#39;s locket">Slytherin's locket</a>.
</p>
<figure class="article-thumb tleft show-info-icon" style="width: 245px"> 	<a href="http://vignette2.wikia.nocookie.net/harrypotter/images/0/03/Harry_temper.gif/revision/latest?cb=20141002142648" 	class="image image-thumbnail" 	 	 	><img src="data:image/gif;base64,R0lGODlhAQABAIABAAAAAP///yH5BAEAAAEALAAAAAABAAEAQAICTAEAOw%3D%3D" 	 alt="Harry temper"  	class="thumbimage lzy lzyPlcHld " 	 	data-image-key="Harry_temper.gif" 	data-image-name="Harry temper.gif" 	 data-src="http://vignette2.wikia.nocookie.net/harrypotter/images/0/03/Harry_temper.gif/revision/latest?cb=20141002142648"  	 width="245"  	 height="120"  	 	 	 onload="if(typeof ImgLzy===&#39;object&#39;){ImgLzy.load(this)}"  	><noscript><img src="http://vignette2.wikia.nocookie.net/harrypotter/images/0/03/Harry_temper.gif/revision/latest?cb=20141002142648" 	 alt="Harry temper"  	class="thumbimage " 	 	data-image-key="Harry_temper.gif" 	data-image-name="Harry temper.gif" 	 	 width="245"  	 height="120"  	 	 	 	></noscript></a>  	<figcaption> 		 			<a href="/wiki/File:Harry_temper.gif" class="sprite info-icon"></a> 		 		 		 			<p class="caption">Harry loses his temper with <a href="/wiki/Marjorie_Dursley" title="Marjorie Dursley">Aunt Marge</a></p> 		 	</figcaption> </figure> 
<p>In some ways, Harry can become extremely intimidating toward people such as Gilderoy Lockhart, Mundungus Fletcher, Hermione Granger and Ron Weasley. It is seen that Harry can become extremely frightening when pushed to the point of anger or extreme annoyance. When in a bad mood and argumentative even Harry's closest friends have been shown to be wary of him, usually replying to his angry tone in a calm and appeasing voice. The only person who does not appear to be afraid of him when he is angry (other than his teachers and other authority figures in his life) is Ginny Weasley.
</p><p>Harry seems to have good and long memory, as he remember the motorbike ride to Privet Drive with Hagrid when he was eleven and could remember the deaths of his mother and Voldemort's laughter when the events occurred ten years earlier.<sup id="cite_ref-PS_33-0" class="reference"><a href="#cite_note-PS-33">[34]</a></sup> Harry also cared very much for his children. He comforted his daughter, <a href="/wiki/Lily_Potter" title="Lily Potter">Lily Potter</a> when she was upset about not going to <a href="/wiki/Hogwarts_School_of_Witchcraft_and_Wizardry" title="Hogwarts School of Witchcraft and Wizardry">Hogwarts</a>. He also made sure his younger son <a href="/wiki/Albus_Potter" title="Albus Potter">Albus Potter</a> would not be teased a lot by Harry's older son, <a href="/wiki/James_Potter_II" title="James Potter II">James Potter II</a>.
</p><p>Although never as given to sarcasm or humour as his best friend <a href="/wiki/Ronald_Weasley" title="Ronald Weasley">Ron</a>, Harry often displayed a dry, occasionally sarcastic, wit. For instance, on finding out that <a href="/wiki/Hermione_Granger" title="Hermione Granger">Hermione Granger</a> intended to take twelve <a href="/wiki/Ordinary_Wizarding_Level" title="Ordinary Wizarding Level">O.W.Ls</a>, he asked her if she planned to eat or sleep at all that year. This humour often became more cutting when applied to people Harry disliked: When threatened by <a href="/wiki/Draco_Malfoy" title="Draco Malfoy">Draco Malfoy</a> and his cronies after the <a href="/wiki/Battle_of_the_Department_of_Mysteries" title="Battle of the Department of Mysteries">Battle of the Department of Mysteries</a>, Harry remarked that he supposed that "<i>Lord Voldemort's just a warm-up act compared to you three</i>", responding to Malfoy's threat that he was dead by casually commenting "<i>Funny, you'd think I'd have stopped walking around</i>".<sup id="cite_ref-OotP38_34-0" class="reference"><a href="#cite_note-OotP38-34">[35]</a></sup> Harry also displayed wit on the occasion when he first encountered Crookshanks, remarking that he was either "<i>a very large cat or quite a small tiger</i>".<sup id="cite_ref-PoA4_35-0" class="reference"><a href="#cite_note-PoA4-35">[36]</a></sup>
</p>
<div class="quote">
<dl><dd><span title="Source: Harry Potter and the Half-Blood Prince"><b>Harry</b>: "<i>Yes,</i>"
</dd><dd><b>Snape</b>: "<i>Yes </i>sir<i>.</i>"
</dd><dd><b>Harry</b>: "<i>There's no need to call me 'sir,' Professor.</i>"</span>
</dd><dd>&#8212; Harry in <a href="/wiki/1996" title="1996">1996</a><sup class="noprint"><a href="/wiki/Harry_Potter_and_the_Half-Blood_Prince" title="Harry Potter and the Half-Blood Prince">[src]</a></sup>
</dd></dl>
</div>
<p>Although he never sought power himself, and would be content with a normal life, when the situation required him to step up, such as when he, Ron and Hermione discovered Voldemort and Quirrell's attempt to steal the Philosopher's Stone, or his time as teacher/leader of Dumbledore's Army, Harry has shown not-inconsiderable leadership abilities, to the point that Dumbledore reflected that Harry was a better leader than him as he never sought power for himself but simply had to assume the mantle of leadership due to circumstances beyond his control and found in the process that he did it well.
</p><p>During his youth, Harry also tended to see morality in a rather stark, absolute manner, particularly when it came to the <a href="/wiki/Hogwarts_Houses" title="Hogwarts Houses">Houses</a>. Harry generally regarded members of <a href="/wiki/Slytherin" title="Slytherin">Slytherin</a> House as evil and therefore his enemies, while <a href="/wiki/Gryffindors" title="Gryffindors" class="mw-redirect">Gryffindors</a>, <a href="/wiki/Ravenclaw" title="Ravenclaw">Ravenclaw</a> and <a href="/wiki/Hufflepuff" title="Hufflepuff">Hufflepuff</a> were allies. The former part could be due to his own status as a Gryffindor, and that many of the Slytherins he encountered, such as <a href="/wiki/Tom_Riddle" title="Tom Riddle">Lord Voldemort</a>, <a href="/wiki/Draco_Malfoy" title="Draco Malfoy">Draco Malfoy</a>, and <a href="/wiki/Severus_Snape" title="Severus Snape">Severus Snape</a>, were significant enemies of his during this period. In addition, many of his friends and allies, such as Ron, Hermione, Dumbledore, and Hagrid, were fellow Gryffindors. However, this mentality eroded as he aged, since he encountered both allies among Slytherin, such as <a href="/wiki/Horace_Slughorn" title="Horace Slughorn">Horace Slughorn</a> (and, later, Snape), and enemies among the other three Houses, such as <a href="/wiki/Peter_Pettigrew" title="Peter Pettigrew">Peter Pettigrew</a> (a fellow Gryffindor) and <a href="/wiki/Quirinus_Quirrell" title="Quirinus Quirrell">Quirinus Quirrell</a> (a Ravenclaw). By <a href="/wiki/2017" title="2017">2017</a>, Harry adopted a more moderate attitude on the Houses, telling his younger son <a href="/wiki/Albus_Potter" title="Albus Potter">Albus Potter</a> that "<i>it doesn't matter to <a href="/wiki/Potter_family" title="Potter family">us</a></i>" if Albus was sorted in Slytherin or Gryffindor. In addition, Harry named that same son after <a href="/wiki/Severus_Snape" title="Severus Snape">Severus Snape</a>, whom he recounted as "<i>the bravest man [he] ever knew</i>".
</p>
<h2><span class="mw-headline" id="Magical_abilities_and_skills">Magical abilities and skills</span></h2>
<figure class="article-thumb tright show-info-icon" style="width: 245px"> 	<a href="http://vignette2.wikia.nocookie.net/harrypotter/images/a/a0/Tumblr_mm80qqESfG1rmesz7o8_250.gif/revision/latest?cb=20140306082114" 	class="image image-thumbnail" 	 	 	><img src="data:image/gif;base64,R0lGODlhAQABAIABAAAAAP///yH5BAEAAAEALAAAAAABAAEAQAICTAEAOw%3D%3D" 	 alt="Tumblr mm80qqESfG1rmesz7o8 250"  	class="thumbimage lzy lzyPlcHld " 	 	data-image-key="Tumblr_mm80qqESfG1rmesz7o8_250.gif" 	data-image-name="Tumblr mm80qqESfG1rmesz7o8 250.gif" 	 data-src="http://vignette2.wikia.nocookie.net/harrypotter/images/a/a0/Tumblr_mm80qqESfG1rmesz7o8_250.gif/revision/latest?cb=20140306082114"  	 width="245"  	 height="150"  	 	 	 onload="if(typeof ImgLzy===&#39;object&#39;){ImgLzy.load(this)}"  	><noscript><img src="http://vignette2.wikia.nocookie.net/harrypotter/images/a/a0/Tumblr_mm80qqESfG1rmesz7o8_250.gif/revision/latest?cb=20140306082114" 	 alt="Tumblr mm80qqESfG1rmesz7o8 250"  	class="thumbimage " 	 	data-image-key="Tumblr_mm80qqESfG1rmesz7o8_250.gif" 	data-image-name="Tumblr mm80qqESfG1rmesz7o8 250.gif" 	 	 width="245"  	 height="150"  	 	 	 	></noscript></a>  	<figcaption> 		 			<a href="/wiki/File:Tumblr_mm80qqESfG1rmesz7o8_250.gif" class="sprite info-icon"></a> 		 		 		 			<p class="caption">Harry's corporeal <a href="/wiki/Patronus" title="Patronus" class="mw-redirect">Patronus</a> (form of a stag), age thirteen</p> 		 	</figcaption> </figure>
<div class="quote">
<dl><dd><span title="Source: Accio Quote!">"<i>Harry.... is becoming exceptionally good at <a href="/wiki/Defence_Against_the_Dark_Arts" title="Defence Against the Dark Arts">Defence Against the Dark Arts</a>. So that's the one area in which, almost instinctively, he is particularly talented. Apart from Quidditch.</i>"</span>
</dd><dd>&#8212;<a href="/wiki/J.K._Rowling" title="J.K. Rowling" class="mw-redirect">J.K. Rowling</a>, interview with South West News<sup class="noprint"><a href="/wiki/Accio_Quote!" title="Accio Quote!">[src]</a></sup>
</dd><dd></div>
</dd></dl>
<p>Harry was seen and had proven himself to be a very talented and powerful wizard. His power was evident from the start: he demonstrated immediate command of a <a href="/wiki/Broomstick" title="Broomstick">broomstick</a>, was able to conjure a corporeal <a href="/wiki/Patronus" title="Patronus" class="mw-redirect">Patronus</a> at an exceptionally young age (a mark of superior magical ability),<sup id="cite_ref-PM_18-1" class="reference"><a href="#cite_note-PM-18">[19]</a></sup> and even survived numerous encounters with Lord Voldemort. He also mastered a wand made of <a href="/wiki/Hawthorn" title="Hawthorn">hawthorn</a>, which one should only ever consider placing in the hands of a witch or wizard of proven talent.<sup id="cite_ref-pottermore_36-0" class="reference"><a href="#cite_note-pottermore-36">[37]</a></sup>
</p>
<ul><li><b><a href="/wiki/Love" title="Love">Love</a></b>: Harry's greatest power of all was his ability to love. In spite of being raised by a family that treated him with anything but affection, Harry remarkably turned out capable of very strong love. For example, Harry's love for his friends caused him to sacrifice himself to Lord Voldemort. His love for his friends also caused him to feel no concern for his own well being or happiness when they were at risk, and put himself in danger many times to protect them. This loving sacrifice conferred a certain amount of <a href="/wiki/Sacrificial_protection" title="Sacrificial protection">protection</a> onto his allies, making it so that spells Voldemort tried to place on them quickly wore off.<sup id="cite_ref-DH36_37-0" class="reference"><a href="#cite_note-DH36-37">[38]</a></sup> Harry's ability to love has also protected and helped him on several occasions, such as when he defeated <a href="/wiki/Quirinus_Quirrell" title="Quirinus Quirrell">Quirrell</a> by causing his skin to burn (due to the magical protection from his mother's sacrifice<sup id="cite_ref-PS17_38-0" class="reference"><a href="#cite_note-PS17-38">[39]</a></sup>), produced a <a href="/wiki/Patronus" title="Patronus" class="mw-redirect">Patronus</a> that could drive numerous <a href="/wiki/Dementors" title="Dementors" class="mw-redirect">Dementors</a> away,<sup id="cite_ref-PoA21_39-0" class="reference"><a href="#cite_note-PoA21-39">[40]</a></sup> repelled Voldemort himself when he possessed him,<sup id="cite_ref-OoP36_40-0" class="reference"><a href="#cite_note-OoP36-40">[41]</a></sup> and allowed him to close the connection between him and Voldemort when he was unable to perform <a href="/wiki/Occlumency" title="Occlumency">Occlumency</a>.<sup id="cite_ref-DH24_41-0" class="reference"><a href="#cite_note-DH24-41">[42]</a></sup> His love was strongest when directed at <a href="/wiki/Ginny_Weasley" title="Ginny Weasley" class="mw-redirect">Ginny Weasley</a>, who was the driving force that kept him going until Voldemort was defeated.
</li></ul>
<div class="quote">
<dl><dd><span title="Source: Harry Potter and the Order of the Phoenix">"<i>Harry, you're the best in the year at Defence Against the Dark Arts.</i>"</span>
</dd><dd>&#8212;<a href="/wiki/Hermione_Granger" title="Hermione Granger">Hermione Granger</a><sup class="noprint"><a href="/wiki/Harry_Potter_and_the_Order_of_the_Phoenix" title="Harry Potter and the Order of the Phoenix">[src]</a></sup>
</dd><dd></div>
</dd></dl>
<figure class="article-thumb tleft show-info-icon" style="width: 245px"> 	<a href="http://vignette1.wikia.nocookie.net/harrypotter/images/e/e0/00grindylow.gif/revision/latest?cb=20140716230942" 	class="image image-thumbnail" 	 	 	><img src="data:image/gif;base64,R0lGODlhAQABAIABAAAAAP///yH5BAEAAAEALAAAAAABAAEAQAICTAEAOw%3D%3D" 	 alt="00grindylow"  	class="thumbimage lzy lzyPlcHld " 	 	data-image-key="00grindylow.gif" 	data-image-name="00grindylow.gif" 	 data-src="http://vignette1.wikia.nocookie.net/harrypotter/images/e/e0/00grindylow.gif/revision/latest?cb=20140716230942"  	 width="245"  	 height="130"  	 	 	 onload="if(typeof ImgLzy===&#39;object&#39;){ImgLzy.load(this)}"  	><noscript><img src="http://vignette1.wikia.nocookie.net/harrypotter/images/e/e0/00grindylow.gif/revision/latest?cb=20140716230942" 	 alt="00grindylow"  	class="thumbimage " 	 	data-image-key="00grindylow.gif" 	data-image-name="00grindylow.gif" 	 	 width="245"  	 height="130"  	 	 	 	></noscript></a>  	<figcaption> 		 			<a href="/wiki/File:00grindylow.gif" class="sprite info-icon"></a> 		 		 		 			<p class="caption">Harry defending himself against <a href="/wiki/Grindylows" title="Grindylows" class="mw-redirect">Grindylows</a> in <a href="/wiki/1994%E2%80%931995_school_year" title="1994–1995 school year">1994</a></p> 		 	</figcaption> </figure>
<ul><li><b><a href="/wiki/Defence_Against_the_Dark_Arts" title="Defence Against the Dark Arts">Defence Against the Dark Arts</a></b>: Harry was extremely adept in Defence Against the Dark Arts, having mastered all manners of spells, such as the <a href="/wiki/Stunning_Spell" title="Stunning Spell">Stunning Spell</a>, <a href="/wiki/Disarming_Charm" title="Disarming Charm">Disarming Charm</a>, <a href="/wiki/Impediment_Jinx" title="Impediment Jinx">Impediment Jinx</a>, <a href="/wiki/Full_Body-Bind_Curse" title="Full Body-Bind Curse">Full Body-Bind Curse</a>, and <a href="/wiki/Reductor_Curse" title="Reductor Curse">Reductor Curse</a>.<sup id="cite_ref-OotP34_42-0" class="reference"><a href="#cite_note-OotP34-42">[43]</a></sup> In fact, his Stunning Spell was so strong that opponents would get knocked out if they were hit directly. He was also skilled at defending himself against Dark creatures such as: <a href="/wiki/Grindylow" title="Grindylow">Grindylows</a>, <a href="/wiki/Red_Cap" title="Red Cap">Red Caps</a>, <a href="/wiki/Hinkypunk" title="Hinkypunk">Hinkypunks</a>, <a href="/wiki/Boggart" title="Boggart">Boggarts</a>, <a href="/wiki/Erkling" title="Erkling">Erklings</a>, and <a href="/wiki/Dementor" title="Dementor">Dementors</a>. In his third year, he was the only student who flawlessly made it through the end-of-the-year exam (an obstacle course containing some of the said creatures<sup id="cite_ref-PoA16_43-0" class="reference"><a href="#cite_note-PoA16-43">[44]</a></sup>). In his fifth year, <a href="/wiki/Professor_McGonagall" title="Professor McGonagall" class="mw-redirect">Professor McGonagall</a> stated that <a href="/wiki/Remus_Lupin" title="Remus Lupin">Professor Lupin</a> said he showed a "<i>pronounced aptitude</i>" for the subject, and that he had "<i>achieved high marks on all his Defence Against the Dark Arts tests</i>".<sup id="cite_ref-OotP29_44-0" class="reference"><a href="#cite_note-OotP29-44">[45]</a></sup> In fact, Harry had beaten Hermione in two of the three Defence Against the Dark Arts exams they had taken together, with her only beating him in their first year exam and Hermione later reflecting that it didn't count as Quirrell "wasn't a particularly good teacher".<sup id="cite_ref-OotP16_45-0" class="reference"><a href="#cite_note-OotP16-45">[46]</a></sup> During his O.W.L. examination, Professor Tofty (Wizarding Examinations Authority) expressed pleasure at Harry's performance of Defence Against the Dark Arts, calling it "<i>excellent</i>".<sup id="cite_ref-OotP31_46-0" class="reference"><a href="#cite_note-OotP31-46">[47]</a></sup> This statement was later proven true when he achieved an '<a href="/wiki/Outstanding" title="Outstanding">Outstanding</a>' Defence Against the Dark Arts <a href="/wiki/Ordinary_Wizarding_Level" title="Ordinary Wizarding Level">O.W.L.</a>, something that not even Hermione achieved, a testament of his extraordinary talent in defensive magic. In 1996, Ron stated that it came as no surprise that Harry was top of the class at Defence Against the Dark Arts.<sup id="cite_ref-HBP4_47-0" class="reference"><a href="#cite_note-HBP4-47">[48]</a></sup> Indeed, Harry was so good at D.A.D.A. that when the <a href="/wiki/British_Ministry_of_Magic" title="British Ministry of Magic">Ministry of Magic</a> prevented the subject from being taught effectively in <a href="/wiki/1995" title="1995">1995</a>, he set up his own D.A.D.A. club and successfully taught members how  to defend themselves against the Dark Arts. He immediately became an <a href="/wiki/Auror" title="Auror">Auror</a> after the Second Wizarding War, which also required considerable skill in both defensive and offensive magic. Harry also developed a high level of resistance to the <a href="/wiki/Imperius_Curse" title="Imperius Curse">Imperius Curse</a> as well, demonstrated when it was cast upon him by <a href="/wiki/Bartemius_Crouch_Jr." title="Bartemius Crouch Jr.">Barty Crouch Jr.</a> (disguised as <a href="/wiki/Alastor_Moody" title="Alastor Moody">Alastor Moody</a>) and by <a href="/wiki/Tom_Riddle" title="Tom Riddle">Voldemort</a> himself in 1995.<sup id="cite_ref-GoF34_25-2" class="reference"><a href="#cite_note-GoF34-25">[26]</a></sup>
</li></ul>
<div class="quote">
<dl><dd><span title="Source: Harry Potter and the Order of the Phoenix">"<i> </i>[...]<i> there's no point pretending that you're not good at <a href="/wiki/Defense_Against_the_Dark_Arts" title="Defense Against the Dark Arts" class="mw-redirect">Defense Against the Dark Arts</a>, because you are. You were the only person last year who could throw off the <a href="/wiki/Imperius_Curse" title="Imperius Curse">Imperius Curse</a> completely, you can produce a <a href="/wiki/Patronus_Charm" title="Patronus Charm">Patronus</a>, you can do all sorts of stuff that full-grown wizards can't.</i>"</span>
</dd><dd>&#8212;Hermione Granger to Harry in <a href="/wiki/1995" title="1995">1995</a><sup class="noprint"><a href="/wiki/Harry_Potter_and_the_Order_of_the_Phoenix" title="Harry Potter and the Order of the Phoenix">[src]</a></sup>
</dd><dd></div>
</dd></dl>
<figure class="article-thumb tright show-info-icon" style="width: 240px"> 	<a href="http://vignette2.wikia.nocookie.net/harrypotter/images/1/17/Tumblr_lq90540gqt1qedoxoo2_250.gif/revision/latest?cb=20140405022531" 	class="image image-thumbnail" 	 	 	><img src="data:image/gif;base64,R0lGODlhAQABAIABAAAAAP///yH5BAEAAAEALAAAAAABAAEAQAICTAEAOw%3D%3D" 	 alt="Tumblr lq90540gqt1qedoxoo2 250"  	class="thumbimage lzy lzyPlcHld " 	 	data-image-key="Tumblr_lq90540gqt1qedoxoo2_250.gif" 	data-image-name="Tumblr lq90540gqt1qedoxoo2 250.gif" 	 data-src="http://vignette2.wikia.nocookie.net/harrypotter/images/1/17/Tumblr_lq90540gqt1qedoxoo2_250.gif/revision/latest/scale-to-width/240?cb=20140405022531"  	 width="240"  	 height="102"  	 	 	 onload="if(typeof ImgLzy===&#39;object&#39;){ImgLzy.load(this)}"  	><noscript><img src="http://vignette2.wikia.nocookie.net/harrypotter/images/1/17/Tumblr_lq90540gqt1qedoxoo2_250.gif/revision/latest/scale-to-width/240?cb=20140405022531" 	 alt="Tumblr lq90540gqt1qedoxoo2 250"  	class="thumbimage " 	 	data-image-key="Tumblr_lq90540gqt1qedoxoo2_250.gif" 	data-image-name="Tumblr lq90540gqt1qedoxoo2 250.gif" 	 	 width="240"  	 height="102"  	 	 	 	></noscript></a>  	<figcaption> 		 			<a href="/wiki/File:Tumblr_lq90540gqt1qedoxoo2_250.gif" class="sprite info-icon"></a> 		 		 		 			<p class="caption">Harry dueling <a href="/wiki/Tom_Riddle" title="Tom Riddle">Voldemort</a> in <a href="/wiki/Little_Hangleton" title="Little Hangleton">Little Hangleton</a></p> 		 	</figcaption> </figure>
<ul><li><b><a href="/wiki/Duelling" title="Duelling">Duelling</a></b>: Despite his young age, Harry was an accomplished and skillful duellist, being able to single-handedly defeat <a href="/wiki/Death_Eaters" title="Death Eaters">Death Eaters</a> and even survive numerous encounters with <a href="/wiki/Tom_Riddle" title="Tom Riddle">Lord Voldemort</a> himself. He eventually defeated Voldemort by becoming the master of the <a href="/wiki/Elder_Wand" title="Elder Wand">Elder Wand</a>. In many battles of the Second Wizarding War, he was able to incapacitate much more experienced Death Eaters, and during the <a href="/wiki/Battle_of_the_Department_of_Mysteries" title="Battle of the Department of Mysteries">Battle of the Department of Mysteries</a>, he was the only one of the six D.A. members to be neither injured nor incapacitated and, along with <a href="/wiki/Albus_Dumbledore" title="Albus Dumbledore">Albus Dumbledore</a> and <a href="/wiki/Remus_Lupin" title="Remus Lupin">Remus Lupin</a>, was the only fighter on their side to emerge from the battle physically unscathed, and in that time he had defeated <a href="/wiki/Lucius_Malfoy" title="Lucius Malfoy">Lucius Malfoy</a> and had defeated the extremely powerful <a href="/wiki/Antonin_Dolohov" title="Antonin Dolohov">Antonin Dolohov</a> twice. Later, in the same battle, he was able to hold his own against <a href="/wiki/Bellatrix_Lestrange" title="Bellatrix Lestrange">Bellatrix Lestrange</a>, who was the most powerful of all the Death Eaters.<sup id="cite_ref-OotP_48-0" class="reference"><a href="#cite_note-OotP-48">[49]</a></sup> In <a href="/wiki/1997" title="1997">1997</a>, Harry defeated <a href="/wiki/Yaxley" title="Yaxley">Yaxley</a>, <a href="/wiki/Fenrir_Greyback" title="Fenrir Greyback">Fenrir Greyback</a>, and one of the two Carrows.<sup id="cite_ref-DH_29-1" class="reference"><a href="#cite_note-DH-29">[30]</a></sup> He fought off several Death Eaters in the <a href="/wiki/Battle_of_the_Seven_Potters" title="Battle of the Seven Potters">Battle of the Seven Potters</a>, overpowered Lucius Malfoy, <a href="/wiki/Draco_Malfoy" title="Draco Malfoy">Draco Malfoy</a>, and Fenrir Greyback during the <a href="/wiki/Skirmish_at_Malfoy_Manor" title="Skirmish at Malfoy Manor">Skirmish at Malfoy Manor</a> and avoided direct conflict damage all throughout the <a href="/wiki/Battle_of_Hogwarts" title="Battle of Hogwarts">Battle of Hogwarts</a> (ensuring that mastery of the Elder Wand did not waver from him<sup id="cite_ref-DH_29-2" class="reference"><a href="#cite_note-DH-29">[30]</a></sup>). He was known to be very quick off the draw and had an aggressive duelling style, even incorporating Unforgivable Curses. He was also known to taunt his opponents and get them to talk at length, angering them and throwing them mentally off-balance, buying himself time to strategise or lulling them into lowering their guard. Harry was especially skilled in the <a href="/wiki/Disarming_Charm" title="Disarming Charm">Disarming Charm</a>, and used it so much that it was seen as his "signature spell" by many Death Eaters. His most notable uses of the Disarming Charm were when he formed <a href="/wiki/Priori_Incantatem" title="Priori Incantatem">Priori Incantatem</a> with Voldemort and when he finally killed the Dark Lord. At the remarkably young age of seventeen, Harry became an Auror and in <a href="/wiki/2007" title="2007" class="mw-redirect">2007</a>, was promoted to Head of the Auror Office.
</li></ul>
<div class="quote">
<dl><dd><span title="Source: Harry Potter and the Deathly Hallows">"<i> </i>Imperio<i>" Harry said again; his voice echoed through the stone passage as he felt the familiar sense of heady control that flowed from brain to wand</i>"</span>
</dd><dd>&#8212;Harry casting an <a href="/wiki/Unforgivable_Curses" title="Unforgivable Curses">Unforgivable Curse</a> on <a href="/wiki/Bogrod" title="Bogrod">Bogrod</a><sup class="noprint"><a href="/wiki/Harry_Potter_and_the_Deathly_Hallows" title="Harry Potter and the Deathly Hallows">[src]</a></sup>
</dd><dd></div>
</dd></dl>
<ul><li><b><a href="/wiki/Dark_Arts" title="Dark Arts">Dark Arts</a></b>: Harry was one of the few non-<a href="/wiki/Dark_Wizard" title="Dark Wizard">Dark Wizards</a> who was highly proficient in the Dark Arts at all levels; whilst he knew simple curses and jinxes like the; <a href="/wiki/Leg-Locker_Curse" title="Leg-Locker Curse">Leg-Locker Curse</a>, <a href="/wiki/Furnunculus" title="Furnunculus" class="mw-redirect">Furnunculus Curse</a>, <a href="/wiki/Knockback_Jinx" title="Knockback Jinx">Knockback Jinx</a>, <a href="/wiki/Revulsion_Jinx" title="Revulsion Jinx">Revulsion Jinx</a>, and <a href="/wiki/Melofors_Jinx" title="Melofors Jinx">Melofors Jinx</a>, he could cast more powerful spells such as the <a href="/wiki/Blasting_Curse" title="Blasting Curse">Blasting Curse</a>.<sup id="cite_ref-DH4_49-0" class="reference"><a href="#cite_note-DH4-49">[50]</a></sup> He was also able to flawlessly cast the jinxes and curses in the<a href="/wiki/Half-Blood_Prince%27s_copy_of_Advanced_Potion-Making" title="Half-Blood Prince&#39;s copy of Advanced Potion-Making" class="mw-redirect"> Half-Blood Prince's copy of Advanced Potion-Making</a>.<sup id="cite_ref-HBP_31-2" class="reference"><a href="#cite_note-HBP-31">[32]</a></sup> Harry even used some of the <a href="/wiki/Unforgivable_Curses" title="Unforgivable Curses">Unforgivable Curses</a>, such as the <a href="/wiki/Imperius_Curse" title="Imperius Curse">Imperius Curse</a> on <a href="/wiki/Travers" title="Travers">Travers</a> and a <a href="/wiki/Goblin" title="Goblin">goblin</a> called <a href="/wiki/Bogrod" title="Bogrod">Bogrod</a> during the <a href="/wiki/Break-in_of_Gringotts_Wizarding_Bank_(1998)" title="Break-in of Gringotts Wizarding Bank (1998)">1998 Break-in of Gringotts Wizarding Bank</a>,<sup id="cite_ref-DH26_50-0" class="reference"><a href="#cite_note-DH26-50">[51]</a></sup> as well as the <a href="/wiki/Cruciatus_Curse" title="Cruciatus Curse">Cruciatus Curse</a> on several occasions. However, his first successful attempt was in <a href="/wiki/1998" title="1998">1998</a> against <a href="/wiki/Amycus_Carrow" title="Amycus Carrow">Amycus Carrow</a>, but it did not result in the prolonged, excruciating pain that the curse was famous for — instead, Carrow screamed and was incapacitated.<sup id="cite_ref-DH30_51-0" class="reference"><a href="#cite_note-DH30-51">[52]</a></sup> He has never used the <a href="/wiki/Killing_Curse" title="Killing Curse">Killing Curse</a> for obvious reasons, even in his final battle with Voldemort.
</li></ul>
<div class="quote">
<dl><dd><span title="Source: Harry Potter and the Prisoner of Azkaban">"<i>You play as good as your father did, Harry.</i>"</span>
</dd><dd>&#8212;<a href="/wiki/Sirius_Black" title="Sirius Black">Sirius Black</a> talking about Harry's flying talent<sup class="noprint"><a href="/wiki/Harry_Potter_and_the_Prisoner_of_Azkaban" title="Harry Potter and the Prisoner of Azkaban">[src]</a></sup>
</dd><dd></div>
</dd></dl>
<figure class="article-thumb tright show-info-icon" style="width: 213px"> 	<a href="http://vignette1.wikia.nocookie.net/harrypotter/images/1/1e/Harry_Potter_-_Quidditch_%28HBP_promo%29_1.jpg/revision/latest?cb=20141122215656" 	class="image image-thumbnail" 	 	 	><img src="data:image/gif;base64,R0lGODlhAQABAIABAAAAAP///yH5BAEAAAEALAAAAAABAAEAQAICTAEAOw%3D%3D" 	 alt="Harry Potter - Quidditch (HBP promo) 1"  	class="thumbimage lzy lzyPlcHld " 	 	data-image-key="Harry_Potter_-_Quidditch_%28HBP_promo%29_1.jpg" 	data-image-name="Harry Potter - Quidditch (HBP promo) 1.jpg" 	 data-src="http://vignette1.wikia.nocookie.net/harrypotter/images/1/1e/Harry_Potter_-_Quidditch_%28HBP_promo%29_1.jpg/revision/latest/scale-to-width/213?cb=20141122215656"  	 width="213"  	 height="160"  	 	 	 onload="if(typeof ImgLzy===&#39;object&#39;){ImgLzy.load(this)}"  	><noscript><img src="http://vignette1.wikia.nocookie.net/harrypotter/images/1/1e/Harry_Potter_-_Quidditch_%28HBP_promo%29_1.jpg/revision/latest/scale-to-width/213?cb=20141122215656" 	 alt="Harry Potter - Quidditch (HBP promo) 1"  	class="thumbimage " 	 	data-image-key="Harry_Potter_-_Quidditch_%28HBP_promo%29_1.jpg" 	data-image-name="Harry Potter - Quidditch (HBP promo) 1.jpg" 	 	 width="213"  	 height="160"  	 	 	 	></noscript></a>  	<figcaption> 		 			<a href="/wiki/File:Harry_Potter_-_Quidditch_(HBP_promo)_1.jpg" class="sprite info-icon"></a> 		 		 		 			<p class="caption">Harry on his broom</p> 		 	</figcaption> </figure>
<ul><li><b><a href="/wiki/Flying" title="Flying">Flying</a></b>: Harry had also inherited his <a href="/wiki/James_Potter_I" title="James Potter I">father</a>'s talent for flying and for <a href="/wiki/Quidditch" title="Quidditch">Quidditch</a>, showing immediate command of a <a href="/wiki/Broomstick" title="Broomstick">broomstick</a> in his first year, which made him a naturally good <a href="/wiki/Seeker" title="Seeker">Seeker</a>. This was the first magical skill for which he discovered an aptitude, as he found in 1991. In fact, at the mere age of eleven, Harry became the youngest Seeker in a century.<sup id="cite_ref-PS9_52-0" class="reference"><a href="#cite_note-PS9-52">[53]</a></sup> Harry's extraordinary flying skills aided him when he had to capture <a href="/wiki/Winged_Keys" title="Winged Keys">Winged Keys</a> to get past <a href="/wiki/Filius_Flitwick" title="Filius Flitwick">Professor Flitwick</a>'s challenge in the <a href="/wiki/Philosopher%27s_Stone_Chambers" title="Philosopher&#39;s Stone Chambers" class="mw-redirect">Philosopher's Stone Chambers</a>, and also helped him in the Triwizard Tournament (where he had to steal a golden egg from a <a href="/wiki/Hungarian_Horntail" title="Hungarian Horntail">Hungarian Horntail</a>), and during the <a href="/wiki/Battle_of_Hogwarts" title="Battle of Hogwarts">Battle of Hogwarts</a>, during which he managed to escape a <i><a href="/wiki/Fiendfyre" title="Fiendfyre">Fiendfyre</a></i> inferno in the <a href="/wiki/Room_of_Requirement" title="Room of Requirement">Room of Requirement</a>.
</li><li><b><a href="/wiki/Parseltongue" title="Parseltongue">Parselmouth</a></b>: Because he carried <a href="/wiki/Horcrux" title="Horcrux">a piece of Voldemort's soul</a> within himself, Harry was able to speak and understand Parseltongue from <a href="/wiki/1981" title="1981">1981</a> to <a href="/wiki/1998" title="1998">1998</a>. After that soul fragment was destroyed, Harry lost this ability, which he was glad for.
</li><li><b>Insight into Voldemort's mind</b>: Also due to the piece of Voldemort's soul, Harry was able to look into Voldemort's mind and see through his senses from time to time. He sometimes used this ability to monitor what <a href="/wiki/Tom_Riddle" title="Tom Riddle">Voldemort</a> was doing. However, it was a dangerous ability to have as well; Voldemort once used it, along with <a href="/wiki/Legilimency" title="Legilimency">Legilimency</a>, to plant a false vision in Harry's mind of <a href="/wiki/Sirius_Black" title="Sirius Black">Sirius Black</a> being tortured, which he used to lure Harry to the <a href="/wiki/Department_of_Mysteries" title="Department of Mysteries">Department of Mysteries</a>.<sup id="cite_ref-OotP23_53-0" class="reference"><a href="#cite_note-OotP23-53">[54]</a></sup> Additionally, because of their connection, Harry felt a burning pain in his scar whenever he and Voldemort were in close proximity or whenever Voldemort felt strong negative emotions. As Harry lost the ability to speak <a href="/wiki/Parseltongue" title="Parseltongue">Parseltongue</a>, he presumably lost this ability as well when the soul fragment within him was destroyed, as was Voldemort himself.
</li><li><b><a href="/wiki/Master_of_Death" title="Master of Death">Master of Death</a></b>: Harry mastered all three Deathly Hallows and accepted his own death.<sup id="cite_ref-DH_29-3" class="reference"><a href="#cite_note-DH-29">[30]</a></sup> First, he inherited the <a href="/wiki/Cloak_of_Invisibility" title="Cloak of Invisibility">Cloak of Invisibility</a> from his father, James. Then, he inherited the <a href="/wiki/Resurrection_Stone" title="Resurrection Stone">Resurrection Stone</a> from Dumbledore, which was inside a snitch. Finally, he won the <a href="/wiki/Elder_Wand" title="Elder Wand">Elder Wand</a> from Draco Malfoy during the <a href="/wiki/Skirmish_at_Malfoy_Manor" title="Skirmish at Malfoy Manor">Skirmish at Malfoy Manor</a>. All three were directly or indirectly employed by Harry in the <a href="/wiki/Forbidden_Forest" title="Forbidden Forest">Forbidden Forest</a>: he was wearing the Cloak, using the Stone, and was preparing to be killed by the Wand, which he had already won.<sup id="cite_ref-DH34_54-0" class="reference"><a href="#cite_note-DH34-54">[55]</a></sup> The only Hallow he choose to keep was the cloak as it was a priceless family heirloom; the stone was lost in the forest and the wand returned to Dumbledore's tomb.<sup id="cite_ref-DH36_37-1" class="reference"><a href="#cite_note-DH36-37">[38]</a></sup>
</li></ul>
<div class="quote">
<dl><dd><span title="Source: Harry Potter and the Order of the Phoenix">"<i> </i>[...]<i> and was pleased to find that when left alone, he was able to concoct an <a href="/wiki/Invigoration_Draught" title="Invigoration Draught">Invigoration Draught</a> quite easily.</i>"</span>
</dd><dd>&#8212;Harry's opinion on brewing the Ordinary Wizarding Level potion<sup class="noprint"><a href="/wiki/Harry_Potter_and_the_Order_of_the_Phoenix" title="Harry Potter and the Order of the Phoenix">[src]</a></sup>
</dd><dd></div>
</dd></dl>
<figure class="article-thumb tleft show-info-icon" style="width: 140px"> 	<a href="http://vignette2.wikia.nocookie.net/harrypotter/images/3/32/Harry_potions_sixth_year_1_hi_res.jpeg/revision/latest?cb=20141122215740" 	class="image image-thumbnail" 	 	 	><img src="data:image/gif;base64,R0lGODlhAQABAIABAAAAAP///yH5BAEAAAEALAAAAAABAAEAQAICTAEAOw%3D%3D" 	 alt="Harry potions sixth year 1 hi res"  	class="thumbimage lzy lzyPlcHld " 	 	data-image-key="Harry_potions_sixth_year_1_hi_res.jpeg" 	data-image-name="Harry potions sixth year 1 hi res.jpeg" 	 data-src="http://vignette2.wikia.nocookie.net/harrypotter/images/3/32/Harry_potions_sixth_year_1_hi_res.jpeg/revision/latest/scale-to-width/140?cb=20141122215740"  	 width="140"  	 height="207"  	 	 	 onload="if(typeof ImgLzy===&#39;object&#39;){ImgLzy.load(this)}"  	><noscript><img src="http://vignette2.wikia.nocookie.net/harrypotter/images/3/32/Harry_potions_sixth_year_1_hi_res.jpeg/revision/latest/scale-to-width/140?cb=20141122215740" 	 alt="Harry potions sixth year 1 hi res"  	class="thumbimage " 	 	data-image-key="Harry_potions_sixth_year_1_hi_res.jpeg" 	data-image-name="Harry potions sixth year 1 hi res.jpeg" 	 	 width="140"  	 height="207"  	 	 	 	></noscript></a>  	<figcaption> 		 			<a href="/wiki/File:Harry_potions_sixth_year_1_hi_res.jpeg" class="sprite info-icon"></a> 		 		 		 			<p class="caption">Harry brewing a <a href="/wiki/N.E.W.T." title="N.E.W.T." class="mw-redirect">N.E.W.T.</a>-level potion</p> 		 	</figcaption> </figure>
<ul><li><b><a href="/wiki/Potion" title="Potion">Potions</a></b>: Harry's Potions ability was apparently better than it appeared, as he was able to achieve an '<a href="/wiki/Exceeds_Expectations" title="Exceeds Expectations">Exceeds Expectations</a>' on his O.W.L. exam — proof of his proficiency in the subject. He was one of the only twelve students able to reach the required level to take <a href="/wiki/N.E.W.T." title="N.E.W.T." class="mw-redirect">N.E.W.T.</a> Potions.<sup id="cite_ref-HBP9_55-0" class="reference"><a href="#cite_note-HBP9-55">[56]</a></sup> He improved greatly during his sixth year when he came into possession of an <a href="/wiki/Half-Blood_Prince%27s_copy_of_Advanced_Potion-Making" title="Half-Blood Prince&#39;s copy of Advanced Potion-Making" class="mw-redirect">old potions textbook</a>, that had been revised by the Half-Blood Prince (<a href="/wiki/Severus_Snape" title="Severus Snape">Severus Snape</a>). However, the usage of this textbook was noted by both Hermione and Snape to be cheating, and when forced to hide it, Harry's potion skills suffered. It was revealed, though, that even without the Prince's book, Harry was still able to do a decent enough job at potion-making that <a href="/wiki/Horace_Slughorn" title="Horace Slughorn">Slughorn</a>'s suspicions were not raised. Apparently, Harry had no problems with potions at all as long as Snape was not around.<sup id="cite_ref-OotP29_44-1" class="reference"><a href="#cite_note-OotP29-44">[45]</a></sup><sup id="cite_ref-OotP31_46-1" class="reference"><a href="#cite_note-OotP31-46">[47]</a></sup>
</li></ul>
<div class="quote">
<dl><dd><span title="Source: Harry Potter and the Half-Blood Prince">"<i>I was pleased with your Transfiguration mark, Potter, very pleased.</i>"</span>
</dd><dd>&#8212;<a href="/wiki/Minerva_McGonagall" title="Minerva McGonagall">Professor McGonagall</a> regarding Harry's O.W.L. result<sup class="noprint"><a href="/wiki/Harry_Potter_and_the_Half-Blood_Prince" title="Harry Potter and the Half-Blood Prince">[src]</a></sup>
</dd><dd></div>
</dd></dl>
<ul><li><b><a href="/wiki/Transfiguration" title="Transfiguration">Transfiguration</a></b>: Harry achieved an 'Exceeds Expectations' on his O.W.L. exam, showing proficiency in the subject and advanced to <a href="/wiki/N.E.W.T." title="N.E.W.T." class="mw-redirect">N.E.W.T.</a>-level. He was able to perform <a href="/wiki/Conjuration" title="Conjuration">Conjuration</a>: an advanced type of Transfiguration, as demonstrated by his conjuring ropes and water in his sixth year.<sup id="cite_ref-HBP26_56-0" class="reference"><a href="#cite_note-HBP26-56">[57]</a></sup> He could also <a href="/wiki/Vanishing_Spell" title="Vanishing Spell">vanish</a> objects, which is one of the most complicated spells taught at <a href="/wiki/Ordinary_Wizarding_Level" title="Ordinary Wizarding Level">Ordinary Wizarding Level</a>. In <a href="/wiki/1995" title="1995">1995</a>, he vanished the whole of an iguana<sup id="cite_ref-OotP31_46-2" class="reference"><a href="#cite_note-OotP31-46">[47]</a></sup> and in 1997, a snake that crossed his path. He can also transform objects into other objects for example, he can cast the <a href="/wiki/Avifors_Spell" title="Avifors Spell">Avifors Spell</a><sup id="cite_ref-CSPS_57-0" class="reference"><a href="#cite_note-CSPS-57">[58]</a></sup>. He is also skilled enough to perform <a href="/wiki/Human_Transfiguration" title="Human Transfiguration">human Transfiguration</a>, which is noted to be "<i>immensely difficult</i>". He accomplished this during a 1996 Transfiguration lesson, where he succeeded in turning his eyebrow bright yellow.<sup id="cite_ref-HBP15_58-0" class="reference"><a href="#cite_note-HBP15-58">[59]</a></sup> Minerva McGonagall herself complimented Harry on his Transfiguration ability.<sup id="cite_ref-HBP9_55-1" class="reference"><a href="#cite_note-HBP9-55">[56]</a></sup>
</li></ul>
<figure class="article-thumb tright show-info-icon" style="width: 215px"> 	<a href="http://vignette3.wikia.nocookie.net/harrypotter/images/7/78/Harry_casting_the_Shield_Charm.jpg/revision/latest?cb=20141122215753" 	class="image image-thumbnail" 	 	 	><img src="data:image/gif;base64,R0lGODlhAQABAIABAAAAAP///yH5BAEAAAEALAAAAAABAAEAQAICTAEAOw%3D%3D" 	 alt="Harry casting the Shield Charm"  	class="thumbimage lzy lzyPlcHld " 	 	data-image-key="Harry_casting_the_Shield_Charm.jpg" 	data-image-name="Harry casting the Shield Charm.jpg" 	 data-src="http://vignette3.wikia.nocookie.net/harrypotter/images/7/78/Harry_casting_the_Shield_Charm.jpg/revision/latest/scale-to-width/215?cb=20141122215753"  	 width="215"  	 height="157"  	 	 	 onload="if(typeof ImgLzy===&#39;object&#39;){ImgLzy.load(this)}"  	><noscript><img src="http://vignette3.wikia.nocookie.net/harrypotter/images/7/78/Harry_casting_the_Shield_Charm.jpg/revision/latest/scale-to-width/215?cb=20141122215753" 	 alt="Harry casting the Shield Charm"  	class="thumbimage " 	 	data-image-key="Harry_casting_the_Shield_Charm.jpg" 	data-image-name="Harry casting the Shield Charm.jpg" 	 	 width="215"  	 height="157"  	 	 	 	></noscript></a>  	<figcaption> 		 			<a href="/wiki/File:Harry_casting_the_Shield_Charm.jpg" class="sprite info-icon"></a> 		 		 		 			<p class="caption">Harry casting the <a href="/wiki/Shield_Charm" title="Shield Charm">Shield Charm</a> during the <a href="/wiki/Battle_of_Hogwarts" title="Battle of Hogwarts">Battle of Hogwarts</a></p> 		 	</figcaption> </figure>
<ul><li><b><a href="/wiki/Charm" title="Charm">Charms</a></b>: Harry achieved an 'Exceeds Expectations' on his O.W.L. exam and advanced to <a href="/wiki/N.E.W.T." title="N.E.W.T." class="mw-redirect">N.E.W.T.</a>-level, and proved to be particularly talented in this subject. He frequently used the <a href="/wiki/Summoning_Charm" title="Summoning Charm">Summoning Charm</a> successfully, would occasionally cast the <a href="/wiki/Protective_enchantments" title="Protective enchantments">protective enchantments</a> that Hermione would use during the Horcrux hunt,<sup id="cite_ref-DH16_59-0" class="reference"><a href="#cite_note-DH16-59">[60]</a></sup><sup id="cite_ref-DH27_60-0" class="reference"><a href="#cite_note-DH27-60">[61]</a></sup> and was able to cast the <a href="/wiki/Confundus_Charm" title="Confundus Charm">Confundus Charm</a>.<sup id="cite_ref-DH26_50-1" class="reference"><a href="#cite_note-DH26-50">[51]</a></sup> He displayed an impressive mastery of the <a href="/wiki/Shield_Charm" title="Shield Charm">Shield Charm</a> surpassing that of many Ministry employees:<sup id="cite_ref-HBP6_61-0" class="reference"><a href="#cite_note-HBP6-61">[62]</a></sup> his Shield Charms were so powerful that they were able to deflect curses from Lord Voldemort himself.<sup id="cite_ref-DH36_37-2" class="reference"><a href="#cite_note-DH36-37">[38]</a></sup> During the <a href="/wiki/Battle_of_the_Seven_Potters" title="Battle of the Seven Potters">Battle of the Seven Potters</a>, he was able to levitate a side-car with himself in it, for a long stretch of time. He could also cast simplier charms such as the; <a href="/wiki/Wand-Lighting_Charm" title="Wand-Lighting Charm">Wand-Lighting Charm</a>, <a href="/wiki/Colour_Change_Charm" title="Colour Change Charm">Colour Change Charm</a>, <a href="/wiki/Banishing_Charm" title="Banishing Charm">Banishing Charm</a>, <a href="/wiki/Refilling_Charm" title="Refilling Charm">Refilling Charm</a>, and various others. Under the teaching of <a href="/wiki/Remus_Lupin" title="Remus Lupin">Remus Lupin</a>, Harry was able to conjure an extremely powerful corporeal <a href="/wiki/Patronus_Charm" title="Patronus Charm">Patronus</a> in his third year (in the form of a stag), which was a remarkable feat and yet another proof of his talent, given that many adult wizards were unable to cast the difficult charm successfully.<sup id="cite_ref-PM_18-2" class="reference"><a href="#cite_note-PM-18">[19]</a></sup>
</li></ul>
<div class="quote">
<dl><dd><span title="Source: Harry Potter and the Order of the Phoenix">"<i>Impressive. A true Patronus at that age... very impressive indeed.</i>"</span>
</dd><dd>&#8212;<a href="/wiki/Amelia_Bones" title="Amelia Bones">Madam Amelia Bones</a> to Harry Potter during his disciplinary hearing<sup class="noprint"><a href="/wiki/Harry_Potter_and_the_Order_of_the_Phoenix" title="Harry Potter and the Order of the Phoenix">[src]</a></sup>
</dd><dd></div>
</dd></dl>
<ul><li><b><a href="/wiki/Healing_magic" title="Healing magic">Healing magic</a></b>: Harry was able to effectively cast <a href="/wiki/Healing_spell" title="Healing spell">healing spells</a>. He fixed <a href="/wiki/Demelza_Robins" title="Demelza Robins">Demelza Robins</a>' broken lip in 1996 with a spell used to treat mild to moderate injuries.<sup id="cite_ref-HBP14_62-0" class="reference"><a href="#cite_note-HBP14-62">[63]</a></sup> He also used the healing spell for clearing up dried blood from a bleeding wound.<sup id="cite_ref-DH17_63-0" class="reference"><a href="#cite_note-DH17-63">[64]</a></sup>
</li><li><b><a href="/wiki/Apparition" title="Apparition">Apparition</a></b>: Harry had not earned a license to apparate, but he used the ability frequently during 1997 and 1998 to great success, even when forced to apparate with only a few seconds' notice or while guiding others.<sup id="cite_ref-DH_29-4" class="reference"><a href="#cite_note-DH-29">[30]</a></sup> He also used apparition in his sixth year to a very impressive degree to get himself and a weakened <a href="/wiki/Albus_Dumbledore" title="Albus Dumbledore">Albus Dumbledore</a> over an incredibly vast distance even though he was inexperienced.<sup id="cite_ref-HBP26_56-1" class="reference"><a href="#cite_note-HBP26-56">[57]</a></sup> Harry has stated and it is noted that he does not like the sensation however.
</li><li><b><a href="/wiki/Nonverbal_spell" title="Nonverbal spell">Non-verbal</a> and <a href="/wiki/Wandless_spell" title="Wandless spell">wandless magic</a></b>: In <a href="/wiki/1995" title="1995">1995</a>, when the <a href="/wiki/Dementor" title="Dementor">Dementors</a> attacked in Little Whinging, <a href="/wiki/Dudley_Dursley" title="Dudley Dursley">Dudley</a> had knocked <a href="/wiki/Harry_Potter%27s_wand" title="Harry Potter&#39;s wand">Harry's wand</a> out of his hand when he punched him moments before. In desperation, Harry calls out "<i><a href="/wiki/Wand-Lighting_Charm" title="Wand-Lighting Charm">Lumos</a></i>!" Although his wand was not in his hand, the wand tip lit up.<sup id="cite_ref-OotP1_64-0" class="reference"><a href="#cite_note-OotP1-64">[65]</a></sup> During <a href="/wiki/1997" title="1997">1997</a> and <a href="/wiki/1998" title="1998">1998</a>, Harry began using spells non-verbally and became quite proficient at it when Snape was not bothering him.<sup id="cite_ref-DH_29-5" class="reference"><a href="#cite_note-DH-29">[30]</a></sup> He used both non-verbal and wandless magic in <a href="/wiki/1991" title="1991">1991</a>, when he caused the glass window of a snake's cage at the zoo to vanish, and again in <a href="/wiki/1993" title="1993">1993</a>, when he inflated <a href="/wiki/Marge_Dursley" title="Marge Dursley" class="mw-redirect">Marge Dursley</a>, although both of these occurrences were accidents fuelled by pure anger. Few other wizards have exhibited this power, although <a href="/wiki/Albus_Dumbledore" title="Albus Dumbledore">Dumbledore</a> and <a href="/wiki/Tom_Riddle" title="Tom Riddle">Voldemort</a> were among them. This further testifies to Harry's skill, as only some of the most powerful wizards of his time were able to do so.
</li></ul>
<div class="quote">
<dl><dd><span title="Source: Harry Potter and the Prisoner of Azkaban">"<i>she was inflating like a monstrous balloon, her stomach bursting free of her of her tweet waistband, each of her fingers blowing up like salami —</i>"</span>
</dd><dd>&#8212;Harry loses control of his magic in <a href="/wiki/1993" title="1993">1993</a><sup class="noprint"><a href="/wiki/Harry_Potter_and_the_Prisoner_of_Azkaban" title="Harry Potter and the Prisoner of Azkaban">[src]</a></sup>
</dd><dd></div>
</dd></dl>
<figure class="article-thumb tleft show-info-icon" style="width: 235px"> 	<a href="http://vignette2.wikia.nocookie.net/harrypotter/images/3/3b/Harry_Potter_Buckbeak.jpg/revision/latest?cb=20141122215913" 	class="image image-thumbnail" 	 	 	><img src="data:image/gif;base64,R0lGODlhAQABAIABAAAAAP///yH5BAEAAAEALAAAAAABAAEAQAICTAEAOw%3D%3D" 	 alt="Harry Potter Buckbeak"  	class="thumbimage lzy lzyPlcHld " 	 	data-image-key="Harry_Potter_Buckbeak.jpg" 	data-image-name="Harry Potter Buckbeak.jpg" 	 data-src="http://vignette2.wikia.nocookie.net/harrypotter/images/3/3b/Harry_Potter_Buckbeak.jpg/revision/latest/scale-to-width/235?cb=20141122215913"  	 width="235"  	 height="119"  	 	 	 onload="if(typeof ImgLzy===&#39;object&#39;){ImgLzy.load(this)}"  	><noscript><img src="http://vignette2.wikia.nocookie.net/harrypotter/images/3/3b/Harry_Potter_Buckbeak.jpg/revision/latest/scale-to-width/235?cb=20141122215913" 	 alt="Harry Potter Buckbeak"  	class="thumbimage " 	 	data-image-key="Harry_Potter_Buckbeak.jpg" 	data-image-name="Harry Potter Buckbeak.jpg" 	 	 width="235"  	 height="119"  	 	 	 	></noscript></a>  	<figcaption> 		 			<a href="/wiki/File:Harry_Potter_Buckbeak.jpg" class="sprite info-icon"></a> 		 		 		 			<p class="caption">Harry and <a href="/wiki/Buckbeak" title="Buckbeak">Buckbeak</a>, first lesson of Care of Magical Creatures</p> 		 	</figcaption> </figure>
<ul><li><b><a href="/wiki/Care_of_Magical_Creatures" title="Care of Magical Creatures">Care of Magical Creatures</a></b>: Harry achieved an 'Exceeds Expectations' on his <a href="/wiki/Ordinary_Wizarding_Level" title="Ordinary Wizarding Level">O.W.L.</a> exam, he has shown on more than one occasion to have good skill in handling numerous sorts of magical creatures. For example, he was the first in his class to tame a <a href="/wiki/Hippogriff" title="Hippogriff">Hippogriff</a>, which he did very excellently.<sup id="cite_ref-PoA6_65-0" class="reference"><a href="#cite_note-PoA6-65">[66]</a></sup> He befriended the hippogriff, <a href="/wiki/Buckbeak" title="Buckbeak">Buckbeak</a>, to the extent that Buckbeak defended him when he was in danger. He has also shown on three occasions that he is quite competent at dealing with <a href="/wiki/Dragon" title="Dragon">dragons</a>. This is shown when he was able to help <a href="/wiki/Rubeus_Hagrid" title="Rubeus Hagrid">Hagrid</a> take care of baby <a href="/wiki/Norbert" title="Norbert" class="mw-redirect">Norbert</a> the dragon, outsmart the <a href="/wiki/Hungarian_Horntail" title="Hungarian Horntail">Hungarian Horntail</a> in the <a href="/wiki/Triwizard_Tournament" title="Triwizard Tournament">Triwizard Tournament</a>, and tame a half-blind dragon into helping the Trio escape <a href="/wiki/Gringotts_Wizarding_Bank" title="Gringotts Wizarding Bank">Gringotts</a> by flying out on its back. He was also one of very few in his class who was able to see <a href="/wiki/Thestral" title="Thestral">Thestrals</a>, and had no trouble mounting his in June 1996. Harry was also good with <a href="/wiki/House-elf" title="House-elf">House-elves</a>, befriending the house-elf <a href="/wiki/Dobby" title="Dobby">Dobby</a> and eventually freeing him, which made the little elf so loyal to him that he gave his life to save him.<sup id="cite_ref-DH24_41-1" class="reference"><a href="#cite_note-DH24-41">[42]</a></sup> He also earned the respect and loyalty of <a href="/wiki/Kreacher" title="Kreacher">Kreacher</a>, a very difficult task.
</li><li><b><a href="/wiki/Herbology" title="Herbology">Herbology</a></b>: Harry attended <a href="/wiki/N.E.W.T." title="N.E.W.T." class="mw-redirect">N.E.W.T.</a> Herbology classes. He achieved an 'Exceeds Expectations' on his O.W.L. exam, showing aptitude in the subject. In 1998 Harry was able to recognise a <a href="/wiki/Snargaluff" title="Snargaluff">Snargaluff</a> plant at the <a href="/wiki/Lovegood_House" title="Lovegood House" class="mw-redirect">Lovegood House</a> and knew to gave it a wide berth of space.<sup id="cite_ref-DH20_66-0" class="reference"><a href="#cite_note-DH20-66">[67]</a></sup> He also had knowledge of plants such as: <a href="/wiki/Devil%27s_Snare" title="Devil&#39;s Snare">Devil's Snare</a>, <a href="/wiki/Gillyweed" title="Gillyweed">Gillyweed</a>, <a href="/wiki/Venomous_Tentacula" title="Venomous Tentacula">Venomous Tentacula</a>, and <a href="/wiki/Fanged_Geranium" title="Fanged Geranium">Fanged Geranium</a> from hands on experience. He could cast plant-related spells such as the <a href="/wiki/Fire-Making_Spell" title="Fire-Making Spell">Fire-Making Spell</a><sup id="cite_ref-PSvg_67-0" class="reference"><a href="#cite_note-PSvg-67">[68]</a></sup> and<a href="/wiki/Herbivicus_Charm" title="Herbivicus Charm"> Herbivicus Charm.</a>
</li><li><b><a href="/wiki/Astronomy" title="Astronomy">Astronomy</a></b>: Though not excellent at Astronomy, Harry was able to pass his O.W.L. exam with an '<a href="/wiki/Acceptable" title="Acceptable">Acceptable</a>'. It is not known if he was able to advance to the N.E.W.T class or not, seeing as he did not apply for advancement.
</li><li><b><a href="/wiki/Wandlore" title="Wandlore">Wand versatility</a></b>:<b> </b>Harry was able to use <a href="/wiki/Hermione_Granger%27s_First_Wand" title="Hermione Granger&#39;s First Wand" class="mw-redirect">Hermione's wand</a> after his was broken during the <a href="/wiki/Attack_at_Godric%27s_Hollow_(1997)" title="Attack at Godric&#39;s Hollow (1997)">Attack at Godric's Hollow</a> in 1997. He was able to use spells such as: the <a href="/wiki/Wand-Lighting_Charm" title="Wand-Lighting Charm">Wand-Lighting Charm</a>, the <a href="/wiki/Shield_Charm" title="Shield Charm">Shield Charm</a>, and the <a href="/wiki/Severing_Charm" title="Severing Charm">Severing Charm</a> at full strength, despite not having won the wand's allegiance.<sup id="cite_ref-DH19_68-0" class="reference"><a href="#cite_note-DH19-68">[69]</a></sup> He also gained the allegiance of <a href="/wiki/Draco_Malfoy%27s_wand" title="Draco Malfoy&#39;s wand">Draco Malfoy's wand</a>, the <a href="/wiki/Elder_Wand" title="Elder Wand">Elder Wand</a>, and quite possibly <a href="/wiki/Tom_Riddle%27s_wand" title="Tom Riddle&#39;s wand">Voldemort's wand</a> by defeating the previous masters.
</li><li><b>Expert detective skills</b>: Harry, along with Ron and Hermione, was also a formidably talented investigator. While in school, the trio had a knack for solving difficult mysteries and discovering the truth despite all attempts by others to conceal it, with Hermione generally finding the background information while Harry put the pieces together to make a coherent picture. In his first year, Harry uncovered the truth about the <a href="/wiki/Philosopher%27s_Stone" title="Philosopher&#39;s Stone">Philosopher's Stone</a> and saved it from Voldemort. Over the next six years, he would solve the mystery of the <a href="/wiki/Chamber_of_Secrets" title="Chamber of Secrets">Chamber of Secrets</a>,<sup id="cite_ref-CoS15_69-0" class="reference"><a href="#cite_note-CoS15-69">[70]</a></sup> find the truth about the <a href="/wiki/Prophecy" title="Prophecy">Prophecy</a>, and hunt down and destroy all of Voldemort's Horcruxes using his amazing deductive skills. Harry's deductive skills also allowed him to uncover the mystery of the <a href="/wiki/Deathly_Hallows" title="Deathly Hallows">Deathly Hallows</a><sup id="cite_ref-DH22_30-2" class="reference"><a href="#cite_note-DH22-30">[31]</a></sup> and learn that he mastered the three of them. Harry also had a knack for spotting things that others did not, and had a sharp eye for details, as he was able to tell that Luna Lovegood had not been home in weeks by the state of her room,<sup id="cite_ref-DH21_70-0" class="reference"><a href="#cite_note-DH21-70">[71]</a></sup> and he became suspicious when Dobby revealed that he had known that Harry was not getting any letters in <a href="/wiki/1992" title="1992">1992</a>. His intelligence allowed him to intuitively know that <a href="/wiki/Draco_Malfoy" title="Draco Malfoy">Draco Malfoy</a> had been branded with the Dark Mark despite no solid proof, that Malfoy was using the <a href="/wiki/Room_of_Requirement" title="Room of Requirement">Room of Requirement</a> as a work shop, and that he was having <a href="/wiki/Vincent_Crabbe" title="Vincent Crabbe">Crabbe</a> and <a href="/wiki/Gregory_Goyle" title="Gregory Goyle">Goyle</a> use <a href="/wiki/Polyjuice_Potion" title="Polyjuice Potion">Polyjuice Potion</a> in order to disguise themselves as girls while keeping watch outside the room.<sup id="cite_ref-HBP21_71-0" class="reference"><a href="#cite_note-HBP21-71">[72]</a></sup>
</li></ul>
<div class="quote">
<dl><dd><span title="Source: Harry Potter and the Half-Blood Prince">"<i>And you feel that you have exerted your very best efforts in this matter, do you? That you have exercised all of your considerable ingenuity? </i>"</span>
</dd><dd>&#8212;<a href="/wiki/Albus_Dumbledore" title="Albus Dumbledore">Albus Dumbledore</a> to Harry during a private lesson<sup class="noprint"><a href="/wiki/Harry_Potter_and_the_Half-Blood_Prince" title="Harry Potter and the Half-Blood Prince">[src]</a></sup>
</dd><dd></div>
</dd></dl>
<ul><li><b>Resourcefulness</b>: Harry showed resourcefulness in many different situations. In his first year, Harry impersonated the Bloody Baron, warning <a href="/wiki/Peeves" title="Peeves">Peeves</a> to stay away from the third floor that night so he wouldn't inconvenience the trio on their quest to save the <a href="/wiki/Philosopher%27s_Stone" title="Philosopher&#39;s Stone">Philosopher's Stone</a>.<sup id="cite_ref-PS16_72-0" class="reference"><a href="#cite_note-PS16-72">[73]</a></sup> In his second year, when encountering Professor McGonagall on his and Ron's way to <a href="/wiki/First_floor_girls%27_lavatory" title="First floor girls&#39; lavatory">Moaning Myrtle's Bathroom</a>, he lied and said that that they were on their way to see Hermione in the Hospital wing<sup id="cite_ref-CoS16_73-0" class="reference"><a href="#cite_note-CoS16-73">[74]</a></sup> also in his second year, he used a <a href="/wiki/Basilisk" title="Basilisk">Basilisk</a> fang to destroy <a href="/wiki/Tom_Riddle%27s_Diary" title="Tom Riddle&#39;s Diary" class="mw-redirect">Tom Riddle's Diary</a>.<sup id="cite_ref-CoS17_74-0" class="reference"><a href="#cite_note-CoS17-74">[75]</a></sup> In his fifth year, while under interrogation from <a href="/wiki/Dolores_Umbridge" title="Dolores Umbridge">Umbridge</a>, he relayed a coded message to <a href="/wiki/Severus_Snape" title="Severus Snape">Snape</a> in an attempt to warn him and by extension the Order, that Voldemort had Sirius. In the same year, while surrounded by <a href="/wiki/Death_Eaters" title="Death Eaters">Death Eaters</a> Harry came up with the plan to smash the shelves in the <a href="/wiki/Hall_of_Prophecy" title="Hall of Prophecy">Hall of Prophecy</a> as a distraction so that he and the <a href="/wiki/Dumbledore%27s_Army" title="Dumbledore&#39;s Army">D.A.</a> could try and escape. During the hunt for <a href="/wiki/Horcrux" title="Horcrux">Horcruxes</a>, he used the <a href="/wiki/Sword_of_Gryffindor" title="Sword of Gryffindor">Sword of Gryffindor</a> as a way of retrieving <a href="/wiki/Helga_Hufflepuff%27s_cup" title="Helga Hufflepuff&#39;s cup">Helga Hufflepuff's cup</a> from the mounds of burning treasure and used the half-blind Dragon as a means to escape from <a href="/wiki/Gringotts_Wizarding_Bank" title="Gringotts Wizarding Bank">Gringotts Wizarding Bank</a>.<sup id="cite_ref-DH26_50-2" class="reference"><a href="#cite_note-DH26-50">[51]</a></sup>
</li></ul>
<div class="quote">
<dl><dd><span title="Source: Harry Potter and the Deathly Hallows">"<i>It is a curious thing, Harry, but perhaps those who are best suited to power are those who have never sought it. Those who, like you, have leadership thrust upon them, and take up the mantle because they must, and find to their own surprise that they wear it well.</i>"</span>
</dd><dd>&#8212;<a href="/wiki/Albus_Dumbledore" title="Albus Dumbledore">Albus Dumbledore</a> to Harry Potter<sup class="noprint"><a href="/wiki/Harry_Potter_and_the_Deathly_Hallows" title="Harry Potter and the Deathly Hallows">[src]</a></sup>
</dd><dd></div>
</dd></dl>
<figure class="article-thumb tright show-info-icon" style="width: 230px"> 	<a href="http://vignette2.wikia.nocookie.net/harrypotter/images/9/96/Dumbledore%27s_Army.jpg/revision/latest?cb=20141122215921" 	class="image image-thumbnail" 	 	 	><img src="data:image/gif;base64,R0lGODlhAQABAIABAAAAAP///yH5BAEAAAEALAAAAAABAAEAQAICTAEAOw%3D%3D" 	 alt="Dumbledore&#39;s Army"  	class="thumbimage lzy lzyPlcHld " 	 	data-image-key="Dumbledore%27s_Army.jpg" 	data-image-name="Dumbledore&#39;s Army.jpg" 	 data-src="http://vignette2.wikia.nocookie.net/harrypotter/images/9/96/Dumbledore%27s_Army.jpg/revision/latest/scale-to-width/230?cb=20141122215921"  	 width="230"  	 height="153"  	 	 	 onload="if(typeof ImgLzy===&#39;object&#39;){ImgLzy.load(this)}"  	><noscript><img src="http://vignette2.wikia.nocookie.net/harrypotter/images/9/96/Dumbledore%27s_Army.jpg/revision/latest/scale-to-width/230?cb=20141122215921" 	 alt="Dumbledore&#39;s Army"  	class="thumbimage " 	 	data-image-key="Dumbledore%27s_Army.jpg" 	data-image-name="Dumbledore&#39;s Army.jpg" 	 	 width="230"  	 height="153"  	 	 	 	></noscript></a>  	<figcaption> 		 			<a href="/wiki/File:Dumbledore%27s_Army.jpg" class="sprite info-icon"></a> 		 		 		 			<p class="caption">Harry leader and teacher of <a href="/wiki/Dumbledore%27s_Army" title="Dumbledore&#39;s Army">Dumbledore's Army</a></p> 		 	</figcaption> </figure>
<ul><li><b>Leadership skills</b>: While Harry never deliberately set out to be a leader to others, he had often taken charge when the situation required it, beginning with his impulsive decision to find and warn Hermione about the presence of a <a href="/wiki/Troll" title="Troll">troll</a> in the school during the 1991 <a href="/wiki/Hallowe%27en_feast" title="Hallowe&#39;en feast" class="mw-redirect">Hallowe'en feast</a> and progressing to the point where over thirty students, some of them in their sixth and seventh years — respect him as a teacher in <a href="/wiki/Dumbledore%27s_Army" title="Dumbledore&#39;s Army">Dumbledore's Army </a> despite his being younger than they were.<sup id="cite_ref-OotP18_75-0" class="reference"><a href="#cite_note-OotP18-75">[76]</a></sup> Dumbledore later noted that Harry was a superior leader to him as Dumbledore had deliberately sought power in his youth and subsequently avoided anything more demanding than his role as Hogwarts headmaster — while Harry had leadership thrust upon him and accepted the burden, acknowledging his responsibilities towards those who "followed" him regardless of how uncomfortable he might feel about the prospect and coordinating his efforts against his enemies well, when left with no other option but to take control.<sup id="cite_ref-DH35_76-0" class="reference"><a href="#cite_note-DH35-76">[77]</a></sup>
</li><li><b>Indomitable will</b>: Harry appears to possess an unbreakable spirit and, though not above depression, he has never truly given up on any mission. He's been shown to rise from defeat and loss, such as the deaths of many loved ones, even stronger than before. His indomitable will is exemplified by his ability to resist the <a href="/wiki/Imperius_Curse" title="Imperius Curse">Imperius Curse</a>, and also by the fact that he had never begged for mercy even in life-and-death situations, but fought back in defiance, as well as perform <a href="/wiki/Nonverbal_spell" title="Nonverbal spell">non-verbal spells</a> flawlessly.<sup id="cite_ref-DH_29-6" class="reference"><a href="#cite_note-DH-29">[30]</a></sup> His inability to perform <a href="/wiki/Occlumency" title="Occlumency">Occlumency</a>, despite possessing the required willpower, is due to his inability to keep his emotions under control at times, and only once, during his lessons with Snape, did he managed to slightly escape <a href="/wiki/Legilimency" title="Legilimency">Legilimency</a>, but faltered again in the subsequent attempt.
</li></ul>
<div class="quote">
<dl><dd><span title="Source: Harry Potter and the Order of the Phoenix">"<i>You're a r-really good teacher, you know. I've never been able to Stun anything before.</i>"</span>
</dd><dd>&#8212;Cho Chang regarding Harry's teaching ability<sup class="noprint"><a href="/wiki/Harry_Potter_and_the_Order_of_the_Phoenix" title="Harry Potter and the Order of the Phoenix">[src]</a></sup>
</dd><dd></div>
</dd></dl>
<ul><li><b>Teaching skills</b>: Harry has shown tremendous skill in teaching others. Having mastered many spells at a young age, Harry successfully passed them onto others even when he was still a student himself, giving proper instructions and corrections on how to perform many fields of magic, ranging from the relatively simplistic <a href="/wiki/Disarming_Charm" title="Disarming Charm">Disarming Charm</a> to the highly advanced <a href="/wiki/Patronus_Charm" title="Patronus Charm">Patronus Charm</a>.<sup id="cite_ref-OotP_48-1" class="reference"><a href="#cite_note-OotP-48">[49]</a></sup> Harry's effectiveness as a teacher led many, some even older than him, to choose him over a Ministry-installed professional, and he even returned to Hogwarts to give occasional lectures.
</li></ul>
<h2><span class="mw-headline" id="Possessions">Possessions</span></h2>
<div class="quote">
<dl><dd><span title="Source: Harry Potter and the Half-Blood Prince">"<i>He's been left a house?</i>"</span>
</dd><dd>&#8212;<a href="/wiki/Vernon_Dursley" title="Vernon Dursley">Vernon Dursley</a><sup class="noprint"><a href="/wiki/Harry_Potter_and_the_Half-Blood_Prince" title="Harry Potter and the Half-Blood Prince">[src]</a></sup>
</dd><dd></div>
</dd></dl>
<ul><li><b><a href="/wiki/Potter_family" title="Potter family">Potter</a> Inheritance</b>: When Harry's parents were murdered by <a href="/wiki/Tom_Riddle" title="Tom Riddle">Lord Voldemort</a>, they left behind a small fortune in <a href="/wiki/Vault_687" title="Vault 687">Vault 687</a> of <a href="/wiki/Gringotts_Wizarding_Bank" title="Gringotts Wizarding Bank">Gringotts Wizarding Bank</a>. This inheritance became Harry's source of funding for all his <a href="/wiki/Hogwarts_School_of_Witchcraft_and_Wizardry" title="Hogwarts School of Witchcraft and Wizardry">Hogwarts</a> textbooks, wizarding clothes, etc.<br style="clear: right;" />
</li></ul>
<figure class="article-thumb tright show-info-icon" style="width: 205px"> 	<a href="http://vignette3.wikia.nocookie.net/harrypotter/images/f/f6/250px-Harrypotterwand.jpg/revision/latest?cb=20141122215927" 	class="image image-thumbnail" 	 	 	><img src="data:image/gif;base64,R0lGODlhAQABAIABAAAAAP///yH5BAEAAAEALAAAAAABAAEAQAICTAEAOw%3D%3D" 	 alt="250px-Harrypotterwand"  	class="thumbimage lzy lzyPlcHld " 	 	data-image-key="250px-Harrypotterwand.jpg" 	data-image-name="250px-Harrypotterwand.jpg" 	 data-src="http://vignette3.wikia.nocookie.net/harrypotter/images/f/f6/250px-Harrypotterwand.jpg/revision/latest/scale-to-width/205?cb=20141122215927"  	 width="205"  	 height="62"  	 	 	 onload="if(typeof ImgLzy===&#39;object&#39;){ImgLzy.load(this)}"  	><noscript><img src="http://vignette3.wikia.nocookie.net/harrypotter/images/f/f6/250px-Harrypotterwand.jpg/revision/latest/scale-to-width/205?cb=20141122215927" 	 alt="250px-Harrypotterwand"  	class="thumbimage " 	 	data-image-key="250px-Harrypotterwand.jpg" 	data-image-name="250px-Harrypotterwand.jpg" 	 	 width="205"  	 height="62"  	 	 	 	></noscript></a>  	<figcaption> 		 			<a href="/wiki/File:250px-Harrypotterwand.jpg" class="sprite info-icon"></a> 		 		 		 			<p class="caption">Harry's first wand</p> 		 	</figcaption> </figure>
<ul><li><b><a href="/wiki/Harry_Potter%27s_wand" title="Harry Potter&#39;s wand">Wand</a></b>: As is the case with most <a href="/wiki/Wizards" title="Wizards" class="mw-redirect">wizards and witches</a>, Harry's <a href="/wiki/Wand" title="Wand">wand</a> is among his most valued <a href="/wiki/Magic" title="Magic">magical</a> possessions. His wand is made of <a href="/wiki/Holly" title="Holly">Holly</a>, a <a href="/wiki/Wand_wood" title="Wand wood">wood</a> with the powers to repel evil.<sup id="cite_ref-77" class="reference"><a href="#cite_note-77">[78]</a></sup> The <a href="/wiki/Wand" title="Wand">wand</a> is in deliberate contrast to the <a href="/wiki/Tom_Riddle%27s_wand" title="Tom Riddle&#39;s wand">wand</a> of <a href="/wiki/Tom_Riddle" title="Tom Riddle">Lord Voldemort</a>, which is <a href="/wiki/Yew" title="Yew">Yew</a>: a wood with the powers of evil. Harry's wand shared a twin core with Voldemort's wand, as both contained <a href="/wiki/Phoenix_feather" title="Phoenix feather">phoenix feathers</a> from the same phoenix, <a href="/wiki/Fawkes" title="Fawkes">Fawkes</a>. Harry's wand broke in <a href="/wiki/1997" title="1997">1997</a> during a <a href="/wiki/Attack_at_Godric%27s_Hollow_(1997)" title="Attack at Godric&#39;s Hollow (1997)">skirmish</a> with <a href="/wiki/Nagini" title="Nagini">Nagini</a> in <a href="/wiki/Bathilda_Bagshot" title="Bathilda Bagshot">Bathilda Bagshot</a>'s house due to a stray spell cast by <a href="/wiki/Hermione_Granger" title="Hermione Granger">Hermione Granger</a>. Later he used the <a href="/wiki/Elder_Wand" title="Elder Wand">Elder Wand</a> to repair it.<br style="clear: right;" />
</li><li><b><a href="/wiki/Draco_Malfoy%27s_wand" title="Draco Malfoy&#39;s wand">Draco Malfoy's wand</a></b>: In <a href="/wiki/1998" title="1998">1998</a> Harry won the <a href="/wiki/Hawthorn" title="Hawthorn">hawthorn</a> wand's allegiance after overpowering Draco Malfoy during the <a href="/wiki/Skirmish_at_Malfoy_Manor" title="Skirmish at Malfoy Manor">Skirmish at Malfoy Manor</a>. This wand was carried by him for the remainder of the <a href="/wiki/Second_Wizarding_War" title="Second Wizarding War">Second Wizarding War</a>; seeing action in the <a href="/wiki/1998_Break-In_of_Gringotts_Wizarding_Bank" title="1998 Break-In of Gringotts Wizarding Bank" class="mw-redirect">break-in at Gringotts</a>, as well as during the final climactic <a href="/wiki/Battle_of_Hogwarts" title="Battle of Hogwarts">Battle of Hogwarts</a>. It is unknown what happened to the wand after Harry repaired his <a href="/wiki/Harry_Potter%27s_wand" title="Harry Potter&#39;s wand">phoenix feather wand</a>.
</li><li><b><a href="/wiki/Harry_Potter%27s_photo_album" title="Harry Potter&#39;s photo album">Photo album</a></b>: In June of <a href="/wiki/1992" title="1992">1992</a> <a href="/wiki/Rubeus_Hagrid" title="Rubeus Hagrid">Hagrid</a> gave this album as a gift to Harry. The album contained pictures of his parents, <a href="/wiki/Ronald_Weasley" title="Ronald Weasley">Ron</a>, <a href="/wiki/Hermione_Granger" title="Hermione Granger">Hermione</a>, and himself.
</li></ul>
<figure class="article-thumb tleft show-info-icon" style="width: 125px"> 	<a href="http://vignette4.wikia.nocookie.net/harrypotter/images/a/a3/Marauder%27sMap.png/revision/latest?cb=20120312201158" 	class="image image-thumbnail" 	 	 	><img src="data:image/gif;base64,R0lGODlhAQABAIABAAAAAP///yH5BAEAAAEALAAAAAABAAEAQAICTAEAOw%3D%3D" 	 alt="Marauder&#39;sMap"  	class="thumbimage lzy lzyPlcHld " 	 	data-image-key="Marauder%27sMap.png" 	data-image-name="Marauder&#39;sMap.png" 	 data-src="http://vignette4.wikia.nocookie.net/harrypotter/images/a/a3/Marauder%27sMap.png/revision/latest/scale-to-width/125?cb=20120312201158"  	 width="125"  	 height="234"  	 	 	 onload="if(typeof ImgLzy===&#39;object&#39;){ImgLzy.load(this)}"  	><noscript><img src="http://vignette4.wikia.nocookie.net/harrypotter/images/a/a3/Marauder%27sMap.png/revision/latest/scale-to-width/125?cb=20120312201158" 	 alt="Marauder&#39;sMap"  	class="thumbimage " 	 	data-image-key="Marauder%27sMap.png" 	data-image-name="Marauder&#39;sMap.png" 	 	 width="125"  	 height="234"  	 	 	 	></noscript></a>  	<figcaption> 		 			<a href="/wiki/File:Marauder%27sMap.png" class="sprite info-icon"></a> 		 		 		 			<p class="caption">The Marauder's Map</p> 		 	</figcaption> </figure>
<ul><li><b><a href="/wiki/Marauder%27s_Map" title="Marauder&#39;s Map">Marauder's Map</a></b>: One of Harry's most treasured possessions. In his third year, <a href="/wiki/Fred_Weasley" title="Fred Weasley">Fred Weasley</a> and <a href="/wiki/George_Weasley" title="George Weasley">George Weasley</a> gave it to Harry while he was trying to sneak into <a href="/wiki/Hogsmeade" title="Hogsmeade">Hogsmeade</a>. It was confiscated by <a href="/wiki/Remus_Lupin" title="Remus Lupin">Remus Lupin</a>, but later returned when Lupin quit his job. Harry kept it with him for a long period of time, keeping it in the <a href="/wiki/Mokeskin" title="Mokeskin">Mokeskin</a> wallet he had gotten from Hagrid, until it was finally stolen from his desk by his son, James.<br style="clear: right;" />
</li><li><b><a href="/wiki/Cloak_of_Invisibility" title="Cloak of Invisibility">Cloak of Invisibility</a></b>: Another valued and useful possession is Harry's Cloak of Invisibility. In his first year at <a href="/wiki/Hogwarts_School_of_Witchcraft_and_Wizardry" title="Hogwarts School of Witchcraft and Wizardry">Hogwarts School of Witchcraft and Wizardry</a>, he received it as an anonymous Christmas gift. He later learned the gift came from <a href="/wiki/Albus_Dumbledore" title="Albus Dumbledore">Albus Dumbledore</a>, who obtained it in turn from Harry's father, <a href="/wiki/James_Potter_I" title="James Potter I">James Potter</a>. It was later revealed to be a <a href="/wiki/Potter_family" title="Potter family">family</a> heirloom as well as one of the three <a href="/wiki/Deathly_Hallows" title="Deathly Hallows">Deathly Hallows</a>. From this Harry realises he is a direct descendant of Ignotus Peverell, one of the three brothers who created the Deathly Hallows. It is yet to be decided whether he would give the cloak to his oldest son, James Sirius, his youngest son, Albus Severus, or his daughter Lily Luna.<br style="clear: right;" />
</li><li><b><a href="/wiki/Hedwig" title="Hedwig">Hedwig</a></b>: Harry's animal companion, Hedwig was vitally helpful in delivering messages and packages for Harry, especially while Sirius was in hiding from the <a href="/wiki/British_Ministry_of_Magic" title="British Ministry of Magic">Ministry</a>.
