<div class="quote">
<dl><dd><span title="Source: Harry Potter and the Half-Blood Prince">"<i>Harry felt as though his body was generating waves of hatred so powerful that it seemed incredible that Snape could not feel them burning him.</i>"</span>
</dd><dd>&#8212;Harry Potter in <a href="/wiki/1996" title="1996">1996</a><sup class="noprint"><a href="/wiki/Harry_Potter_and_the_Half-Blood_Prince" title="Harry Potter and the Half-Blood Prince">[src]</a></sup>
</dd><dd></div>
</dd></dl>
<p>After Sirius was <a href="/wiki/Battle_of_the_Department_of_Mysteries" title="Battle of the Department of Mysteries">murdered</a> during <a href="/wiki/1996" title="1996">1996</a> in the <a href="/wiki/Department_of_Mysteries" title="Department of Mysteries">Department of Mysteries</a> by <a href="/wiki/Bellatrix_Lestrange" title="Bellatrix Lestrange">Bellatrix Lestrange</a>, Harry took savage pleasure in blaming Snape for his death. He believed that Snape's taunt to Sirius about his uselessness to the <a href="/wiki/Order_of_the_Phoenix" title="Order of the Phoenix">Order of the Phoenix</a> was one of the main factors which caused Sirius to leave his house and fight. Harry's hatred of Snape reached its height in <a href="/wiki/1997" title="1997">1997</a> when he discovered that Snape had told Voldemort about <a href="/wiki/Sybill_Trelawney%27s_first_prophecy" title="Sybill Trelawney&#39;s first prophecy">the Prophecy</a> involving him, which led Harry to believe that Snape had betrayed his parents. Harry raged at <a href="/wiki/Albus_Dumbledore" title="Albus Dumbledore">Albus Dumbledore</a> for trusting Snape, only to have Dumbledore silence him. Later the same night, Snape <a href="/wiki/Battle_of_the_Astronomy_Tower" title="Battle of the Astronomy Tower">killed</a> Dumbledore, which only seemed to confirm what Harry had come to believe about his former Potions master, resenting Snape almost as much as he resented Voldemort himself.
</p>
<figure class="article-thumb tleft show-info-icon" style="width: 245px"> 	<a href="http://vignette2.wikia.nocookie.net/harrypotter/images/1/1c/Snape%26harry.gif/revision/latest?cb=20141009143617" 	class="image image-thumbnail" 	 	 	><img src="data:image/gif;base64,R0lGODlhAQABAIABAAAAAP///yH5BAEAAAEALAAAAAABAAEAQAICTAEAOw%3D%3D" 	 alt="Snape&amp;harry"  	class="thumbimage lzy lzyPlcHld " 	 	data-image-key="Snape%26harry.gif" 	data-image-name="Snape&amp;amp;harry.gif" 	 data-src="http://vignette2.wikia.nocookie.net/harrypotter/images/1/1c/Snape%26harry.gif/revision/latest?cb=20141009143617"  	 width="245"  	 height="120"  	 	 	 onload="if(typeof ImgLzy===&#39;object&#39;){ImgLzy.load(this)}"  	><noscript><img src="http://vignette2.wikia.nocookie.net/harrypotter/images/1/1c/Snape%26harry.gif/revision/latest?cb=20141009143617" 	 alt="Snape&amp;harry"  	class="thumbimage " 	 	data-image-key="Snape%26harry.gif" 	data-image-name="Snape&amp;amp;harry.gif" 	 	 width="245"  	 height="120"  	 	 	 	></noscript></a>  	<figcaption> 		 			<a href="/wiki/File:Snape%26harry.gif" class="sprite info-icon"></a> 		 		 		 			<p class="caption">Snape threatens Harry in <a href="/wiki/1996" title="1996">1996</a> after an <a href="/wiki/Occlumency" title="Occlumency">Occlumency</a> lesson</p> 		 	</figcaption> </figure>
<p>In <a href="/wiki/1998" title="1998">1998</a>, Harry witnessed Voldemort order the death of Severus Snape, in an attempt to gain the allegiance of the <a href="/wiki/Elder_Wand" title="Elder Wand">Elder Wand</a>. Despite his hatred of his former teacher, he still felt sorry for the way Voldemort had killed Snape without even feeling sorry for taking his life. As Voldemort left Snape mortally wounded by <a href="/wiki/Nagini" title="Nagini">Nagini</a> in the <a href="/wiki/Shrieking_Shack" title="Shrieking Shack">Shrieking Shack</a>, Harry was able to obtain several <a href="/wiki/Pensieve" title="Pensieve">memories</a> that contained not only the truth about Snape's motives and unwavering allegiance to the <a href="/wiki/Order_of_the_Phoenix" title="Order of the Phoenix">Order of the Phoenix</a>, but relayed a crucial message from Dumbledore. What Harry discovered about Snape's persistent love for Lily Evans also explained Snape's final act: he had instructed Harry to look at him, so he could die looking into the eyes Harry inherited from his mother.
</p><p>By <a href="/wiki/2017" title="2017">2017</a>, Harry considered Snape to be one of the bravest men he had ever known, and gave his <a href="/wiki/Albus_Potter" title="Albus Potter">second son</a>, who was the only one of his children to inherit Lily's eyes, the middle name "Severus".<sup><a href="/wiki/Harry_Potter_and_the_Deathly_Hallows" title="Harry Potter and the Deathly Hallows">[HP7]</a></sup> Harry ensured that Snape's portrait eventually found its rightful place among Hogwarts's previous headmasters.
</p><p>Ironically, the two shared many similarities that neither of them were aware of. Both were <a href="/wiki/Half-blood" title="Half-blood">half-blood</a> wizards who grew up among <a href="/wiki/Muggle" title="Muggle">Muggles</a>. Both of their Muggle caretakers were cruel to them (Snape's father was implied to be abusive to Snape and his mother, while <a href="/wiki/Dursley_family" title="Dursley family">the Dursleys</a> were neglectful towards Harry). Both Snape and Harry's childhoods involved <a href="/wiki/Petunia_Dursley" title="Petunia Dursley">Petunia Evans</a> (Snape was friends with Petunia's sister Lily, while Harry was Petunia's nephew). Both grew up wearing secondhand clothes (however, Snape was likely forced to wear them due to his family's poverty, Harry's relatives were simply reluctant to afford any major expenses on him). In addition, the two grew up virtually friendless until attending <a href="/wiki/Hogwarts_School_of_Witchcraft_and_Wizardry" title="Hogwarts School of Witchcraft and Wizardry">Hogwarts</a> (Snape due to his unstable family life and secondhand clothes, Harry due to his relatives isolating him). Upon entering Hogwarts, Snape and Harry were bullied mercilessly, in Snape's case, by the <a href="/wiki/Marauders" title="Marauders">Marauders</a> (who were led by <a href="/wiki/James_Potter_I" title="James Potter I">James Potter I</a>), and Harry by (ironically) Snape himself, <a href="/wiki/Draco_Malfoy" title="Draco Malfoy">Draco Malfoy</a> , among others. Furthermore, both had at least one near-death experience during their Hogwarts: Snape was nearly killed in an abortive prank by the Marauders , while Harry repeatedly had Voldemort attempting to kill him. However, both Harry and Snape had at least one silver gleaming: their attraction to a redhead (<a href="/wiki/Lily_Evans" title="Lily Evans">Lily Evans</a> and <a href="/wiki/Ginevra_Weasley" title="Ginevra Weasley">Ginny Weasley</a> , respectively). Of course, Snape did not marry Lily (who married <a href="/wiki/James_Potter_I" title="James Potter I">James</a> and mothered Harry), while Harry himself did marry Ginny (with whom he had sired a child named <a href="/wiki/Albus_Potter" title="Albus Potter">Albus Potter</a>).
</p>
<h3><span class="mw-headline" id="Nymphadora_Tonks">Nymphadora Tonks</span></h3>
<div class="quote">
<dl><dd><span title="Source: Harry Potter and the Order of the Pheonix">"<i>Wotcher, Harry.</i>"</span>
</dd><dd>&#8212;Tonks greeting Harry<sup class="noprint"><a href="/wiki/Harry_Potter_and_the_Order_of_the_Pheonix" title="Harry Potter and the Order of the Pheonix" class="mw-redirect">[src]</a></sup>
</dd><dd></div>
</dd></dl>
<figure class="article-thumb tright show-info-icon" style="width: 145px"> 	<a href="http://vignette1.wikia.nocookie.net/harrypotter/images/c/c7/Nymphadora_Tonks_Deathly_Hallows_promotional_image.jpg/revision/latest?cb=20141122220753" 	class="image image-thumbnail" 	 	 	><img src="data:image/gif;base64,R0lGODlhAQABAIABAAAAAP///yH5BAEAAAEALAAAAAABAAEAQAICTAEAOw%3D%3D" 	 alt="Nymphadora Tonks Deathly Hallows promotional image"  	class="thumbimage lzy lzyPlcHld " 	 	data-image-key="Nymphadora_Tonks_Deathly_Hallows_promotional_image.jpg" 	data-image-name="Nymphadora Tonks Deathly Hallows promotional image.jpg" 	 data-src="http://vignette1.wikia.nocookie.net/harrypotter/images/c/c7/Nymphadora_Tonks_Deathly_Hallows_promotional_image.jpg/revision/latest/scale-to-width/145?cb=20141122220753"  	 width="145"  	 height="191"  	 	 	 onload="if(typeof ImgLzy===&#39;object&#39;){ImgLzy.load(this)}"  	><noscript><img src="http://vignette1.wikia.nocookie.net/harrypotter/images/c/c7/Nymphadora_Tonks_Deathly_Hallows_promotional_image.jpg/revision/latest/scale-to-width/145?cb=20141122220753" 	 alt="Nymphadora Tonks Deathly Hallows promotional image"  	class="thumbimage " 	 	data-image-key="Nymphadora_Tonks_Deathly_Hallows_promotional_image.jpg" 	data-image-name="Nymphadora Tonks Deathly Hallows promotional image.jpg" 	 	 width="145"  	 height="191"  	 	 	 	></noscript></a>  	<figcaption> 		 			<a href="/wiki/File:Nymphadora_Tonks_Deathly_Hallows_promotional_image.jpg" class="sprite info-icon"></a> 		 		 		 			<p class="caption">Nymphadora Tonks, his friend and protector</p> 		 	</figcaption> </figure>
<p>Harry and <a href="/wiki/Nymphadora_Tonks" title="Nymphadora Tonks">Nymphadora Tonks</a> first met in <a href="/wiki/1995" title="1995">1995</a> when the <a href="/wiki/Advance_Guard" title="Advance Guard">Advance Guard</a> came to transport Harry to <a href="/wiki/Grimmauld_Place" title="Grimmauld Place">Grimmauld Place</a>. From there, she became one of Harry's most valuable allies and friend, and was one of the five Order members who rescued Harry and his friends during the <a href="/wiki/Battle_of_the_Department_of_Mysteries" title="Battle of the Department of Mysteries">Battle of the Department of Mysteries</a>. In <a href="/wiki/1996" title="1996">1996</a>. Their friendship grew for the next few years; Tonks felt sorry Harry wasn't been able to attend her wedding in <a href="/wiki/1997" title="1997">1997</a>, though nine months later, Tonks and Remus asked Harry to be godfather to their son, <a href="/wiki/Edward_Lupin" title="Edward Lupin">Teddy Lupin</a>. During the <a href="/wiki/Battle_of_Hogwarts" title="Battle of Hogwarts">Battle of Hogwarts</a>, Tonks was killed by her aunt <a href="/wiki/Bellatrix_Lestrange" title="Bellatrix Lestrange">Bellatrix</a>, who finally succeeded in managing to kill her "blood traitor" niece, however it is possible she was killed from behind as her husband had fell before her (she may have been distracted by this). Tonks's death, along with that of her husband and <a href="/wiki/Fred_Weasley" title="Fred Weasley">Fred Weasley</a>, was among those that hit Harry the hardest.
</p><p>In honour of Tonks and her husband's memory, Harry helped <a href="/wiki/Andromeda_Tonks" title="Andromeda Tonks">Nymphadora's mother</a> to raise <a href="/wiki/Edward_Lupin" title="Edward Lupin">Teddy Lupin</a>. When Harry saw his two sons off to the <a href="/wiki/Hogwarts_Express" title="Hogwarts Express">Hogwarts Express</a> in <a href="/wiki/2017" title="2017">2017</a>, <a href="/wiki/James_Potter_II" title="James Potter II">James</a> came running back to his parents to announce that he had seen Teddy snogging <a href="/wiki/Victoire_Weasley" title="Victoire Weasley">Victoire Weasley</a>, which may have meant Teddy eventually became an official member of the extended Potter-Weasley family.
</p>
<h3><span class="mw-headline" id="Luna_Lovegood">Luna Lovegood</span></h3>
<div class="quote">
<dl><dd><span title="Source: Harry Potter and the Half-Blood Prince"><b>Luna</b>: "<i>People expect you to have cooler friends than us.</i>"
</dd><dd><b>Harry</b>: "<i>You are cool. None of them were at the Ministry. They didn’t <a href="/wiki/Battle_of_the_Department_of_Mysteries" title="Battle of the Department of Mysteries">fight with me</a>.</i>"
</dd><dd><b>Luna</b>: "<i>That’s a very nice thing to say.</i>"</span>
</dd><dd>&#8212; Luna and Harry in 1996<sup class="noprint"><a href="/wiki/Harry_Potter_and_the_Half-Blood_Prince" title="Harry Potter and the Half-Blood Prince">[src]</a></sup>
</dd></dl>
</div>
<figure class="article-thumb tleft show-info-icon" style="width: 145px"> 	<a href="http://vignette3.wikia.nocookie.net/harrypotter/images/f/f3/Luna-Lovegood-Deathly-Hallows.jpg/revision/latest?cb=20141122220801" 	class="image image-thumbnail" 	 	 	><img src="data:image/gif;base64,R0lGODlhAQABAIABAAAAAP///yH5BAEAAAEALAAAAAABAAEAQAICTAEAOw%3D%3D" 	 alt="Luna-Lovegood-Deathly-Hallows"  	class="thumbimage lzy lzyPlcHld " 	 	data-image-key="Luna-Lovegood-Deathly-Hallows.jpg" 	data-image-name="Luna-Lovegood-Deathly-Hallows.jpg" 	 data-src="http://vignette3.wikia.nocookie.net/harrypotter/images/f/f3/Luna-Lovegood-Deathly-Hallows.jpg/revision/latest/scale-to-width/145?cb=20141122220801"  	 width="145"  	 height="193"  	 	 	 onload="if(typeof ImgLzy===&#39;object&#39;){ImgLzy.load(this)}"  	><noscript><img src="http://vignette3.wikia.nocookie.net/harrypotter/images/f/f3/Luna-Lovegood-Deathly-Hallows.jpg/revision/latest/scale-to-width/145?cb=20141122220801" 	 alt="Luna-Lovegood-Deathly-Hallows"  	class="thumbimage " 	 	data-image-key="Luna-Lovegood-Deathly-Hallows.jpg" 	data-image-name="Luna-Lovegood-Deathly-Hallows.jpg" 	 	 width="145"  	 height="193"  	 	 	 	></noscript></a>  	<figcaption> 		 			<a href="/wiki/File:Luna-Lovegood-Deathly-Hallows.jpg" class="sprite info-icon"></a> 		 		 		 			<p class="caption">Luna Lovegood, a close friend</p> 		 	</figcaption> </figure>
<p><br />
Harry met <a href="/wiki/Luna_Lovegood" title="Luna Lovegood">Luna Lovegood</a>, a <a href="/wiki/Ravenclaw" title="Ravenclaw">Ravenclaw</a> student at Hogwarts, in <a href="/wiki/1995" title="1995">1995</a>, on the <a href="/wiki/Hogwarts_Express" title="Hogwarts Express">Hogwarts Express</a>. Although Harry found the younger witch rather strange, he was grateful when she told him that she believed his claim that <a href="/wiki/Tom_Riddle" title="Tom Riddle">Lord Voldemort</a> had returned, as she seemed to be one of the few students who did. Harry and Luna became friendlier through <a href="/wiki/Dumbledore%27s_Army" title="Dumbledore&#39;s Army">Dumbledore's Army</a>, and after they fought together at the <a href="/wiki/Battle_of_the_Department_of_Mysteries" title="Battle of the Department of Mysteries">Battle of the Department of Mysteries</a>, Luna comforted Harry over the loss of his <a href="/wiki/Sirius_Black" title="Sirius Black">godfather</a>, telling him about her late <a href="/wiki/Luna_Lovegood%27s_mother" title="Luna Lovegood&#39;s mother" class="mw-redirect">mother</a>. She holds Harry's hand in the process, and they both show a some feelings for each other. The <a href="/wiki/1996" title="1996">following year</a>, Harry defended Luna and <a href="/wiki/Neville_Longbottom" title="Neville Longbottom">Neville Longbottom</a> when <a href="/wiki/Romilda_Vane" title="Romilda Vane">Romilda Vane</a> implied they were not worth spending time with, whereas the previous year he found the two as embarrassment to his standing in front of <a href="/wiki/Cho_Chang" title="Cho Chang">Cho Chang</a>, and he later on invited Luna to attend <a href="/wiki/Horace_Slughorn" title="Horace Slughorn">Slughorn</a>'s <a href="/wiki/Slug_Club_Christmas_party" title="Slug Club Christmas party">Christmas Party</a> with him.
</p><p>During the year in which Harry, Ron, and Hermione went to hunt down <a href="/wiki/Tom_Riddle" title="Tom Riddle">Lord Voldemort's</a> <a href="/wiki/Horcrux" title="Horcrux">Horcruxes</a>, Harry visited the Lovegood household, and found Luna decorated her bedroom with pictures of her five friends: Harry, Ron, Hermione, Ginny and Neville. Harry found this sight to be very touching, and felt great affection for Luna. Upon learning that Luna was being held hostage by the Death Eaters, Harry felt greatly worried, to the point of feeling some pity for her father for attempting to turn the trio in for ransom, but had confidence in Luna surviving nevertheless. In the prelude to the final <a href="/wiki/Battle_of_Hogwarts" title="Battle of Hogwarts">battle</a>, Luna aided Harry in his search for <a href="/wiki/Ravenclaw%27s_Diadem" title="Ravenclaw&#39;s Diadem">Ravenclaw's Diadem</a>, having been the one to inform Harry of its existence in the first place, and she <a href="/wiki/Stunning_Spell" title="Stunning Spell">Stunned</a> <a href="/wiki/Alecto_Carrow" title="Alecto Carrow">Alecto Carrow</a> when Harry was too shocked to move, which probably saved him from being held captive until <a href="/wiki/Tom_Riddle" title="Tom Riddle">Voldemort</a>'s arrival. Later when Harry was going to sacrifice himself, he realised that Luna was one of his closest friends and one of the persons he would like to see before his death.
</p><p>After the <a href="/wiki/Battle_of_Hogwarts" title="Battle of Hogwarts">Battle of Hogwarts</a>, Luna was the only one who noticed that Harry wanted to get away from the victory party, and created a distraction so that he could go speak with Ron and Hermione in private. The two remained friends into adulthood, and Harry gave his <a href="/wiki/Lily_Potter" title="Lily Potter">daughter</a> the middle name “Luna” in honour of his friend.
</p>
<h3><span class="mw-headline" id="Dobby">Dobby</span></h3>
<div class="quote">
<dl><dd><span title="Source: Harry Potter and the Chamber of Secrets">"<i>You shall not harm Harry Potter!</i>"</span>
</dd><dd>&#8212;Dobby protects Harry from <a href="/wiki/Lucius_Malfoy" title="Lucius Malfoy">Lucius Malfoy</a><sup class="noprint"><a href="/wiki/Harry_Potter_and_the_Chamber_of_Secrets" title="Harry Potter and the Chamber of Secrets">[src]</a></sup>
</dd><dd></div>
</dd></dl>
<figure class="article-thumb tright show-info-icon" style="width: 145px"> 	<a href="http://vignette1.wikia.nocookie.net/harrypotter/images/1/18/DOBBY2.jpg/revision/latest?cb=20141122220920" 	class="image image-thumbnail" 	 	 	><img src="data:image/gif;base64,R0lGODlhAQABAIABAAAAAP///yH5BAEAAAEALAAAAAABAAEAQAICTAEAOw%3D%3D" 	 alt="DOBBY2"  	class="thumbimage lzy lzyPlcHld " 	 	data-image-key="DOBBY2.jpg" 	data-image-name="DOBBY2.jpg" 	 data-src="http://vignette1.wikia.nocookie.net/harrypotter/images/1/18/DOBBY2.jpg/revision/latest/scale-to-width/145?cb=20141122220920"  	 width="145"  	 height="194"  	 	 	 onload="if(typeof ImgLzy===&#39;object&#39;){ImgLzy.load(this)}"  	><noscript><img src="http://vignette1.wikia.nocookie.net/harrypotter/images/1/18/DOBBY2.jpg/revision/latest/scale-to-width/145?cb=20141122220920" 	 alt="DOBBY2"  	class="thumbimage " 	 	data-image-key="DOBBY2.jpg" 	data-image-name="DOBBY2.jpg" 	 	 width="145"  	 height="194"  	 	 	 	></noscript></a>  	<figcaption> 		 			<a href="/wiki/File:DOBBY2.jpg" class="sprite info-icon"></a> 		 		 		 			<p class="caption">Dobby, Harry's friend</p> 		 	</figcaption> </figure>
<p>The <a href="/wiki/House-elf" title="House-elf">House-elf</a> <a href="/wiki/Dobby" title="Dobby">Dobby</a> became a vitally important figure in Harry's life, and their relationship played a crucial role in Harry's ultimate defeat of <a href="/wiki/Tom_Riddle" title="Tom Riddle">Lord Voldemort</a>. Even before Harry freed Dobby from the slavery of the <a href="/wiki/Malfoy_family" title="Malfoy family">Malfoy family</a>, in <a href="/wiki/1993" title="1993">1993</a>, Dobby did all he could to protect Harry from impending danger, and later displayed the strength of his <a href="/wiki/House-elf_magic" title="House-elf magic">house-elf magic</a> to protect Harry from Lucius Malfoy. For the next several years, Dobby was appointed to work at the kitchen of <a href="/wiki/Hogwarts_Castle" title="Hogwarts Castle">Hogwarts Castle</a> in the paid service of Headmaster <a href="/wiki/Albus_Dumbledore" title="Albus Dumbledore">Albus Dumbledore</a>, though even as a free elf, his loyalty always laid foremost with Harry.<sup id="cite_ref-HBP_31-3" class="reference"><a href="#cite_note-HBP-31">[32]</a></sup> In <a href="/wiki/1994" title="1994">1994</a>, Dobby provided Harry with <a href="/wiki/Gillyweed" title="Gillyweed">Gillyweed</a> for the second task of the <a href="/wiki/Triwizard_Tournament" title="Triwizard Tournament">Triwizard Tournament</a>, and the next year, told Harry about the <a href="/wiki/Room_of_Requirement" title="Room of Requirement">Room of Requirement</a>, which became <a href="/wiki/Dumbledore%27s_Army" title="Dumbledore&#39;s Army">Dumbledore's Army</a>'s base of operations.
</p><p>In <a href="/wiki/1998" title="1998">1998</a>, Harry, <a href="/wiki/Ronald_Weasley" title="Ronald Weasley">Ron</a>, <a href="/wiki/Hermione_Granger" title="Hermione Granger">Hermione</a>, <a href="/wiki/Luna_Lovegood" title="Luna Lovegood">Luna Lovegood</a>, <a href="/wiki/Dean_Thomas" title="Dean Thomas">Dean Thomas</a>, <a href="/wiki/Garrick_Ollivander" title="Garrick Ollivander">Garrick Ollivander</a> and the goblin <a href="/wiki/Griphook" title="Griphook">Griphook</a> were captured and taken hostage at the <a href="/wiki/Malfoy_Manor" title="Malfoy Manor">Malfoy Manor</a>. Alerted to their whereabouts by <a href="/wiki/Aberforth_Dumbledore" title="Aberforth Dumbledore">Aberforth Dumbledore</a>, Dobby rescued the hostages in two groups, first <a href="/wiki/Apparition" title="Apparition">apparating</a> Dean, Luna and Ollivander to <a href="/wiki/Shell_Cottage" title="Shell Cottage">Shell Cottage</a>, then returning to do the same for Hermione, Ron, Harry and Griphook. Dobby dropped a chandelier on <a href="/wiki/Bellatrix_Lestrange" title="Bellatrix Lestrange">Bellatrix Lestrange</a> to release Hermione from being held at knife-point, giving Ron the opportunity to take a wand and disapparate with Hermione. Enraged by what he had done, Bellatrix threw the same silver knife at Dobby, mortally wounding him, just as he disapparated with Harry and Griphook. Upon arriving at Shell Cottage, Harry discovered Dobby's wound and cried out for help as Dobby died in Harry's arms. Harry dug a grave without using magic and held a small <a href="/wiki/Funeral_of_Dobby" title="Funeral of Dobby">funeral</a> for the elf in the garden of <a href="/wiki/Shell_Cottage" title="Shell Cottage">Shell Cottage</a>. Dobby's epitaph read "<i>Here lies Dobby, A Free Elf</i>". After the funeral, Harry remembered <a href="/wiki/Funeral_of_Albus_Dumbledore" title="Funeral of Albus Dumbledore">the one</a> <a href="/wiki/Albus_Dumbledore" title="Albus Dumbledore">Albus Dumbledore</a> had, and thought that Dobby deserved one just as grand.
</p><p>It was the <a href="/wiki/Love" title="Love">grief</a> Harry felt for Dobby's death that ultimately grounded him, ridding Harry of the "<i>weird, obsessive longing</i>" to find the <a href="/wiki/Elder_Wand" title="Elder Wand">Elder Wand</a> and the resentment for how little he felt Albus Dumbledore had actually disclosed during their time together. While digging Dobby's grave, Harry reflected on all Dumbledore had said about love, and all he had foreseen, and replaced his trust in the late Headmaster, making the conscious decision to continue his pursuit of <a href="/wiki/Horcrux" title="Horcrux">Horcruxes</a>, and not <a href="/wiki/Deathly_Hallows" title="Deathly Hallows">Hallows</a>.
</p>
<h3><span class="mw-headline" id="Neville_Longbottom">Neville Longbottom</span></h3>
<div class="quote">
<dl><dd><span title="Source: Harry Potter and the Deathly Hallows"><b>Neville</b>: "<i>All right, Harry. You're okay, are you?</i>"
</dd><dd><b>Harry</b>: "<i>I'm fine. Thanks, Neville.</i>"
</dd><dd><b>Neville</b>: "<i>We're all going to keep fighting, Harry. You know that?</i>"</span>
</dd><dd>&#8212; Harry Potter and <a href="/wiki/Neville_Longbottom" title="Neville Longbottom">Neville Longbottom</a> during the <a href="/wiki/Battle_of_Hogwarts" title="Battle of Hogwarts">Battle of Hogwarts</a><sup class="noprint"><a href="/wiki/Harry_Potter_and_the_Deathly_Hallows" title="Harry Potter and the Deathly Hallows">[src]</a></sup>
</dd></dl>
</div>
<figure class="article-thumb tleft show-info-icon" style="width: 140px"> 	<a href="http://vignette2.wikia.nocookie.net/harrypotter/images/2/20/NevilleHBP.jpg/revision/latest?cb=20141122220929" 	class="image image-thumbnail" 	 	 	><img src="data:image/gif;base64,R0lGODlhAQABAIABAAAAAP///yH5BAEAAAEALAAAAAABAAEAQAICTAEAOw%3D%3D" 	 alt="NevilleHBP"  	class="thumbimage lzy lzyPlcHld " 	 	data-image-key="NevilleHBP.jpg" 	data-image-name="NevilleHBP.jpg" 	 data-src="http://vignette2.wikia.nocookie.net/harrypotter/images/2/20/NevilleHBP.jpg/revision/latest/scale-to-width/140?cb=20141122220929"  	 width="140"  	 height="207"  	 	 	 onload="if(typeof ImgLzy===&#39;object&#39;){ImgLzy.load(this)}"  	><noscript><img src="http://vignette2.wikia.nocookie.net/harrypotter/images/2/20/NevilleHBP.jpg/revision/latest/scale-to-width/140?cb=20141122220929" 	 alt="NevilleHBP"  	class="thumbimage " 	 	data-image-key="NevilleHBP.jpg" 	data-image-name="NevilleHBP.jpg" 	 	 width="140"  	 height="207"  	 	 	 	></noscript></a>  	<figcaption> 		 			<a href="/wiki/File:NevilleHBP.jpg" class="sprite info-icon"></a> 		 		 		 			<p class="caption">Neville Longbottom, a close friend</p> 		 	</figcaption> </figure>
<p><a href="/wiki/Neville_Longbottom" title="Neville Longbottom">Neville Longbottom</a> became Harry's room mate in <a href="/wiki/1991" title="1991">1991</a>, in their first year at <a href="/wiki/Hogwarts_School_of_Witchcraft_and_Wizardry" title="Hogwarts School of Witchcraft and Wizardry">Hogwarts</a>. In <a href="/wiki/1996" title="1996">1996</a>, Harry learned that <a href="/wiki/Sybill_Trelawney%27s_first_prophecy" title="Sybill Trelawney&#39;s first prophecy">The Prophecy</a> that prompted Lord Voldemort to target his parents could have been referring to Neville. Though Harry sympathised with the fact that Neville's parents had been tortured into insanity by Bellatrix, Rodolphus and Rabastan <a href="/wiki/Lestrange_family" title="Lestrange family">Lestrange</a>, and <a href="/wiki/Bartemius_Crouch_Jr." title="Bartemius Crouch Jr.">Barty Crouch Jr</a>, he spent part of the journey to Hogwarts prior to his sixth year pondering how things could have been different if Voldemort had chosen to attack Neville, and he had become the "<i>one with the power to vanquish the Dark Lord</i>" instead of Harry.
</p><p>In the initial years, Harry was quite friendly with Neville, though he was not as close to him as he was with Ron and Hermione. Harry helped out Neville in many occasions, such as in <a href="/wiki/1992" title="1992">1992</a>, when he advised him to stand up to Draco Malfoy, who constantly bullied him. Harry and Neville became close friends only in their fifth year at school, when Neville took part in <a href="/wiki/Dumbledore%27s_Army" title="Dumbledore&#39;s Army">Dumbledore's Army</a>, an organisation that Harry led and taught in opposition to <a href="/wiki/Dolores_Umbridge" title="Dolores Umbridge">Dolores Umbridge</a>. Neville became highly devoted to the D.A., which, along with Harry's encouragement, helped Neville not only improve his magical abilities, but gain badly needed confidence and incredible courage. He fought alongside Harry in the <a href="/wiki/Battle_of_the_Department_of_Mysteries" title="Battle of the Department of Mysteries">Battle of the Department of Mysteries</a>, where Neville saved Harry's life from the Death Eater <a href="/wiki/Walden_Macnair" title="Walden Macnair">Walden Macnair</a>, and in <a href="/wiki/1997" title="1997">1997</a>, was one of only three D.A. members who still checked their <a href="/wiki/Dumbledore%27s_Army_coin" title="Dumbledore&#39;s Army coin">enchanted coin</a> enough to receive Hermione's call for help prior to the <a href="/wiki/Battle_of_the_Astronomy_Tower" title="Battle of the Astronomy Tower">Battle of the Astronomy Tower</a>.
</p><p>In <a href="/wiki/1998" title="1998">1998</a>, when Harry, Ron and Hermione were on the run, Neville re-formed Dumbledore's Army with <a href="/wiki/Ginevra_Weasley" title="Ginevra Weasley">Ginny Weasley</a> and <a href="/wiki/Luna_Lovegood" title="Luna Lovegood">Luna Lovegood</a>, in resistance against <a href="/wiki/Death_Eaters" title="Death Eaters">Death Eaters</a> <a href="/wiki/Alecto_Carrow" title="Alecto Carrow">Alecto</a> and <a href="/wiki/Amycus_Carrow" title="Amycus Carrow">Amycus Carrow</a>. Neville spoke out against their anti-<a href="/wiki/Muggle" title="Muggle">Muggle</a> rhetoric and habit of using the <a href="/wiki/Cruciatus_Curse" title="Cruciatus Curse">Cruciatus Curse</a> on students, regardless of the consequences, saying he noticed it always helped give people hope when Harry did that. When Harry returned, Neville deferred to his leadership and summoned the rest of Dumbledore's Army (who, in turn, contacted the Order of the Phoenix) believing Harry was there to lead a revolt. Harry and Neville fought together throughout the <a href="/wiki/Battle_of_Hogwarts" title="Battle of Hogwarts">Battle of Hogwarts</a>, and just before Harry sacrificed himself, he left Neville with the instruction to kill <a href="/wiki/Nagini" title="Nagini">Nagini</a>, Voldemort's snake and last remaining <a href="/wiki/Horcrux" title="Horcrux">Horcrux</a>. When everyone believed Harry to be dead, Neville openly defied Voldemort, who tried to burn him alive with the <a href="/wiki/Sorting_Hat" title="Sorting Hat">Sorting Hat</a> but failed due to Harry's <a href="/wiki/Sacrificial_protection" title="Sacrificial protection">sacrificial protection</a>. Using the opportunity given to him by the sudden arrival of reinforcements, Neville completed the task Harry gave to him; he drew <a href="/wiki/Godric_Gryffindor%27s_Sword" title="Godric Gryffindor&#39;s Sword" class="mw-redirect">Gryffindor's Sword</a> from the Sorting Hat and slew Nagini, destroying the last Horcrux and rendering Voldemort mortal, thus allowing Harry to finally kill him.
</p><p>Nineteen years after the battle, Neville was the <a href="/wiki/Herbology" title="Herbology">Herbology</a> teacher at Hogwarts, and taught Harry and Ginny's children, James and Albus. They both remain close friends in adulthood. Harry made Neville the godfather to his second son Albus.
</p>
<h3><span class="mw-headline" id="Draco_Malfoy">Draco Malfoy</span></h3>
<div class="quote">
<dl><dd><span title="Source: Harry Potter and the Order of the Phoenix"><b>Draco</b>: "<i>You’re dead, Potter.</i>"
</dd><dd><b>Harry</b>: "<i>Funny, you’d think I’d have stopped walking around.</i>"
</dd><dd><b>Draco</b>: "<i>You’re going to pay. I’m going to make you pay for what you’ve done to my <a href="/wiki/Lucius_Malfoy" title="Lucius Malfoy">father</a>... You can’t land my father in <a href="/wiki/Azkaban" title="Azkaban">prison</a>.</i>"</span>
</dd><dd>&#8212; Draco and Harry after the <a href="/wiki/Battle_of_the_Department_of_Mysteries" title="Battle of the Department of Mysteries">Battle of the Department of Mysteries</a><sup class="noprint"><a href="/wiki/Harry_Potter_and_the_Order_of_the_Phoenix" title="Harry Potter and the Order of the Phoenix">[src]</a></sup>
</dd></dl>
</div>
<figure class="article-thumb tright show-info-icon" style="width: 140px"> 	<a href="http://vignette1.wikia.nocookie.net/harrypotter/images/e/e2/Draco_Malfoy_hp6.jpg/revision/latest?cb=20141122220937" 	class="image image-thumbnail" 	 	 	><img src="data:image/gif;base64,R0lGODlhAQABAIABAAAAAP///yH5BAEAAAEALAAAAAABAAEAQAICTAEAOw%3D%3D" 	 alt="Draco Malfoy hp6"  	class="thumbimage lzy lzyPlcHld " 	 	data-image-key="Draco_Malfoy_hp6.jpg" 	data-image-name="Draco Malfoy hp6.jpg" 	 data-src="http://vignette1.wikia.nocookie.net/harrypotter/images/e/e2/Draco_Malfoy_hp6.jpg/revision/latest/scale-to-width/140?cb=20141122220937"  	 width="140"  	 height="212"  	 	 	 onload="if(typeof ImgLzy===&#39;object&#39;){ImgLzy.load(this)}"  	><noscript><img src="http://vignette1.wikia.nocookie.net/harrypotter/images/e/e2/Draco_Malfoy_hp6.jpg/revision/latest/scale-to-width/140?cb=20141122220937" 	 alt="Draco Malfoy hp6"  	class="thumbimage " 	 	data-image-key="Draco_Malfoy_hp6.jpg" 	data-image-name="Draco Malfoy hp6.jpg" 	 	 width="140"  	 height="212"  	 	 	 	></noscript></a>  	<figcaption> 		 			<a href="/wiki/File:Draco_Malfoy_hp6.jpg" class="sprite info-icon"></a> 		 		 		 			<p class="caption">Draco Malfoy, his school bully and arch-rival</p> 		 	</figcaption> </figure>
<p><a href="/wiki/Draco_Malfoy" title="Draco Malfoy">Draco Malfoy</a> became Harry's rival almost from the moment they met at <a href="/wiki/Madam_Malkin%27s_Robes_for_All_Occasions" title="Madam Malkin&#39;s Robes for All Occasions">Madam Malkin's Robes for All Occasions</a> in <a href="/wiki/Diagon_Alley" title="Diagon Alley">Diagon Alley</a>. Draco came from a family that believed strongly in the importance of <a href="/wiki/Blood_purity" title="Blood purity" class="mw-redirect">blood purity</a>, thus he considered himself superior to most people, bullying and insulting <a href="/wiki/Muggle-born" title="Muggle-born">Muggle-borns</a> and <a href="/wiki/Gryffindor" title="Gryffindor">Gryffindors</a> in particular. He was bitterly jealous of Harry's seemingly effortless heroism. Despite his strong hatred towards Draco, Harry had some restraint towards Draco's taunts, occasionally restraining <a href="/wiki/Ronald_Weasley" title="Ronald Weasley">Ron Weasley</a> (and on one occasion, <a href="/wiki/George_Weasley" title="George Weasley">George Weasley</a>) from attacking him and only resorted to violence on him if Draco provoked or insulted him. Draco bit off more than he could chew in his ambition to be like his father, <a href="/wiki/Lucius_Malfoy" title="Lucius Malfoy">Lucius Malfoy</a>, when he became a <a href="/wiki/Death_Eaters" title="Death Eaters">Death Eater</a> at a young age; to punish his father, Voldemort ordered Draco to assassinate <a href="/wiki/Albus_Dumbledore" title="Albus Dumbledore">Albus Dumbledore</a>, threatening his parents' lives if he failed. Although he let several Death Eaters into Hogwarts in <a href="/wiki/1997" title="1997">1997</a>, Draco found himself unwilling to actually go through with killing Dumbledore, even when given the opportunity to do so. A year later, when Harry was brought to the Malfoy Manor to be handed over to the Dark Lord, Draco was very reluctant to identify him, and during the confrontation that ensued, Harry disarmed him, winning both his hawthorn wand and, unknowingly, the <a href="/wiki/Elder_Wand" title="Elder Wand">Elder Wand</a>.
</p><p>During the Battle of Hogwarts, Harry, Ron and Hermione saved his life twice: against Crabbe's Fiendfyre and from a masked Death Eater. Because of his family's switching of sides during the <a href="/wiki/Battle_of_Hogwarts" title="Battle of Hogwarts">Battle of Hogwarts</a>, Draco was not sent to <a href="/wiki/Azkaban" title="Azkaban">Azkaban</a> for his crimes. By <a href="/wiki/2017" title="2017">2017</a>, he was married and had a <a href="/wiki/Scorpius_Malfoy" title="Scorpius Malfoy">son</a>. Draco saw Harry, Ginny, Hermione and Ron at King's Cross Station when sending their children to <a href="/wiki/Hogwarts_School_of_Witchcraft_and_Wizardry" title="Hogwarts School of Witchcraft and Wizardry">Hogwarts</a>, where he gave them a curt nod. While Draco and Harry eventually made peace, they never became friends. It is also unknown if Harry ever gave Draco his original wand back, as Harry won it's allegiance and it is never stated how a wand that has been won behaves towards his original master afterwards.
</p>
<h3><span class="mw-headline" id="Seamus_Finnigan_and_Dean_Thomas">Seamus Finnigan and Dean Thomas</span></h3>
<div class="quote">
<dl><dd><span title="Source: Harry Potter and the Order of the Phoenix (film)">"<i><a href="/wiki/Dean_Thomas" title="Dean Thomas">Dean</a>, <a href="/wiki/Seamus_Finnigan" title="Seamus Finnigan">Seamus</a>. Good Holidays?</i>"</span>
</dd><dd>&#8212;Harry to Dean and Seamus in the begin of the 1995-1996 school year<sup class="noprint"><a href="/wiki/Harry_Potter_and_the_Order_of_the_Phoenix_(film)" title="Harry Potter and the Order of the Phoenix (film)">[src]</a></sup>
</dd><dd></div>
</dd></dl>
<figure class="article-thumb tleft show-info-icon" style="width: 235px"> 	<a href="http://vignette3.wikia.nocookie.net/harrypotter/images/7/70/Seamusgof.jpg/revision/latest?cb=20080211182128" 	class="image image-thumbnail" 	 	 	><img src="data:image/gif;base64,R0lGODlhAQABAIABAAAAAP///yH5BAEAAAEALAAAAAABAAEAQAICTAEAOw%3D%3D" 	 alt="Seamusgof"  	class="thumbimage lzy lzyPlcHld " 	 	data-image-key="Seamusgof.jpg" 	data-image-name="Seamusgof.jpg" 	 data-src="http://vignette3.wikia.nocookie.net/harrypotter/images/7/70/Seamusgof.jpg/revision/latest/scale-to-width/235?cb=20080211182128"  	 width="235"  	 height="127"  	 	 	 onload="if(typeof ImgLzy===&#39;object&#39;){ImgLzy.load(this)}"  	><noscript><img src="http://vignette3.wikia.nocookie.net/harrypotter/images/7/70/Seamusgof.jpg/revision/latest/scale-to-width/235?cb=20080211182128" 	 alt="Seamusgof"  	class="thumbimage " 	 	data-image-key="Seamusgof.jpg" 	data-image-name="Seamusgof.jpg" 	 	 width="235"  	 height="127"  	 	 	 	></noscript></a>  	<figcaption> 		 			<a href="/wiki/File:Seamusgof.jpg" class="sprite info-icon"></a> 		 		 		 			<p class="caption">Seamus, Dean, and Neville</p> 		 	</figcaption> </figure>
<p>In addition to <a href="/wiki/Ronald_Weasley" title="Ronald Weasley">Ron</a> and <a href="/wiki/Neville_Longbottom" title="Neville Longbottom">Neville</a>, Harry’s room mates at <a href="/wiki/Hogwarts_School_of_Witchcraft_and_Wizardry" title="Hogwarts School of Witchcraft and Wizardry">Hogwarts</a> were <a href="/wiki/Dean_Thomas" title="Dean Thomas">Dean Thomas</a> and <a href="/wiki/Seamus_Finnigan" title="Seamus Finnigan">Seamus Finnigan</a>. Although he was not as close to them as he was to Ron, Harry was nevertheless friendly with both of them.
</p><p>Dean made a banner for Harry during his first <a href="/wiki/Quidditch" title="Quidditch">Quidditch</a> match, and believed him about the return of <a href="/wiki/Tom_Riddle" title="Tom Riddle">Lord Voldemort</a> in <a href="/wiki/1995" title="1995">1995</a>, unlike Seamus, eagerly joining <a href="/wiki/Dumbledore%27s_Army" title="Dumbledore&#39;s Army">Dumbledore's Army</a>. However,  Seamus eventually realized that Harry was telling the truth about Voldemort's return, he joined the D.A. and became friends with Harry again. Harry resented Dean slightly during their sixth year out of jealousy over Dean's romance with <a href="/wiki/Ginevra_Weasley" title="Ginevra Weasley">Ginny Weasley</a>, on whom he had developed a crush. When Dean and Ginny split up, Harry's enmity lifted, though Dean then became upset when Harry kissed his ex-girlfriend soon after their break-up.<sup id="cite_ref-HBP_31-4" class="reference"><a href="#cite_note-HBP-31">[32]</a></sup>,in spite of this, he never seemed to carry any ill will towards Harry.
</p><p>Dean, like Ron, Harry, and Hermione, left Hogwarts in <a href="/wiki/1997" title="1997">1997</a>, because he was unsure whether he was a <a href="/wiki/Muggle-born" title="Muggle-born">Muggle-born</a> or not. He was caught by a group of <a href="/wiki/Snatchers" title="Snatchers">Snatchers</a>, led by <a href="/wiki/Fenrir_Greyback" title="Fenrir Greyback">Fenrir Greyback</a>, along with Ron, Harry and Hermione. During his rescue from Malfoy Manor, he was very reluctant to escape with <a href="/wiki/Dobby" title="Dobby">Dobby</a> and leave Harry behind<sup id="cite_ref-DH_29-7" class="reference"><a href="#cite_note-DH-29">[30]</a></sup> and lived for a few days at <a href="/wiki/Shell_Cottage" title="Shell Cottage">Shell Cottage</a>. Seamus and Dean eventually fought along with Ron in the <a href="/wiki/Battle_of_Hogwarts" title="Battle of Hogwarts">Battle of Hogwarts</a>.
</p>
<h3><span class="mw-headline" id="Cho_Chang">Cho Chang</span></h3>
<div class="quote">
<dl><dd><span title="Source: Harry Potter and the Order of the Phoenix">"<i>Well, obviously, she’s feeling very sad, because of Cedric dying. Then I expect she’s feeling confused because she liked Cedric and now she likes Harry, and she can’t work out who she likes best. Then she’ll be feeling guilty, thinking it’s an insult to Cedric’s memory to be kissing Harry at all </i>[…]<i> </i>"</span>
</dd><dd>&#8212;Hermione on Cho Chang after the latter’s kiss with Harry<sup class="noprint"><a href="/wiki/Harry_Potter_and_the_Order_of_the_Phoenix" title="Harry Potter and the Order of the Phoenix">[src]</a></sup>
</dd><dd></div>
</dd></dl>
<figure class="article-thumb tright show-info-icon" style="width: 140px"> 	<a href="http://vignette3.wikia.nocookie.net/harrypotter/images/8/88/Cho-chang1.jpg/revision/latest?cb=20140425003330" 	class="image image-thumbnail" 	 	 	><img src="data:image/gif;base64,R0lGODlhAQABAIABAAAAAP///yH5BAEAAAEALAAAAAABAAEAQAICTAEAOw%3D%3D" 	 alt="Cho-chang1"  	class="thumbimage lzy lzyPlcHld " 	 	data-image-key="Cho-chang1.jpg" 	data-image-name="Cho-chang1.jpg" 	 data-src="http://vignette3.wikia.nocookie.net/harrypotter/images/8/88/Cho-chang1.jpg/revision/latest/scale-to-width/140?cb=20140425003330"  	 width="140"  	 height="210"  	 	 	 onload="if(typeof ImgLzy===&#39;object&#39;){ImgLzy.load(this)}"  	><noscript><img src="http://vignette3.wikia.nocookie.net/harrypotter/images/8/88/Cho-chang1.jpg/revision/latest/scale-to-width/140?cb=20140425003330" 	 alt="Cho-chang1"  	class="thumbimage " 	 	data-image-key="Cho-chang1.jpg" 	data-image-name="Cho-chang1.jpg" 	 	 width="140"  	 height="210"  	 	 	 	></noscript></a>  	<figcaption> 		 			<a href="/wiki/File:Cho-chang1.jpg" class="sprite info-icon"></a> 		 		 		 			<p class="caption"><a href="/wiki/Cho_Chang" title="Cho Chang">Cho Chang</a>, his ex-girlfriend</p> 		 	</figcaption> </figure>
<p>In his earlier years at <a href="/wiki/Hogwarts_School_of_Witchcraft_and_Wizardry" title="Hogwarts School of Witchcraft and Wizardry">Hogwarts</a>, Harry was attracted to <a href="/wiki/Cho_Chang" title="Cho Chang">Cho Chang</a>, a popular girl in <a href="/wiki/Ravenclaw" title="Ravenclaw">Ravenclaw</a> House and seeker of their <a href="/wiki/Quidditch" title="Quidditch">Quidditch</a> team who is one year older than him. It was said that his stomach did "<i>somersaults</i>" whenever he saw her. During the <a href="/wiki/Triwizard_Tournament" title="Triwizard Tournament">Triwizard Tournament</a> in <a href="/wiki/1994" title="1994">1994</a>, Harry plucked up the courage to ask her to the <a href="/wiki/Yule_Ball" title="Yule Ball">Yule Ball</a>, but was disappointed to find that she had already agreed to go with <a href="/wiki/Cedric_Diggory" title="Cedric Diggory">Cedric Diggory</a>, though she seemed to genuinely feel bad about having to turn him down.
</p><p>In their next year, following Cedric's tragic death, Harry and Cho grew closer, eventually sharing a kiss under the mistletoe. However, Cho was still mourning Cedric, and became unreasonably jealous of Harry's friendship with Hermione, which, compounded with Harry’s inexperience with girls, put a strain on their relationship; Harry, unimpressed with Cho's attitude and started to see her in a more negative light when the misunderstanding soured their first date's experience.
</p>
<figure class="article-thumb tleft show-info-icon" style="width: 240px"> 	<a href="http://vignette4.wikia.nocookie.net/harrypotter/images/a/a0/1harry-cho.JPG/revision/latest?cb=20140624043250" 	class="image image-thumbnail" 	 	 	><img src="data:image/gif;base64,R0lGODlhAQABAIABAAAAAP///yH5BAEAAAEALAAAAAABAAEAQAICTAEAOw%3D%3D" 	 alt="1harry-cho"  	class="thumbimage lzy lzyPlcHld " 	 	data-image-key="1harry-cho.JPG" 	data-image-name="1harry-cho.JPG" 	 data-src="http://vignette4.wikia.nocookie.net/harrypotter/images/a/a0/1harry-cho.JPG/revision/latest/scale-to-width/240?cb=20140624043250"  	 width="240"  	 height="103"  	 	 	 onload="if(typeof ImgLzy===&#39;object&#39;){ImgLzy.load(this)}"  	><noscript><img src="http://vignette4.wikia.nocookie.net/harrypotter/images/a/a0/1harry-cho.JPG/revision/latest/scale-to-width/240?cb=20140624043250" 	 alt="1harry-cho"  	class="thumbimage " 	 	data-image-key="1harry-cho.JPG" 	data-image-name="1harry-cho.JPG" 	 	 width="240"  	 height="103"  	 	 	 	></noscript></a>  	<figcaption> 		 			<a href="/wiki/File:1harry-cho.JPG" class="sprite info-icon"></a> 		 		 		 			<p class="caption">The kiss between Cho and Harry.</p> 		 	</figcaption> </figure>
<p>Although Harry was still attracted to Cho it said that his stomach reacted less violently when she was around, merely doing a "feeble lurch" rather than a somersault. The last straw was Cho's friend <a href="/wiki/Marietta_Edgecombe" title="Marietta Edgecombe">Marietta Edgecombe</a>'s betrayal of <a href="/wiki/Dumbledore%27s_Army" title="Dumbledore&#39;s Army">Dumbledore's Army</a> to <a href="/wiki/Dolores_Umbridge" title="Dolores Umbridge">Dolores Umbridge</a>; Cho defended Marietta and called the <a href="/wiki/Dumbledore%27s_Army_parchment_jinx" title="Dumbledore&#39;s Army parchment jinx">jinx</a> Hermione had placed on the D.A. parchment a "horrible trick", both of which angered Harry. The two stopped speaking to one another, and Cho soon began dating <a href="/wiki/Michael_Corner" title="Michael Corner">Michael Corner</a>. However, any animosity seemed to have vanished by <a href="/wiki/1998" title="1998">1998</a>, as Cho was among the former D.A. members who returned to participate in the <a href="/wiki/Battle_of_Hogwarts" title="Battle of Hogwarts">Battle of Hogwarts</a>. Just before the battle, she offered to show Harry the Ravenclaw common room, and seemed disappointed when this offer was fiercely denied by <a href="/wiki/Ginevra_Weasley" title="Ginevra Weasley">Ginny Weasley</a>. Harry, on the other hand, did not hesitate nor argue on Ginny's insistence on taking Luna instead.
</p>
<div class="quote">
<dl><dd><span title="Source: Harry Potter and the Order of the Phoenix">"<i>Women! What did she want to talk about Cedric for, anyway? Why does she want to drag up a subject that makes her act like a human hosepipe?</i>"</span>
</dd><dd>&#8212;Harry angry at Cho's crying<sup class="noprint"><a href="/wiki/Harry_Potter_and_the_Order_of_the_Phoenix" title="Harry Potter and the Order of the Phoenix">[src]</a></sup>
</dd><dd></div>
</dd></dl>
<p>One of the many points that Harry fell in love with Ginny is because she was rarely weepy. This contrasts with Cho, as she cried openly for many periods of time after Cedric's death, to which left Harry at a complete loss as to what to do at such moments. Along with Cho's desire to talk about Cedric's death with Harry (to which Harry refused), Harry's confusion and awkwardness turned to sheer annoyance, and he began to lose interest in her more and more for spoiling the mood, until finally he was too irritated at her tears when she cried at how Harry insulted Marietta, and told her off rudely.
</p>
<h3><span class="mw-headline" id="Bellatrix_Lestrange">Bellatrix Lestrange</span></h3>
<div class="quote">
<dl><dd><span title="Source: Harry Potter and the Order of the Phoenix">"<i>SHE KILLED SIRIUS! SHE KILLED HIM — </i>I'LL KILL HER<i>!</i>"</span>
</dd><dd>&#8212;Harry on Bellatrix Lestrange, after she killed Sirius Black<sup class="noprint"><a href="/wiki/Harry_Potter_and_the_Order_of_the_Phoenix" title="Harry Potter and the Order of the Phoenix">[src]</a></sup>
</dd><dd></div>
</dd></dl>
<figure class="article-thumb tright show-info-icon" style="width: 140px"> 	<a href="http://vignette3.wikia.nocookie.net/harrypotter/images/0/06/Bella2.jpg/revision/latest?cb=20140623202746" 	class="image image-thumbnail" 	 	 	><img src="data:image/gif;base64,R0lGODlhAQABAIABAAAAAP///yH5BAEAAAEALAAAAAABAAEAQAICTAEAOw%3D%3D" 	 alt="Bella2"  	class="thumbimage lzy lzyPlcHld " 	 	data-image-key="Bella2.jpg" 	data-image-name="Bella2.jpg" 	 data-src="http://vignette3.wikia.nocookie.net/harrypotter/images/0/06/Bella2.jpg/revision/latest/scale-to-width/140?cb=20140623202746"  	 width="140"  	 height="210"  	 	 	 onload="if(typeof ImgLzy===&#39;object&#39;){ImgLzy.load(this)}"  	><noscript><img src="http://vignette3.wikia.nocookie.net/harrypotter/images/0/06/Bella2.jpg/revision/latest/scale-to-width/140?cb=20140623202746" 	 alt="Bella2"  	class="thumbimage " 	 	data-image-key="Bella2.jpg" 	data-image-name="Bella2.jpg" 	 	 width="140"  	 height="210"  	 	 	 	></noscript></a>  	<figcaption> 		 			<a href="/wiki/File:Bella2.jpg" class="sprite info-icon"></a> 		 		 		 			<p class="caption">Bellatrix Lestrange,  a hated enemy</p> 		 	</figcaption> </figure>
<p>Harry felt contemptuous of <a href="/wiki/Bellatrix_Lestrange" title="Bellatrix Lestrange">Bellatrix Lestrange</a> from the moment he learned of her torturing of <a href="/wiki/Alice_and_Frank_Longbottom" title="Alice and Frank Longbottom">Alice and Frank Longbottom</a>, his eyes immediately drawn to her picture wherever he saw it. Throughout their encounter in the <a href="/wiki/Battle_of_the_Department_of_Mysteries" title="Battle of the Department of Mysteries">Battle of the Department of Mysteries</a>, Bellatrix goaded Harry with sarcastic baby-talk, mocking him for falling for <a href="/wiki/Tom_Riddle" title="Tom Riddle">Lord Voldemort</a>'s ploy and traveling to the <a href="/wiki/British_Ministry_of_Magic" title="British Ministry of Magic">Ministry of Magic</a> to save his non-present <a href="/wiki/Sirius_Black" title="Sirius Black">godfather</a>. She abandoned the baby-talk, however, becoming incensed when Harry used Voldemort's name — a mark of deep disrespect in Bellatrix's eyes.
</p><p>After Bellatrix killed <a href="/wiki/Sirius_Black" title="Sirius Black">Sirius Black</a>, Harry seemed to hate her as much as, if not more than, he did Voldemort. He chased her into the <a href="/wiki/Atrium" title="Atrium">Atrium</a> of the Ministry in a fit of rage, where he tried (unsuccessfully) to torture her by use of the <a href="/wiki/Cruciatus_Curse" title="Cruciatus Curse">Cruciatus Curse</a>. He even had to restrain himself from destroying <a href="/wiki/Bellatrix_Lestrange%27s_wand" title="Bellatrix Lestrange&#39;s wand" class="mw-redirect">her wand</a>, which he managed to procure during the <a href="/wiki/Skirmish_at_Malfoy_Manor" title="Skirmish at Malfoy Manor">Skirmish at Malfoy Manor</a>. Bellatrix would later murder both <a href="/wiki/Nymphadora_Tonks" title="Nymphadora Tonks">Nymphadora Tonks</a> and <a href="/wiki/Dobby" title="Dobby">Dobby</a> the <a href="/wiki/House-elf" title="House-elf">house-elf</a> in <a href="/wiki/1998" title="1998">1998</a>, also nearly killing <a href="/wiki/Ginevra_Weasley" title="Ginevra Weasley">Ginny Weasley</a> during the second round of the <a href="/wiki/Battle_of_Hogwarts" title="Battle of Hogwarts">Battle of Hogwarts</a>. In the latter incident, Harry, who had been hurrying towards Voldemort in the <a href="/wiki/Great_Hall" title="Great Hall">Great Hall</a>, noticed the danger to Ginny's life and made a beeline for Bellatrix instead. He was beaten to her, however, by <a href="/wiki/Molly_Weasley" title="Molly Weasley">Molly Weasley</a>'s abrupt intervention.
</p><p>Though she spoke disparagingly of the fact that Harry was a <a href="/wiki/Half-blood" title="Half-blood">Half-blood</a>, and vehemently denied Harry's claims that Voldemort was the same, Bellatrix despised Harry mostly out of loyalty to her master, the man with whom she had developed an obsessive infatuation. As such, Bellatrix more or less hated anyone who challenged or threatened <a href="/wiki/Tom_Riddle" title="Tom Riddle">Lord Voldemort</a>. Regardless of his feelings, Harry recognized that Bellatrix made a fearsome opponent; while he hated her as his godfather's killer, he acknowledged that she was also a witch of "<i>prodigious</i>" skill and absolutely no conscience.
</p><p>As Harry's hate towards Bellatrix is prominent amongst the many other Death Eaters, he tends to focus on her whenever her picture was shown in the Daily Prophet, or when her name comes up. It was due to this relationship that he saw the resemblance between Bellatrix and her younger sisters, <a href="/wiki/Narcissa_Malfoy" title="Narcissa Malfoy">Narcissa</a> and <a href="/wiki/Andromeda_Tonks" title="Andromeda Tonks">Andromeda</a>, to the point of even nearly mistaking the latter for Bellatrix herself.
</p>
<h3><span class="mw-headline" id="Peter_Pettigrew">Peter Pettigrew</span></h3>
<div class="quote">
<dl><dd><span title="Source: Harry Potter and the Deathly Hallows">"<i>You're going to kill me? After I saved your life? You owe me, Wormtail </i>[...]<i> </i>"</span>
</dd><dd>&#8212;Harry to Pettigrew, reminding him that he had saved his life<sup class="noprint"><a href="/wiki/Harry_Potter_and_the_Deathly_Hallows" title="Harry Potter and the Deathly Hallows">[src]</a></sup>
</dd><dd></div>
</dd></dl>
<figure class="article-thumb tleft show-info-icon" style="width: 150px"> 	<a href="http://vignette2.wikia.nocookie.net/harrypotter/images/7/7f/Wormtail_DH1.jpg/revision/latest?cb=20140602041920" 	class="image image-thumbnail" 	 	 	><img src="data:image/gif;base64,R0lGODlhAQABAIABAAAAAP///yH5BAEAAAEALAAAAAABAAEAQAICTAEAOw%3D%3D" 	 alt="Wormtail DH1"  	class="thumbimage lzy lzyPlcHld " 	 	data-image-key="Wormtail_DH1.jpg" 	data-image-name="Wormtail DH1.jpg" 	 data-src="http://vignette2.wikia.nocookie.net/harrypotter/images/7/7f/Wormtail_DH1.jpg/revision/latest/scale-to-width/150?cb=20140602041920"  	 width="150"  	 height="222"  	 	 	 onload="if(typeof ImgLzy===&#39;object&#39;){ImgLzy.load(this)}"  	><noscript><img src="http://vignette2.wikia.nocookie.net/harrypotter/images/7/7f/Wormtail_DH1.jpg/revision/latest/scale-to-width/150?cb=20140602041920" 	 alt="Wormtail DH1"  	class="thumbimage " 	 	data-image-key="Wormtail_DH1.jpg" 	data-image-name="Wormtail DH1.jpg" 	 	 width="150"  	 height="222"  	 	 	 	></noscript></a>  	<figcaption> 		 			<a href="/wiki/File:Wormtail_DH1.jpg" class="sprite info-icon"></a> 		 		 		 			<p class="caption"><a href="/wiki/Peter_Pettigrew" title="Peter Pettigrew">Peter Pettigrew</a>, the man who betrayed his parents</p> 		 	</figcaption> </figure>
<p>Harry first heard about <a href="/wiki/Peter_Pettigrew" title="Peter Pettigrew">Peter Pettigrew</a> in <a href="/wiki/1993" title="1993">1993</a>, and he believed Pettigrew to have been a hero who had dared to confront the man who betrayed <a href="/wiki/James_and_Lily_Potter" title="James and Lily Potter">James and Lily Potter</a>, and been tragically killed as a result. Harry even compared Pettigrew to his good friend <a href="/wiki/Neville_Longbottom" title="Neville Longbottom">Neville Longbottom</a>. After <a href="/wiki/Sirius_Black" title="Sirius Black">Sirius Black</a> escaped from from <a href="/wiki/Azkaban" title="Azkaban">Azkaban</a> that same year, the alleged convict made his way to Hogwarts. Sirius supposedly had the goal of killing Harry in a crazed bid to bring <a href="/wiki/Lord_Voldemort" title="Lord Voldemort" class="mw-redirect">Lord Voldemort</a> back to power.
</p><p>Towards the end of the school year, Black managed to pull <a href="/wiki/Ronald_Weasley" title="Ronald Weasley">Ron Weasley</a> through the <a href="/wiki/Whomping_Willow" title="Whomping Willow">Whomping Willow</a> and in to the <a href="/wiki/Shrieking_Shack" title="Shrieking Shack">Shrieking Shack</a>, followed closely by <a href="/wiki/Hermione_Granger" title="Hermione Granger">Hermione Granger</a> and an incensed Harry. When they were joined shortly after by <a href="/wiki/Remus_Lupin" title="Remus Lupin">Remus Lupin</a>, he and Sirius revealed a completely different truth: Pettigrew had been the one to betray Harry's parents, and had subsequently framed Sirius by pretending to confront him, then faked his own death by cutting off one of his own fingers and hiding in his unregistered <a href="/wiki/Animagus" title="Animagus">Animagus</a> form as Ron's pet rat, <a href="/wiki/Peter_Pettigrew" title="Peter Pettigrew">Scabbers</a>. Although Harry was disgusted by Pettigrew's disloyalty and cowardice, he convinced Sirius and Remus not to become murderers, and instead force Pettigrew to face justice in the hands of the Dementors. Though Pettigrew escaped, making it impossible to prove Sirius Black's innocence, Harry's decision to spare his life was not fruitless: Pettigrew owed Harry a <a href="/wiki/Life_debt" title="Life debt">Life debt</a>.
</p><p>Pettigrew, who had fled to <a href="/wiki/Albania" title="Albania">Albania</a> and sought protection from Sirius in the service of Lord Voldemort, returned to <a href="/wiki/Great_Britain" title="Great Britain">Great Britain</a> in <a href="/wiki/1994" title="1994">1994</a>. After Harry and <a href="/wiki/Cedric_Diggory" title="Cedric Diggory">Cedric Diggory</a> were transported to the <a href="/wiki/Little_Hangleton_graveyard" title="Little Hangleton graveyard">Little Hangleton graveyard</a> following the end of the <a href="/wiki/Triwizard_Tournament" title="Triwizard Tournament">Triwizard Tournament</a>, Pettigrew murdered Cedric, bound Harry to the grave of <a href="/wiki/Tom_Riddle_Sr." title="Tom Riddle Sr.">Tom Riddle Sr.</a>, and concocted a <a href="/wiki/Regeneration_Potion" title="Regeneration Potion" class="mw-redirect">potion</a> using the senior Riddle's bones, one of Pettigrew's own hands, and Harry's blood, to return Voldemort to physical form. When instructed by Voldemort to give Harry back <a href="/wiki/Harry_Potter%27s_wand" title="Harry Potter&#39;s wand">his wand</a>, Pettigrew did so without looking at him.
</p><p>In 1998, during the <a href="/wiki/Skirmish_at_Malfoy_Manor" title="Skirmish at Malfoy Manor">Skirmish at Malfoy Manor</a>, Peter Pettigrew's life debt was repaid; Harry reminded him that he had saved his life, and Pettigrew momentarily hesitated in the midst of attempting to strangle him. As a result, the <a href="/wiki/Peter_Pettigrew%27s_silver_hand" title="Peter Pettigrew&#39;s silver hand">silver hand</a> Voldemort had made for Pettigrew, as a reward for sacrificing his own, saw the hesitation as sign of weakness, and turned against him. Though Ron and Harry both tried to save him, the hand ultimately strangled Pettigrew to death.
</p>
<h3><span class="mw-headline" id="Dolores_Umbridge">Dolores Umbridge</span></h3>
<div class="quote">
<dl><dd><span title="Source: Harry Potter and the Order of the Phoenix (film)">"<i>As I told you once before, Mr Potter, naughty children deserve to be punished.</i>"</span>
</dd><dd>&#8212;Umbridge speaking to Harry<sup class="noprint"><a href="/wiki/Harry_Potter_and_the_Order_of_the_Phoenix_(film)" title="Harry Potter and the Order of the Phoenix (film)">[src]</a></sup>
</dd><dd></div>
</dd></dl>
<figure class="article-thumb tright show-info-icon" style="width: 145px"> 	<a href="http://vignette4.wikia.nocookie.net/harrypotter/images/6/68/Dolores_Umbridge_Deathly_Hallows_promotional_image.jpg/revision/latest?cb=20101127041001" 	class="image image-thumbnail" 	 	 	><img src="data:image/gif;base64,R0lGODlhAQABAIABAAAAAP///yH5BAEAAAEALAAAAAABAAEAQAICTAEAOw%3D%3D" 	 alt="Dolores Umbridge Deathly Hallows promotional image"  	class="thumbimage lzy lzyPlcHld " 	 	data-image-key="Dolores_Umbridge_Deathly_Hallows_promotional_image.jpg" 	data-image-name="Dolores Umbridge Deathly Hallows promotional image.jpg" 	 data-src="http://vignette4.wikia.nocookie.net/harrypotter/images/6/68/Dolores_Umbridge_Deathly_Hallows_promotional_image.jpg/revision/latest/scale-to-width/145?cb=20101127041001"  	 width="145"  	 height="191"  	 	 	 onload="if(typeof ImgLzy===&#39;object&#39;){ImgLzy.load(this)}"  	><noscript><img src="http://vignette4.wikia.nocookie.net/harrypotter/images/6/68/Dolores_Umbridge_Deathly_Hallows_promotional_image.jpg/revision/latest/scale-to-width/145?cb=20101127041001" 	 alt="Dolores Umbridge Deathly Hallows promotional image"  	class="thumbimage " 	 	data-image-key="Dolores_Umbridge_Deathly_Hallows_promotional_image.jpg" 	data-image-name="Dolores Umbridge Deathly Hallows promotional image.jpg" 	 	 width="145"  	 height="191"  	 	 	 	></noscript></a>  	<figcaption> 		 			<a href="/wiki/File:Dolores_Umbridge_Deathly_Hallows_promotional_image.jpg" class="sprite info-icon"></a> 		 		 		 			<p class="caption">Dolores Umbridge, his previous <a href="/wiki/Defence_Against_the_Dark_Arts" title="Defence Against the Dark Arts">Defence Against the Dark Arts</a> professor and enemy</p> 		 	</figcaption> </figure>
<p>Harry disliked <a href="/wiki/Senior_Undersecretary_to_the_Minister_for_Magic" title="Senior Undersecretary to the Minister for Magic">Senior Undersecretary to the Minister for Magic</a>, <a href="/wiki/Dolores_Umbridge" title="Dolores Umbridge">Dolores Umbridge</a>, from the moment he first laid eyes on her, which was shortly before she voted in favour of Harry's undeserved expulsion from <a href="/wiki/Hogwarts_School_of_Witchcraft_and_Wizardry" title="Hogwarts School of Witchcraft and Wizardry">Hogwarts</a>; her voice made the hair on the back of his neck stand up, and his hate for her boiled for reasons he could not explain at first. In the summer of <a href="/wiki/1995" title="1995">1995</a>, Umbridge sent two <a href="/wiki/Dementor" title="Dementor">Dementors</a> after Harry and his cousin, <a href="/wiki/Dudley_Dursley" title="Dudley Dursley">Dudley Dursley</a>, in an attempt to silence Harry from contradicting the <a href="/wiki/British_Ministry_of_Magic" title="British Ministry of Magic">Ministry of Magic</a>'s official position maintaining that <a href="/wiki/Tom_Riddle" title="Tom Riddle">Lord Voldemort</a> had not returned to power. Harry was forced to use a <a href="/wiki/Patronus_Charm" title="Patronus Charm">Patronus</a> to defend himself and Dudley from the Dementors, which resulted in Harry being summoned to the Ministry on the charge of using under-age magic; if convicted, he would have been expelled from Hogwarts. Umbridge took part in Harry’s prosecution and spoke in favour of his conviction, but Harry was cleared due to <a href="/wiki/Albus_Dumbledore" title="Albus Dumbledore">Albus Dumbledore</a>’s defence, as well as the impartiality of <a href="/wiki/Amelia_Bones" title="Amelia Bones">Amelia Bones</a> and several other members of the <a href="/wiki/Wizengamot" title="Wizengamot">Wizengamot</a>. Though Harry was triumphant in his clearance, Umbridge kept glaring at him after leaving the courtroom, and he felt resentment for her voting his guilt.
</p>
<div class="quote">
<dl><dd><span title="Source: Harry Potter and the Order of the Phoenix">"<i>Harry felt a strong urge to swing around and seize her by the throat</i>"</span>
</dd><dd>&#8212;Harry Potter furious at Umbridge for calling <a href="/wiki/Rubeus_Hagrid" title="Rubeus Hagrid">Rubeus Hagrid</a> a "great half-breed oaf"<sup class="noprint"><a href="/wiki/Harry_Potter_and_the_Order_of_the_Phoenix" title="Harry Potter and the Order of the Phoenix">[src]</a></sup>
</dd><dd></div>
</dd></dl>
<p>Harry soon encountered Umbridge again when she was appointed <a href="/wiki/Defence_Against_the_Dark_Arts" title="Defence Against the Dark Arts">Defence Against the Dark Arts</a> teacher at Hogwarts, by the <a href="/wiki/British_Ministry_of_Magic" title="British Ministry of Magic">Ministry</a>. Harry was outspoken in his outrage at the Ministry's denial of Voldemort's return and their refusal to allow Hogwarts students to practise defensive magic, which Umbridge sadistically responded to by making him carve the words, "<i>I must not tell lies</i>", into the back of his own hand using a <a href="/wiki/Blood_Quill" title="Blood Quill" class="mw-redirect">Blood Quill</a>. Umbridge clearly favoured <a href="/wiki/Slytherin" title="Slytherin">Slytherin</a> students, and presumably those who had ties to the Ministry in particular, as demonstrated by her allowing the <a href="/wiki/Slytherin_Quidditch_team" title="Slytherin Quidditch team">Slytherin Quidditch team</a> to re-form before any other, following the passage of <a href="/wiki/Educational_Decree_Number_Twenty-Four" title="Educational Decree Number Twenty-Four">Educational Decree Number Twenty-Four</a>, and later giving Harry and the <a href="/wiki/Fred_Weasley" title="Fred Weasley">Fred Weasley</a> and <a href="/wiki/George_Weasley" title="George Weasley">George Weasley</a> lifetime bans from playing <a href="/wiki/Quidditch" title="Quidditch">Quidditch</a> after they attacked <a href="/wiki/Draco_Malfoy" title="Draco Malfoy">Draco Malfoy</a>.
</p>
<figure class="article-thumb tleft show-info-icon" style="width: 245px"> 	<a href="http://vignette1.wikia.nocookie.net/harrypotter/images/a/a9/Blood_quill.gif/revision/latest?cb=20140912015019" 	class="image image-thumbnail" 	 	 	><img src="data:image/gif;base64,R0lGODlhAQABAIABAAAAAP///yH5BAEAAAEALAAAAAABAAEAQAICTAEAOw%3D%3D" 	 alt="Blood quill"  	class="thumbimage lzy lzyPlcHld " 	 	data-image-key="Blood_quill.gif" 	data-image-name="Blood quill.gif" 	 data-src="http://vignette1.wikia.nocookie.net/harrypotter/images/a/a9/Blood_quill.gif/revision/latest?cb=20140912015019"  	 width="245"  	 height="125"  	 	 	 onload="if(typeof ImgLzy===&#39;object&#39;){ImgLzy.load(this)}"  	><noscript><img src="http://vignette1.wikia.nocookie.net/harrypotter/images/a/a9/Blood_quill.gif/revision/latest?cb=20140912015019" 	 alt="Blood quill"  	class="thumbimage " 	 	data-image-key="Blood_quill.gif" 	data-image-name="Blood quill.gif" 	 	 width="245"  	 height="125"  	 	 	 	></noscript></a>  	<figcaption> 		 			<a href="/wiki/File:Blood_quill.gif" class="sprite info-icon"></a> 		 		 		 			<p class="caption">Harry's hand due to Umbridge's punishments with the <a href="/wiki/Blood_quill" title="Blood quill" class="mw-redirect">Blood quill</a></p> 		 	</figcaption> </figure>
<p>Umbridge monitored all incoming and outgoing mail, resulting in the injury of Harry’s owl, <a href="/wiki/Hedwig" title="Hedwig">Hedwig</a>, and she made it nearly impossible for Harry, <a href="/wiki/Ronald_Weasley" title="Ronald Weasley">Ron</a> and <a href="/wiki/Hermione_Granger" title="Hermione Granger">Hermione</a> to visit <a href="/wiki/Rubeus_Hagrid" title="Rubeus Hagrid">Hagrid</a> at his <a href="/wiki/Hagrid%27s_Hut" title="Hagrid&#39;s Hut">hut</a>. When Harry publicly recounted witnessing Voldemort's resurrection in an interview with <a href="/wiki/Rita_Skeeter" title="Rita Skeeter">Rita Skeeter</a>, published in <a href="/wiki/The_Quibbler" title="The Quibbler">The Quibbler</a>, Umbridge banned him from <a href="/wiki/Hogsmeade" title="Hogsmeade">Hogsmeade</a> trips. One by one, Umbridge was robbing Harry of his reasons to want to stay at Hogwarts.
In order to offer students the practical defensive education Umbridge was denying them, Harry formed and led <a href="/wiki/Dumbledore%27s_Army" title="Dumbledore&#39;s Army">Dumbledore's Army</a>. When they were betrayed to Umbridge by <a href="/wiki/Marietta_Edgecombe" title="Marietta Edgecombe">one</a> of their members, Harry was nearly expelled from Hogwarts until Dumbledore convinced <a href="/wiki/Cornelius_Fudge" title="Cornelius Fudge">Cornelius Fudge</a> that Harry only formed the organisation on his orders. Dumbledore was forced to leave Hogwarts to avoid being sent to <a href="/wiki/Azkaban" title="Azkaban">Azkaban</a>, after which Umbridge took the position of Headmistress and the students took to making things as difficult for her as possible.
</p><p>Umbridge attempted to have <a href="/wiki/Rubeus_Hagrid" title="Rubeus Hagrid">Hagrid</a> arrested after a couple of <a href="/wiki/Niffler" title="Niffler">Nifflers</a> were released in her office, despite his obvious innocence, which resulted in his going on the run and Professor <a href="/wiki/Minerva_McGonagall" title="Minerva McGonagall">McGonagall</a> being seriously injured and temporarily disabled at <a href="/wiki/St_Mungo%27s_Hospital_for_Magical_Maladies_and_Injuries" title="St Mungo&#39;s Hospital for Magical Maladies and Injuries">St Mungo's Hospital</a>. With seemingly no adults left for him to turn to, Harry attempted to use Umbridge’s fire, the only fire not being monitored by the Ministry, to check on <a href="/wiki/Sirius_Black" title="Sirius Black">Sirius Black</a>, after having a vision that Sirius was being tortured in the <a href="/wiki/Department_of_Mysteries" title="Department of Mysteries">Department of Mysteries</a>. Remembering that <a href="/wiki/Severus_Snape" title="Severus Snape">Severus Snape</a> was, in fact, a member of the <a href="/wiki/Order_of_the_Phoenix" title="Order of the Phoenix">Order of the Phoenix</a>, Harry gave Snape the cryptic message, "<i>he's got Padfoot at the place where it's hidden!</i>" Umbridge nearly used the <a href="/wiki/Cruciatus_Curse" title="Cruciatus Curse">Cruciatus Curse</a> on Harry in order to make him explain his statement, when Hermione intervened and tricked Umbridge into believing the D.A. had been building a weapon for Dumbledore in the <a href="/wiki/Forbidden_Forest" title="Forbidden Forest">Forbidden Forest</a>. When Harry, Hermione, and Umbridge were confronted by a herd of <a href="/wiki/Forbidden_Forest_Centaur_colony" title="Forbidden Forest Centaur colony">centaurs</a>, Umbridge's angry diatribe — in which she referred to the centaurs as "<i>creatures of near-human intelligence</i>" and "<i>filthy half-breeds</i>" — resulted in her being carried off into the depths of the forest.
</p><p>After the Ministry finally acknowledged Voldemort’s return to power, Umbridge was removed from Hogwarts. However, Harry was furious to learn later that year that Umbridge was still working for the Ministry. When Voldemort became the de facto Minister for Magic, with an <a href="/wiki/Imperius_Curse" title="Imperius Curse">imperiused</a> <a href="/wiki/Pius_Thicknesse" title="Pius Thicknesse">Pius Thicknesse</a> as his puppet, Umbridge, knowingly or not, immediately showed sympathy for his agenda by taking part in the hunt for Harry Potter and branding him "Undesirable Number 1<i>.</i>" When Harry, disguised as <a href="/wiki/Albert_Runcorn" title="Albert Runcorn">Albert Runcorn</a> by way of <a href="/wiki/Polyjuice_Potion" title="Polyjuice Potion">Polyjuice Potion</a>, met Umbridge again in <a href="/wiki/1997" title="1997">1997</a>, she had become Head of the <a href="/wiki/Muggle-Born_Registration_Commission" title="Muggle-Born Registration Commission">Muggle-Born Registration Commission</a>, and was cruelly interrogating and "trying" innocent Muggle-born wizards and witches, before sentencing them to <a href="/wiki/Azkaban" title="Azkaban">Azkaban</a> for "stealing magic". When Umbridge taunted a Muggle-born <a href="/wiki/Mary_Cattermole" title="Mary Cattermole">witch</a> by claiming <a href="/wiki/Salazar_Slytherin%27s_locket" title="Salazar Slytherin&#39;s locket">Salazar Slytherin's locket</a> was a family heirloom and proof of her relation to the <a href="/wiki/Pure-blood" title="Pure-blood">pure-blood</a> <a href="/wiki/Selwyn_family" title="Selwyn family">Selwyn family</a>, Harry <a href="/wiki/Stunning_Spell" title="Stunning Spell">stunned</a> Umbridge in a fit of anger. Hermione replaced the locket with a <a href="/wiki/Geminio" title="Geminio" class="mw-redirect">decoy</a>, after which she, Ron, and Harry proceeded to free all the Muggle-borns awaiting interrogation.
</p><p>After the Second Wizarding War, Umbridge was given a life sentence in <a href="/wiki/Azkaban" title="Azkaban">Azkaban</a> in regards to her crimes against humanity.
</p>
<h3><span class="mw-headline" id="Hedwig">Hedwig</span></h3>
<div class="quote">
<dl><dd><span title="Source: Harry Potter and the Deathly Hallows">"<i>No... NO! Hedwig... Hedwig...</i>"</span>
</dd><dd>&#8212;Harry to Hedwig, after her death<sup class="noprint"><a href="/wiki/Harry_Potter_and_the_Deathly_Hallows" title="Harry Potter and the Deathly Hallows">[src]</a></sup>
</dd><dd></div>
</dd></dl>
<figure class="article-thumb tright show-info-icon" style="width: 214px"> 	<a href="http://vignette3.wikia.nocookie.net/harrypotter/images/a/aa/83f8f8c1935a3da9cc8d9ba361ba3013.jpg/revision/latest?cb=20140521135422" 	class="image image-thumbnail" 	 	 	><img src="data:image/gif;base64,R0lGODlhAQABAIABAAAAAP///yH5BAEAAAEALAAAAAABAAEAQAICTAEAOw%3D%3D" 	 alt="83f8f8c1935a3da9cc8d9ba361ba3013"  	class="thumbimage lzy lzyPlcHld " 	 	data-image-key="83f8f8c1935a3da9cc8d9ba361ba3013.jpg" 	data-image-name="83f8f8c1935a3da9cc8d9ba361ba3013.jpg" 	 data-src="http://vignette3.wikia.nocookie.net/harrypotter/images/a/aa/83f8f8c1935a3da9cc8d9ba361ba3013.jpg/revision/latest?cb=20140521135422"  	 width="214"  	 height="165"  	 	 	 onload="if(typeof ImgLzy===&#39;object&#39;){ImgLzy.load(this)}"  	><noscript><img src="http://vignette3.wikia.nocookie.net/harrypotter/images/a/aa/83f8f8c1935a3da9cc8d9ba361ba3013.jpg/revision/latest?cb=20140521135422" 	 alt="83f8f8c1935a3da9cc8d9ba361ba3013"  	class="thumbimage " 	 	data-image-key="83f8f8c1935a3da9cc8d9ba361ba3013.jpg" 	data-image-name="83f8f8c1935a3da9cc8d9ba361ba3013.jpg" 	 	 width="214"  	 height="165"  	 	 	 	></noscript></a>  	<figcaption> 		 			<a href="/wiki/File:83f8f8c1935a3da9cc8d9ba361ba3013.jpg" class="sprite info-icon"></a> 		 		 		 			<p class="caption">Harry with Hedwig, his loyal and loving pet owl</p> 		 	</figcaption> </figure>
<p><a href="/wiki/Hedwig" title="Hedwig">Hedwig</a> was the Snowy <a href="/wiki/Owl" title="Owl">owl</a> <a href="/wiki/Rubeus_Hagrid" title="Rubeus Hagrid">Hagrid</a> bought Harry for his <a href="/wiki/1991" title="1991">eleventh birthday</a>, from <a href="/wiki/Eeylops_Owl_Emporium" title="Eeylops Owl Emporium">Eeylops Owl Emporium</a> in <a href="/wiki/Diagon_Alley" title="Diagon Alley">Diagon Alley</a>. Hedwig was often Harry's only companion during the lonely holidays he spent with the <a href="/wiki/Dursley_family" title="Dursley family">Dursleys</a>, and the bond that developed between them was a close one. Though Hedwig was usually very affectionate with Harry, which she showed by gently nibbling his ear or fingers, she was not above snubbing him out of jealousy or nipping him a bit harder than usual on the rare occasions he snapped at her.
</p><p>Hedwig was also highly intelligent; she understood perfectly when Harry asked her to peck Ron and Hermione until they responded to him, and even flew, completely of her own accord, to where Hermione was on holiday in France, to ensure that Harry received a gift for his thirteenth birthday. In 1997, Harry was completely grief-stricken after Hedwig was struck by a <a href="/wiki/Killing_Curse" title="Killing Curse">Killing Curse</a> during the <a href="/wiki/Battle_of_the_Seven_Potters" title="Battle of the Seven Potters">Battle of the Seven Potters</a>.
</p>
<h3><span class="mw-headline" id="Alastor_Moody">Alastor Moody</span></h3>
<div class="quote">
<dl><dd><span title="Source: Harry Potter and the Deathly Hallows">"<i>Mad-Eye dead; it could not be... Mad-Eye, so tough, so brave, the consummate survivor </i>[...]<i> </i>"</span>
</dd><dd>&#8212;Harry thinking about Mad Eye's death<sup class="noprint"><a href="/wiki/Harry_Potter_and_the_Deathly_Hallows" title="Harry Potter and the Deathly Hallows">[src]</a></sup>
</dd><dd></div>
</dd></dl>
<figure class="article-thumb tleft show-info-icon" style="width: 141px"> 	<a href="http://vignette3.wikia.nocookie.net/harrypotter/images/1/10/Alastor_Moody_Profile.JPG/revision/latest?cb=20081103144159" 	class="image image-thumbnail" 	 	 	><img src="data:image/gif;base64,R0lGODlhAQABAIABAAAAAP///yH5BAEAAAEALAAAAAABAAEAQAICTAEAOw%3D%3D" 	 alt="Alastor Moody Profile"  	class="thumbimage lzy lzyPlcHld " 	 	data-image-key="Alastor_Moody_Profile.JPG" 	data-image-name="Alastor Moody Profile.JPG" 	 data-src="http://vignette3.wikia.nocookie.net/harrypotter/images/1/10/Alastor_Moody_Profile.JPG/revision/latest/scale-to-width/141?cb=20081103144159"  	 width="141"  	 height="219"  	 	 	 onload="if(typeof ImgLzy===&#39;object&#39;){ImgLzy.load(this)}"  	><noscript><img src="http://vignette3.wikia.nocookie.net/harrypotter/images/1/10/Alastor_Moody_Profile.JPG/revision/latest/scale-to-width/141?cb=20081103144159" 	 alt="Alastor Moody Profile"  	class="thumbimage " 	 	data-image-key="Alastor_Moody_Profile.JPG" 	data-image-name="Alastor Moody Profile.JPG" 	 	 width="141"  	 height="219"  	 	 	 	></noscript></a>  	<figcaption> 		 			<a href="/wiki/File:Alastor_Moody_Profile.JPG" class="sprite info-icon"></a> 		 		 		 			<p class="caption">Alastor Moody, his protector and friend</p> 		 	</figcaption> </figure>
<p>Harry first saw the real <a href="/wiki/Alastor_Moody" title="Alastor Moody">Alastor "Mad-Eye" Moody</a> shortly after <a href="/wiki/Bartemius_Crouch_Jr." title="Bartemius Crouch Jr.">Barty Crouch Jr.</a> was revealed to have been keeping Moody imprisoned in his own <a href="/wiki/Alastor_Moody%27s_trunk" title="Alastor Moody&#39;s trunk" class="mw-redirect">trunk</a>, using his hair for <a href="/wiki/Polyjuice_Potion" title="Polyjuice Potion">Polyjuice Potion</a>, and taking Moody's place as temporary <a href="/wiki/Defence_Against_the_Dark_Arts" title="Defence Against the Dark Arts">Defence Against the Dark Arts</a> teacher at Hogwarts for most of the <a href="/wiki/1994%E2%80%931995_school_year" title="1994–1995 school year">1994–1995 school year</a>.
</p><p>The real Moody brought the <a href="/wiki/Advance_Guard" title="Advance Guard">Advance Guard</a> of the <a href="/wiki/Order_of_the_Phoenix" title="Order of the Phoenix">Order of the Phoenix</a> to <a href="/wiki/Privet_Drive" title="Privet Drive">Privet Drive</a> in <a href="/wiki/1995" title="1995">1995</a>, to safely transport Harry to the Order's headquarters, and <a href="/wiki/Sirius_Black" title="Sirius Black">Sirius Black</a>'s ancestral home, at <a href="/wiki/12_Grimmauld_Place" title="12 Grimmauld Place">12 Grimmauld Place</a>. As Harry got to know Moody through his time spent around the Order, Moody proved every bit the great, albeit incredibly paranoid, wizard he was reputed to be. When Moody was killed by <a href="/wiki/Tom_Riddle" title="Tom Riddle">Voldemort</a> during the <a href="/wiki/Battle_of_the_Seven_Potters" title="Battle of the Seven Potters">Battle of the Seven Potters</a>, Harry was shocked and horrified by the abrupt end of such a skilled Auror, and shared a drink in his honour with the rest of the Order.
</p><p>When Harry, <a href="/wiki/Ronald_Weasley" title="Ronald Weasley">Ron</a> and <a href="/wiki/Hermione_Granger" title="Hermione Granger">Hermione</a> infiltrated the <a href="/wiki/British_Ministry_of_Magic" title="British Ministry of Magic">Ministry of Magic</a> in 1997, to steal <a href="/wiki/Salazar_Slytherin" title="Salazar Slytherin">Salazar Slytherin</a>'s locket from <a href="/wiki/Dolores_Umbridge" title="Dolores Umbridge">Dolores Umbridge</a>, Harry found Moody's <a href="/wiki/Alastor_Moody%27s_magical_eye" title="Alastor Moody&#39;s magical eye">magical eye</a> lodged in the door to Umbridge's office. Harry reclaimed the eye, though doing so ended up alerting the Ministry to the breach in security, and later buried it under "<i>the oldest, most gnarled and resilient-looking</i>" tree he could find, marking the spot with a small cross. Little though it was, Harry was certain Moody would prefer it to having his eye put to use spying for Dolores Umbridge.
</p>
<h3><span class="mw-headline" id="Cedric_Diggory">Cedric Diggory</span></h3>
<div class="quote">
<dl><dd><span title="Source: Harry Potter and the Goblet of Fire"><b>Cedric</b>: "<i>You saved my life, Harry. Take the cup.</i>"
</dd><dd><b>Harry</b>: "<i>We'll take it together.</i>"</span>
