</dd><dd>&#8212; Cedric and Harry about who should win the Triwizard Tournament<sup class="noprint"><a href="/wiki/Harry_Potter_and_the_Goblet_of_Fire" title="Harry Potter and the Goblet of Fire">[src]</a></sup>
</dd></dl>
</div>
<figure class="article-thumb tright show-info-icon" style="width: 132px"> 	<a href="http://vignette4.wikia.nocookie.net/harrypotter/images/c/c5/Cedric.jpg/revision/latest?cb=20111015180904" 	class="image image-thumbnail" 	 	 	><img src="data:image/gif;base64,R0lGODlhAQABAIABAAAAAP///yH5BAEAAAEALAAAAAABAAEAQAICTAEAOw%3D%3D" 	 alt="Cedric"  	class="thumbimage lzy lzyPlcHld " 	 	data-image-key="Cedric.jpg" 	data-image-name="Cedric.jpg" 	 data-src="http://vignette4.wikia.nocookie.net/harrypotter/images/c/c5/Cedric.jpg/revision/latest/scale-to-width/132?cb=20111015180904"  	 width="132"  	 height="228"  	 	 	 onload="if(typeof ImgLzy===&#39;object&#39;){ImgLzy.load(this)}"  	><noscript><img src="http://vignette4.wikia.nocookie.net/harrypotter/images/c/c5/Cedric.jpg/revision/latest/scale-to-width/132?cb=20111015180904" 	 alt="Cedric"  	class="thumbimage " 	 	data-image-key="Cedric.jpg" 	data-image-name="Cedric.jpg" 	 	 width="132"  	 height="228"  	 	 	 	></noscript></a>  	<figcaption> 		 			<a href="/wiki/File:Cedric.jpg" class="sprite info-icon"></a> 		 		 		 			<p class="caption">Cedric Diggory, his friend</p> 		 	</figcaption> </figure>
<p>Harry and <a href="/wiki/Cedric_Diggory" title="Cedric Diggory">Cedric Diggory</a>, were, for better or worse, rivals throughout Harry's <a href="/wiki/1993-1994_school_year" title="1993-1994 school year" class="mw-redirect">third</a> and <a href="/wiki/1994-1995_school_year" title="1994-1995 school year" class="mw-redirect">fourth</a> years at Hogwarts. As Cedric was seeker of the <a href="/wiki/Hufflepuff_Quidditch_team" title="Hufflepuff Quidditch team">Hufflepuff Quidditch team</a>, one of their first encounters involved Cedric catching the <a href="/wiki/Golden_Snitch" title="Golden Snitch">snitch</a> and securing the win for his team, while Harry fell off his <a href="/wiki/Broomstick" title="Broomstick">broomstick</a> after one of the <a href="/wiki/Dementor" title="Dementor">Dementors</a> guarding the school found its way onto the Quidditch field.
</p><p>The next year, when both Harry and Cedric were declared Champions in the <a href="/wiki/Triwizard_Tournament" title="Triwizard Tournament">Triwizard Tournament</a>, Cedric was the school's obvious favourite, as most of the students believed Harry had entered the competition illegally. Cedric also believed Harry had entered illegally and asked him how he managed to do it, but Cedric did not hate Harry for this, as much of the school did. Though the negative attention abated slightly after Harry's stellar performance in the first task, Cedric also beat Harry to the punch in asking <a href="/wiki/Cho_Chang" title="Cho Chang">Cho Chang</a> to the <a href="/wiki/Yule_Ball" title="Yule Ball">Yule Ball</a>. And although Cedric remained good-natured and gracious throughout, Harry could not help feeling jealous, and even slightly insecure about the fact that Cedric "looked the part" of a Champion.
</p><p>Regardless, when <a href="/wiki/Rubeus_Hagrid" title="Rubeus Hagrid">Hagrid</a> showed Harry that the Tournament's first task would involve facing <a href="/wiki/Dragon" title="Dragon">dragons</a>, Harry felt compelled to help Cedric, realising he alone would be unprepared, as both Heads of other the two competing schools had seen the dragons as well. Cedric reciprocated by helping Harry with the second task, and during the third, each had occasion to save the other's life. As, such, when they reached the <a href="/wiki/Triwizard_Cup" title="Triwizard Cup">Triwizard Cup</a> at the same time, they agreed to take it together; both boys were transported to the <a href="/wiki/Little_Hangleton_graveyard" title="Little Hangleton graveyard">Little Hangleton graveyard</a>, and Harry watched in horror as <a href="/wiki/Peter_Pettigrew" title="Peter Pettigrew">Peter Pettigrew</a> murdered Cedric on Voldemort's command to "<i>kill the spare.</i>" When Cedric's ghostly image emerged from Voldemort's wand, which was locked in <a href="/wiki/Priori_Incantatem" title="Priori Incantatem">Priori Incantatem</a> with Harry's, he asked Harry to take his body back to his parents, which Harry honoured, risking his life in the process.
</p><p>Cedric's death haunted Harry's dreams well into the summer, as <a href="/wiki/Dudley_Dursley" title="Dudley Dursley">Dudley</a> mockingly asked him if "Cedric" was his boyfriend, and enabled Harry to see <a href="/wiki/Thestral" title="Thestral">Thestrals</a> for the first time at the beginning of his <a href="/wiki/1995%E2%80%931996_school_year" title="1995–1996 school year">fifth</a> year.
</p><p>Having witnessed Cedric's death firsthand made Harry feel very distraught throughout the following year, and aside from Ron and Hermione, he refused to talk about it with anyone else, as he rebuked <a href="/wiki/Zacharias_Smith" title="Zacharias Smith">Zacharias Smith</a>'s demands for more details, and even when a tearful Cho asked of it.
</p>
<h3><span class="mw-headline" id="Kreacher">Kreacher</span></h3>
<div class="quote">
<dl><dd><span title="Source: Harry Potter and the Deathly Hallows">"<i>Kreacher... er... I would like to give you this </i>[...]<i> </i>"</span>
</dd><dd>&#8212;Harry, giving Regulus Black's locket to Kreacher<sup class="noprint"><a href="/wiki/Harry_Potter_and_the_Deathly_Hallows" title="Harry Potter and the Deathly Hallows">[src]</a></sup>
</dd><dd></div>
</dd></dl>
<figure class="article-thumb tleft show-info-icon" style="width: 195px"> 	<a href="http://vignette4.wikia.nocookie.net/harrypotter/images/7/70/Kreacher%2C_House-elf._.jpg/revision/latest?cb=20130907032643" 	class="image image-thumbnail" 	 	 	><img src="data:image/gif;base64,R0lGODlhAQABAIABAAAAAP///yH5BAEAAAEALAAAAAABAAEAQAICTAEAOw%3D%3D" 	 alt="Kreacher, House-elf."  	class="thumbimage lzy lzyPlcHld " 	 	data-image-key="Kreacher%2C_House-elf._.jpg" 	data-image-name="Kreacher, House-elf. .jpg" 	 data-src="http://vignette4.wikia.nocookie.net/harrypotter/images/7/70/Kreacher%2C_House-elf._.jpg/revision/latest/scale-to-width/195?cb=20130907032643"  	 width="195"  	 height="161"  	 	 	 onload="if(typeof ImgLzy===&#39;object&#39;){ImgLzy.load(this)}"  	><noscript><img src="http://vignette4.wikia.nocookie.net/harrypotter/images/7/70/Kreacher%2C_House-elf._.jpg/revision/latest/scale-to-width/195?cb=20130907032643" 	 alt="Kreacher, House-elf."  	class="thumbimage " 	 	data-image-key="Kreacher%2C_House-elf._.jpg" 	data-image-name="Kreacher, House-elf. .jpg" 	 	 width="195"  	 height="161"  	 	 	 	></noscript></a>  	<figcaption> 		 			<a href="/wiki/File:Kreacher,_House-elf._.jpg" class="sprite info-icon"></a> 		 		 		 			<p class="caption">Kreacher, his loyal house-elf</p> 		 	</figcaption> </figure>
<p><a href="/wiki/Kreacher" title="Kreacher">Kreacher</a> was the last in a line of <a href="/wiki/House-elf" title="House-elf">house-elves</a> who served the <a href="/wiki/House_of_Black" title="House of Black">Black family</a>, inherited by <a href="/wiki/Sirius_Black" title="Sirius Black">Sirius Black</a>, and eventually by Harry. In his fanatical loyalty to the House of Black, Kreacher mimicked the family's <a href="/wiki/Pure-blood" title="Pure-blood">Pure-blood</a> supremacist views, and as such, despised Sirius for being a "blood traitor" and for supposedly breaking <a href="/wiki/Walburga_Black" title="Walburga Black">his mother's</a> heart. By extension, he hated, and muttered profanities about, anyone associated with Sirius, particularly Harry and the motley crew of blood statuses that made up the rest of the <a href="/wiki/Order_of_the_Phoenix" title="Order of the Phoenix">Order of the Phoenix</a>.
</p><p>For his part, Sirius saw too much of the family he hated in Kreacher, and had no problem treating Kreacher with utter disdain. After the <a href="/wiki/Battle_of_the_Department_of_Mysteries" title="Battle of the Department of Mysteries">Battle of the Department of Mysteries</a>, Harry learned that Kreacher had helped trick Harry into going to the <a href="/wiki/British_Ministry_of_Magic" title="British Ministry of Magic">Ministry of Magic</a> by pretending Sirius was not at Grimmauld Place when Harry tried to find him, and thus helped bring about Sirius's end. In his will, Sirius left everything he owned to Harry, including Kreacher. As Harry wanted nothing to do with the house-elf, but couldn't risk setting him free and letting any information Kreacher had about the Order fall into the hands of the <a href="/wiki/Lestrange_family" title="Lestrange family">Lestranges</a> or the <a href="/wiki/Malfoy_family" title="Malfoy family">Malfoys</a>, he sent Kreacher to work in the Hogwarts' kitchens.
</p><p>In <a href="/wiki/1997" title="1997">1997</a>, when Harry, Ron and Hermione hid in <a href="/wiki/12_Grimmauld_Place" title="12 Grimmauld Place">12 Grimmauld Place</a> at the start of their hunt for Voldemort's <a href="/wiki/Horcrux" title="Horcrux">Horcruxes</a>, they discovered that "R.A.B" stood for <a href="/wiki/Regulus_Black" title="Regulus Black">Regulus Arcturus Black</a>, and Harry remembered actually having seen and tried to open <a href="/wiki/Salazar_Slytherin%27s_Locket" title="Salazar Slytherin&#39;s Locket" class="mw-redirect">Salazar Slytherin's Locket</a> in the summer of <a href="/wiki/1995" title="1995">1995</a>. They asked Kreacher if he knew where the locket came from and what had become of it, and the house-elf was forced to reveal all that had happened between him, Voldemort, and Regulus Black; when Regulus was still a <a href="/wiki/Death_Eaters" title="Death Eaters">Death Eater</a>, Voldemort told him he required the service of a house-elf, and Regulus volunteered Kreacher for the job. Voldemort took Kreacher to a <a href="/wiki/Crystal_Cave" title="Crystal Cave">seaside cave</a>, where he ordered Kreacher to drink an <a href="/wiki/Drink_of_Despair" title="Drink of Despair">emerald green potion</a>. Kreacher was tortured by the potion, and then left to die in the hands of the <a href="/wiki/Inferius" title="Inferius">Inferi</a>; he was only able to survive and Disapparate out of the cave because <a href="/wiki/Regulus_Black" title="Regulus Black">his master</a> called him home. Regulus became disillusioned by Voldemort's ill-treatment of Kreacher, and soon after, deduced both the existence of Voldemort's horcruxes and the fact that the magic that binds a house-elf to obey their master would supersede the cave's magical protections. Regulus then had Kreacher return with him to the cave, but instead of forcing Kreacher to suffer the effects of the <a href="/wiki/Drink_of_Despair" title="Drink of Despair">potion</a> again, ordered Kreacher to leave the cave with the locket, and destroy it as soon as he could. To protect Kreacher and his family, Regulus forbade Kreacher to tell any member of the House of Black what had happened. Kreacher took the locket and attempted to destroy it, but not before watching in horror as Regulus drank the potion himself, and was killed by the Inferi.
</p><p>Though he initially didn't want to admit it, Harry realised that Kreacher playing a crucial role in leading Sirius to his death was something that could have, and should have, been avoided. When Kreacher finished his story, Harry, with Hermione's guidance, made an effort to show the distraught house-elf kindness, comforting him about Regulus' death and even giving him Regulus' fake locket; the miserable, wretched house-elf they had known became almost unrecognisable. Kreacher told the trio that <a href="/wiki/Mundungus_Fletcher" title="Mundungus Fletcher">Mundungus Fletcher</a> had taken the locket, and gladly obeyed Harry's order — which Harry made a point of phrasing as a request — to find Fletcher and bring him to Grimmauld Place.
</p><p>From that point on, Kreacher happily tidied up the house and fed the trio, until they accidentally broke the <a href="/wiki/Fidelius_Charm" title="Fidelius Charm">Fidelius Charm</a> on 12 Grimmauld Place, and were forced to flee. Kreacher later led the Hogwarts house-elves, in the name of Harry, "<i>defender of house-elves</i>", and brave Regulus Black, in a fervent attack on the invading Death Eaters during the <a href="/wiki/Battle_of_Hogwarts" title="Battle of Hogwarts">Battle of Hogwarts</a>.
</p>
<h3><span class="mw-headline" id="Horace_Slughorn">Horace Slughorn</span></h3>
<div class="quote">
<dl><dd><span title="Source: Harry Potter and the Half-Blood Prince">"<i>You are talented, famous, and powerful — everything Horace values. Professor Slughorn is going to try to collect you, Harry. You would be his crowning jewel.</i>"</span>
</dd><dd>&#8212;<a href="/wiki/Albus_Dumbledore" title="Albus Dumbledore">Albus Dumbledore</a> to Harry Potter <sup class="noprint"><a href="/wiki/Harry_Potter_and_the_Half-Blood_Prince" title="Harry Potter and the Half-Blood Prince">[src]</a></sup>
</dd><dd></div>
</dd></dl>
<figure class="article-thumb tright show-info-icon" style="width: 135px"> 	<a href="http://vignette3.wikia.nocookie.net/harrypotter/images/e/e0/Horace_Slughorn.jpg/revision/latest?cb=20121226172917" 	class="image image-thumbnail" 	 	 	><img src="data:image/gif;base64,R0lGODlhAQABAIABAAAAAP///yH5BAEAAAEALAAAAAABAAEAQAICTAEAOw%3D%3D" 	 alt="Horace Slughorn"  	class="thumbimage lzy lzyPlcHld " 	 	data-image-key="Horace_Slughorn.jpg" 	data-image-name="Horace Slughorn.jpg" 	 data-src="http://vignette3.wikia.nocookie.net/harrypotter/images/e/e0/Horace_Slughorn.jpg/revision/latest/scale-to-width/135?cb=20121226172917"  	 width="135"  	 height="211"  	 	 	 onload="if(typeof ImgLzy===&#39;object&#39;){ImgLzy.load(this)}"  	><noscript><img src="http://vignette3.wikia.nocookie.net/harrypotter/images/e/e0/Horace_Slughorn.jpg/revision/latest/scale-to-width/135?cb=20121226172917" 	 alt="Horace Slughorn"  	class="thumbimage " 	 	data-image-key="Horace_Slughorn.jpg" 	data-image-name="Horace Slughorn.jpg" 	 	 width="135"  	 height="211"  	 	 	 	></noscript></a>  	<figcaption> 		 			<a href="/wiki/File:Horace_Slughorn.jpg" class="sprite info-icon"></a> 		 		 		 			<p class="caption"><a href="/wiki/Horace_Slughorn" title="Horace Slughorn">Horace Slughorn</a>, his professor</p> 		 	</figcaption> </figure>
<p>Harry first met <a href="/wiki/Horace_Slughorn" title="Horace Slughorn">Horace Slughorn</a> in <a href="/wiki/1996" title="1996">1996</a>, when he accompanied Albus Dumbledore in attempting to persuade the old <a href="/wiki/Potions_master" title="Potions master" class="mw-redirect">Potions master</a> to come out of retirement. From the start, Harry was unsure how he felt about Slughorn; though he was clearly not someone with even the slightest inclination toward becoming a <a href="/wiki/Death_Eaters" title="Death Eaters">Death Eater</a>, he seemed wholly more superficial and self-serving than the likes of people in the Order and most of Harry's other professors. Slughorn had a habit of nurturing and promoting students who would allow him to benefit from his connections to them later on; on the other hand, he seemed to take into account genuine merit as much status within the wizarding community, as he told Harry that his mother, who had no connections at all as a Muggle-born witch, was one of his all time favourite students.
</p><p>Though he resisted, Slughorn ultimately could not pass up the opportunity to "collect" Harry, nor could he deny that there was no safer place to be than where ever Dumbledore was. Horace Slughorn resumed his post as Potions Master, and made quick work of inviting several choice students (which included <a href="/wiki/Ginevra_Weasley" title="Ginevra Weasley">Ginny Weasley</a>, when he saw her perform an excellent <a href="/wiki/Bat-Bogey_Hex" title="Bat-Bogey Hex">Bat-Bogey Hex</a> on <a href="/wiki/Zacharias_Smith" title="Zacharias Smith">Zacharias Smith</a>, and later <a href="/wiki/Hermione_Granger" title="Hermione Granger">Hermione</a>, the best in her year) in addition to Harry, to be a part of his Slug Club.
</p><p>In due course, Harry realised that Dumbledore had not just wanted Slughorn back at Hogwarts because he needed to fill a position. During one of their <a href="/wiki/Harry_Potter_and_Albus_Dumbledore%27s_private_lessons" title="Harry Potter and Albus Dumbledore&#39;s private lessons">private lessons</a>, Dumbledore showed Harry a <a href="/wiki/Pensieve" title="Pensieve">memory</a> that belonged to Horace Slughorn, in which Slughorn was chatting with a group of <a href="/wiki/Slytherin" title="Slytherin">Slytherin</a> boys, including a young <a href="/wiki/Tom_Riddle" title="Tom Riddle">Tom Riddle</a>. Riddle had apparently gifted Slughorn his favourite <a href="/wiki/Crystallised_pineapple" title="Crystallised pineapple" class="mw-redirect">Crystallised pineapple</a>, was being being charming, and generally seemed to be building up to something. Indeed, when the other boys left, Riddle stayed behind, and slowly but surely made his way to his point; he wanted to know what Slughorn knew about <a href="/wiki/Horcrux" title="Horcrux">Horcruxes</a>. The room suddenly got hazy, and a voice that belonged to Slughorn but was clearly inorganic reprimanded Riddle for asking such a thing, before the memory abruptly ended.
</p>
<div class="quote">
<dl><dd><span title="Source: Harry Potter and the Half-Blood Prince (film)">"<i>Please... don't think badly of me when you see it... you've no idea how he was like, even then </i>[...]<i> </i>"</span>
</dd><dd>&#8212;Slughorn to Harry in 1997<sup class="noprint"><a href="/wiki/Harry_Potter_and_the_Half-Blood_Prince_(film)" title="Harry Potter and the Half-Blood Prince (film)">[src]</a></sup>
</dd><dd></div>
</dd></dl>
<figure class="article-thumb tleft show-info-icon" style="width: 215px"> 	<a href="http://vignette1.wikia.nocookie.net/harrypotter/images/4/45/Horace_Slughorn_memory.JPG/revision/latest?cb=20081108143449" 	class="image image-thumbnail" 	 	 	><img src="data:image/gif;base64,R0lGODlhAQABAIABAAAAAP///yH5BAEAAAEALAAAAAABAAEAQAICTAEAOw%3D%3D" 	 alt="Horace Slughorn memory"  	class="thumbimage lzy lzyPlcHld " 	 	data-image-key="Horace_Slughorn_memory.JPG" 	data-image-name="Horace Slughorn memory.JPG" 	 data-src="http://vignette1.wikia.nocookie.net/harrypotter/images/4/45/Horace_Slughorn_memory.JPG/revision/latest/scale-to-width/215?cb=20081108143449"  	 width="215"  	 height="140"  	 	 	 onload="if(typeof ImgLzy===&#39;object&#39;){ImgLzy.load(this)}"  	><noscript><img src="http://vignette1.wikia.nocookie.net/harrypotter/images/4/45/Horace_Slughorn_memory.JPG/revision/latest/scale-to-width/215?cb=20081108143449" 	 alt="Horace Slughorn memory"  	class="thumbimage " 	 	data-image-key="Horace_Slughorn_memory.JPG" 	data-image-name="Horace Slughorn memory.JPG" 	 	 width="215"  	 height="140"  	 	 	 	></noscript></a>  	<figcaption> 		 			<a href="/wiki/File:Horace_Slughorn_memory.JPG" class="sprite info-icon"></a> 		 		 		 			<p class="caption">Horace Slughorn, his teacher and friend giving the memory that allowed Harry to defeat Lord Voldemort</p> 		 	</figcaption> </figure>
<p>Dumbledore told Harry that original version of the modified memory would be of vital importance in understanding exactly what destroying Voldemort would entail, and tasked Harry with retrieving it. Aside from simply being "Harry Potter", Harry had three things that would help him do what even Dumbledore apparently could not: a reputation with Slughorn as an excellent potioneer, courtesy of the <a href="/wiki/Severus_Snape%27s_copy_of_Advanced_Potion-Making" title="Severus Snape&#39;s copy of Advanced Potion-Making">Half-Blood Prince</a>, the vial of <a href="/wiki/Felix_Felicis" title="Felix Felicis">liquid luck</a> he had won, also courtesy of the Prince, and Slughorn's fondness for Harry's own <a href="/wiki/Lily_Evans" title="Lily Evans">mother</a>. A combination of all those things, as well as a healthy dose of <a href="/wiki/Mead" title="Mead">Mead</a> and the opportunity to collect a few vials of <a href="/wiki/Acromantula_venom" title="Acromantula venom">Acromantula venom</a>, allowed Harry to finally collect the memory that confirmed what Dumbledore had suspected Voldemort had done to travel "<i>farther down the path to immortality than anyone else</i>"; created not just one, but several <a href="/wiki/Horcrux" title="Horcrux">Horcruxes</a>.
</p><p>Though it seemed as if Slughorn had fled with the rest of the Slytherins prior to the start of the <a href="/wiki/Battle_of_Hogwarts" title="Battle of Hogwarts">Battle of Hogwarts</a>, he soon returned with reinforcements from <a href="/wiki/Hogsmeade" title="Hogsmeade">Hogsmeade</a>. During the final battle in the Great Hall, Slughorn displayed his immense skill and courage by taking on Voldemort directly, duelling him alongside <a href="/wiki/Minerva_McGonagall" title="Minerva McGonagall">Minerva McGonagall</a> and <a href="/wiki/Kingsley_Shacklebolt" title="Kingsley Shacklebolt">Kingsley Shacklebolt</a>.
</p>
<h3><span class="mw-headline" id="Dumbledore.27s_Army">Dumbledore's Army</span></h3>
<div class="quote">
<dl><dd><span title="Source: Harry Potter and the Order of the Phoenix (film)">"<i>Every great wizard in history has started out as nothing more than what we are now: students. If they can do it, why not us?</i>"</span>
</dd><dd>&#8212;Harry Potter<sup class="noprint"><a href="/wiki/Harry_Potter_and_the_Order_of_the_Phoenix_(film)" title="Harry Potter and the Order of the Phoenix (film)">[src]</a></sup>
</dd><dd></div>
</dd></dl>
<figure class="article-thumb tright show-info-icon" style="width: 230px"> 	<a href="http://vignette3.wikia.nocookie.net/harrypotter/images/5/50/Tumblr_mmarg7DVGW1ro7gbao5_250.gif/revision/latest?cb=20140511035102" 	class="image image-thumbnail" 	 	 	><img src="data:image/gif;base64,R0lGODlhAQABAIABAAAAAP///yH5BAEAAAEALAAAAAABAAEAQAICTAEAOw%3D%3D" 	 alt="Tumblr mmarg7DVGW1ro7gbao5 250"  	class="thumbimage lzy lzyPlcHld " 	 	data-image-key="Tumblr_mmarg7DVGW1ro7gbao5_250.gif" 	data-image-name="Tumblr mmarg7DVGW1ro7gbao5 250.gif" 	 data-src="http://vignette3.wikia.nocookie.net/harrypotter/images/5/50/Tumblr_mmarg7DVGW1ro7gbao5_250.gif/revision/latest/scale-to-width/230?cb=20140511035102"  	 width="230"  	 height="153"  	 	 	 onload="if(typeof ImgLzy===&#39;object&#39;){ImgLzy.load(this)}"  	><noscript><img src="http://vignette3.wikia.nocookie.net/harrypotter/images/5/50/Tumblr_mmarg7DVGW1ro7gbao5_250.gif/revision/latest/scale-to-width/230?cb=20140511035102" 	 alt="Tumblr mmarg7DVGW1ro7gbao5 250"  	class="thumbimage " 	 	data-image-key="Tumblr_mmarg7DVGW1ro7gbao5_250.gif" 	data-image-name="Tumblr mmarg7DVGW1ro7gbao5 250.gif" 	 	 width="230"  	 height="153"  	 	 	 	></noscript></a>  	<figcaption> 		 			<a href="/wiki/File:Tumblr_mmarg7DVGW1ro7gbao5_250.gif" class="sprite info-icon"></a> 		 		 		 			<p class="caption">Some members of Dumbledore's Army, applauding Harry</p> 		 	</figcaption> </figure>
<p>By the summer of <a href="/wiki/1995" title="1995">1995</a>, the <a href="/wiki/British_Ministry_of_Magic" title="British Ministry of Magic">Ministry of Magic</a> was in stubborn denial of <a href="/wiki/Tom_Riddle" title="Tom Riddle">Voldemort's</a> <a href="/wiki/Rebirth_of_Tom_Riddle" title="Rebirth of Tom Riddle">return</a>, and <a href="/wiki/Cornelius_Fudge" title="Cornelius Fudge">Cornelius Fudge</a>, whether out of self-delusion or genuine paranoia, seemed to suspect <a href="/wiki/Albus_Dumbledore" title="Albus Dumbledore">Albus Dumbledore</a> may have been making false claims as a pretext for mobilising the students of <a href="/wiki/Hogwarts_School_of_Witchcraft_and_Wizardry" title="Hogwarts School of Witchcraft and Wizardry">Hogwarts School of Witchcraft and Wizardry</a> in a coup against Fudge's administration. As such, the Ministry saw fit to appoint one of its own to fill a vacancy in the Hogwarts faculty; at the start of the <a href="/wiki/1995%E2%80%931996_school_year" title="1995–1996 school year">1995–1996 school year</a>, <a href="/wiki/Dolores_Umbridge" title="Dolores Umbridge">Dolores Umbridge</a> was announced as the school's new <a href="/wiki/Defence_Against_the_Dark_Arts" title="Defence Against the Dark Arts">Defence Against the Dark Arts</a> professor, and later, the first and only known <a href="/wiki/Hogwarts_High_Inquisitor" title="Hogwarts High Inquisitor">Hogwarts High Inquisitor</a>.
</p><p>As Umbridge steadily asserted her authority into nearly every aspect of life at Hogwarts — from refusing to allow her D.A.D.A. students anything beyond a <a href="/wiki/Defensive_Magical_Theory" title="Defensive Magical Theory">basic theoretical education</a> and <a href="/wiki/Educational_Decree_Number_Twenty-Four" title="Educational Decree Number Twenty-Four">disbanding</a> all student organisations, clubs, societies, and teams, to enforcing a unique form of <a href="/wiki/Blood_Quill" title="Blood Quill" class="mw-redirect">corporal punishment</a> — most of the residents of Hogwarts quickly turned against her.
</p><p>Harry was the most heatedly vocal among her opposition, followed closely by <a href="/wiki/Hermione_Granger" title="Hermione Granger">Hermione Granger</a>, who had been the first to notice and question the fact that Umbridge's outlined curriculum did not seem to include the actual use of defensive magic. The two of them, along with <a href="/wiki/Ronald_Weasley" title="Ronald Weasley">Ron Weasley</a>, founded <a href="/wiki/Dumbledore%27s_Army" title="Dumbledore&#39;s Army">Dumbledore's Army</a> (so named to mock "the Ministry's worst fear") to secretly provide students a practical defensive education. When an unexpectedly high number of students arrived at the <a href="/wiki/Hog%27s_Head" title="Hog&#39;s Head" class="mw-redirect">Hog's Head</a> pub for the introductory meeting of the D.A., Harry suspected that many of the attendees were only interested in hearing the details of <a href="/wiki/Cedric_Diggory" title="Cedric Diggory">Cedric Diggory</a>'s death. However, nearly all of the members worked in earnest to improve their <a href="/wiki/Duelling" title="Duelling">duelling</a> skills, crediting their marked successes to Harry's effective teaching, and many were eventually able to produce corporeal <a href="/wiki/Patronus_Charm" title="Patronus Charm">Patronuses</a> under Harry's tuition.
</p><p>The organisation was disbanded in <a href="/wiki/1996" title="1996">1996</a>, when <a href="/wiki/Marietta_Edgecombe" title="Marietta Edgecombe">Marietta Edgecombe</a> gave into pressure from her parents and Umbridge to betray the <a href="/wiki/Room_of_Requirement" title="Room of Requirement">location</a> of the D.A.'s secret meetings, which nearly resulted in the expulsion of all of the members. Dumbledore ultimately took the blame (citing the fact that it was called "<i>Dumbledore's Army, not Potter's</i>"), and overpowered several Ministry officials to avoid being subsequently sent to <a href="/wiki/Azkaban" title="Azkaban">Azkaban</a>.
</p><p>Only <a href="/wiki/Neville_Longbottom" title="Neville Longbottom">Neville Longbottom</a>, <a href="/wiki/Luna_Lovegood" title="Luna Lovegood">Luna Lovegood</a>, and <a href="/wiki/Ginevra_Weasley" title="Ginevra Weasley">Ginny Weasley</a> continued to check their <a href="/wiki/Enchanted_coin" title="Enchanted coin">Enchanted coins</a> and were able to answer Hermione and Ron's call prior to the <a href="/wiki/Battle_of_the_Astronomy_Tower" title="Battle of the Astronomy Tower">Battle of the Astronomy Tower</a>. Nevertheless, all of the former members, aside from Marietta Edgecombe and <a href="/wiki/Zacharias_Smith" title="Zacharias Smith">Zacharias Smith</a>, reunited when the D.A. was re-formed in <a href="/wiki/1997" title="1997">1997</a>, co-led by Neville, Ginny and Luna in Harry, Ron, and Hermione's absence, and fought together in the <a href="/wiki/Battle_of_Hogwarts" title="Battle of Hogwarts">Battle of Hogwarts</a>.
</p>
<h3><span class="mw-headline" id="Order_of_the_Phoenix">Order of the Phoenix</span></h3>
<div class="quote">
<dl><dd><span title="Source: Harry Potter and the Order of the Phoenix (film)">"<i>I want to join! If Voldemort's raising an army, then I want to fight!</i>"</span>
</dd><dd>&#8212;Harry Potter<sup class="noprint"><a href="/wiki/Harry_Potter_and_the_Order_of_the_Phoenix_(film)" title="Harry Potter and the Order of the Phoenix (film)">[src]</a></sup>
</dd><dd></div>
</dd></dl>
<figure class="article-thumb tright show-info-icon" style="width: 240px"> 	<a href="http://vignette3.wikia.nocookie.net/harrypotter/images/f/f9/Ootp.png/revision/latest?cb=20140511035621" 	class="image image-thumbnail" 	 	 	><img src="data:image/gif;base64,R0lGODlhAQABAIABAAAAAP///yH5BAEAAAEALAAAAAABAAEAQAICTAEAOw%3D%3D" 	 alt="Ootp"  	class="thumbimage lzy lzyPlcHld " 	 	data-image-key="Ootp.png" 	data-image-name="Ootp.png" 	 data-src="http://vignette3.wikia.nocookie.net/harrypotter/images/f/f9/Ootp.png/revision/latest/scale-to-width/240?cb=20140511035621"  	 width="240"  	 height="100"  	 	 	 onload="if(typeof ImgLzy===&#39;object&#39;){ImgLzy.load(this)}"  	><noscript><img src="http://vignette3.wikia.nocookie.net/harrypotter/images/f/f9/Ootp.png/revision/latest/scale-to-width/240?cb=20140511035621" 	 alt="Ootp"  	class="thumbimage " 	 	data-image-key="Ootp.png" 	data-image-name="Ootp.png" 	 	 width="240"  	 height="100"  	 	 	 	></noscript></a>  	<figcaption> 		 			<a href="/wiki/File:Ootp.png" class="sprite info-icon"></a> 		 		 		 			<p class="caption">The original <a href="/wiki/Order_of_the_Phoenix" title="Order of the Phoenix">Order of the Phoenix</a></p> 		 	</figcaption> </figure>
<p>Harry first heard about the <a href="/wiki/Order_of_the_Phoenix" title="Order of the Phoenix">Order of the Phoenix</a> in <a href="/wiki/1995" title="1995">1995</a>, a year after Lord Voldemort's return. The Order of the Phoenix was an organisation founded and led by Albus Dumbledore in opposition to <a href="/wiki/Tom_Riddle" title="Tom Riddle">Lord Voldemort</a> and his <a href="/wiki/Death_Eaters" title="Death Eaters">Death Eaters</a> during the <a href="/wiki/First_Wizarding_War" title="First Wizarding War">First Wizarding War</a>, and was reinstated at the start of the <a href="/wiki/Second_Wizarding_War" title="Second Wizarding War">Second Wizarding War</a>. Most of the Order members worked to the best of their ability to protect Harry, at great personal risk, throughout the Second War, for which Harry came to view many of them much like a surrogate extended family.
</p>
<figure class="article-thumb tleft show-info-icon" style="width: 142px"> 	<a href="http://vignette1.wikia.nocookie.net/harrypotter/images/c/c7/AberforthInfobox.jpg/revision/latest?cb=20111027081221" 	class="image image-thumbnail" 	 	 	><img src="data:image/gif;base64,R0lGODlhAQABAIABAAAAAP///yH5BAEAAAEALAAAAAABAAEAQAICTAEAOw%3D%3D" 	 alt="AberforthInfobox"  	class="thumbimage lzy lzyPlcHld " 	 	data-image-key="AberforthInfobox.jpg" 	data-image-name="AberforthInfobox.jpg" 	 data-src="http://vignette1.wikia.nocookie.net/harrypotter/images/c/c7/AberforthInfobox.jpg/revision/latest/scale-to-width/142?cb=20111027081221"  	 width="142"  	 height="187"  	 	 	 onload="if(typeof ImgLzy===&#39;object&#39;){ImgLzy.load(this)}"  	><noscript><img src="http://vignette1.wikia.nocookie.net/harrypotter/images/c/c7/AberforthInfobox.jpg/revision/latest/scale-to-width/142?cb=20111027081221" 	 alt="AberforthInfobox"  	class="thumbimage " 	 	data-image-key="AberforthInfobox.jpg" 	data-image-name="AberforthInfobox.jpg" 	 	 width="142"  	 height="187"  	 	 	 	></noscript></a>  	<figcaption> 		 			<a href="/wiki/File:AberforthInfobox.jpg" class="sprite info-icon"></a> 		 		 		 			<p class="caption"><a href="/wiki/Aberforth_Dumbledore" title="Aberforth Dumbledore">Aberforth Dumbledore</a>, his protector</p> 		 	</figcaption> </figure>
<p><a href="/wiki/Aberforth_Dumbledore" title="Aberforth Dumbledore">Aberforth</a> was <a href="/wiki/Albus_Dumbledore" title="Albus Dumbledore">Albus Dumbledore</a>'s younger brother. Though Harry, Ron and Hermione had known him for years as the owner of the <a href="/wiki/Hog%27s_Head" title="Hog&#39;s Head" class="mw-redirect">Hog's Head</a>, they didn't officially meet him or learn his true identity until <a href="/wiki/1998" title="1998">1998</a>, when Harry, Ron and Hermione apparated outside of Aberforth's pub, in <a href="/wiki/Hogsmeade" title="Hogsmeade">Hogsmeade</a>. Harry had read about Aberforth in <i><a href="/wiki/The_Life_and_Lies_of_Albus_Dumbledore" title="The Life and Lies of Albus Dumbledore">The Life and Lies of Albus Dumbledore</a></i>, a book <a href="/wiki/Rita_Skeeter" title="Rita Skeeter">Rita Skeeter</a> had written, which described Aberforth as unlettered, rude, and bitter for having lived in the shadow of his elder brother. When the trio apparated outside of the Hog's Head, they set off a <a href="/wiki/Caterwauling_Charm" title="Caterwauling Charm">Caterwauling Charm</a> set by <a href="/wiki/Death_Eaters" title="Death Eaters">Death Eaters</a>. As the three were hidden beneath Harry's <a href="/wiki/Cloak_of_Invisibility" title="Cloak of Invisibility">Invisibility cloak</a>, the Death Eaters used Dementors to smoke them out; the <a href="/wiki/Death_Eaters" title="Death Eaters">Death Eaters</a> recognised Harry's stag Patronus, but Aberforth claimed it was he who had set off the Caterwauling charm, and that the Patronus had actually been a goat.
</p><p>Upon taking refuge in the Pub, the trio discovered Aberforth had saved their lives once before; he had been able to send <a href="/wiki/Dobby" title="Dobby">Dobby</a> to save them from the <a href="/wiki/Malfoy_Manor" title="Malfoy Manor">Malfoy Manor</a> after Harry called to him through the broken shards of the <a href="/wiki/Two-way_mirror" title="Two-way mirror">Two-way mirror</a>, as Aberforth had bought Sirius' mirror from <a href="/wiki/Mundungus_Fletcher" title="Mundungus Fletcher">Mundungus Fletcher</a>. Aberforth advised Harry to take Ron and Hermione away from Hogsmeade, and to save himself. He told them about his family life, and that his sister, <a href="/wiki/Ariana_Dumbledore" title="Ariana Dumbledore">Ariana</a>, had been so traumatised after being attacked by three <a href="/wiki/Muggle" title="Muggle">Muggle</a> boys, that she became unable to control her magical abilities. He also told them why <a href="/wiki/Percival_Dumbledore" title="Percival Dumbledore">his father</a> had been imprisoned in <a href="/wiki/Azkaban" title="Azkaban">Azkaban</a>, and about the events leading up to the deaths of <a href="/wiki/Kendra_Dumbledore" title="Kendra Dumbledore">his mother</a> and sister. Though Harry understood, or at least sympathised with, Aberforth's bitterness, he echoed Albus' sentiments by saying "<i>sometimes you've </i>got<i> to think about the greater good!</i>" Harry then informed Aberforth that, despite what he believed of his brother, Albus had never been free of what <a href="/wiki/Gellert_Grindelwald" title="Gellert Grindelwald">Gellert Grindelwald</a> had done to Aberforth or what had happened to Ariana, referring to all Harry had heard Albus saying under the effects of the <a href="/wiki/Drink_of_Despair" title="Drink of Despair">Drink of Despair</a> in the <a href="/wiki/Crystal_Cave" title="Crystal Cave">Crystal Cave</a>. After receiving this insight into his brother's mind, Aberforth showed the trio the secret passage to the <a href="/wiki/Room_of_Requirement" title="Room of Requirement">Room of Requirement</a> concealed behind <a href="/wiki/Ariana_Dumbledore" title="Ariana Dumbledore">Ariana</a>'s portrait.
</p>
<figure class="article-thumb tright show-info-icon" style="width: 145px"> 	<a href="http://vignette4.wikia.nocookie.net/harrypotter/images/7/79/Kingsleydh.jpg/revision/latest?cb=20101113194841" 	class="image image-thumbnail" 	 	 	><img src="data:image/gif;base64,R0lGODlhAQABAIABAAAAAP///yH5BAEAAAEALAAAAAABAAEAQAICTAEAOw%3D%3D" 	 alt="Kingsleydh"  	class="thumbimage lzy lzyPlcHld " 	 	data-image-key="Kingsleydh.jpg" 	data-image-name="Kingsleydh.jpg" 	 data-src="http://vignette4.wikia.nocookie.net/harrypotter/images/7/79/Kingsleydh.jpg/revision/latest/scale-to-width/145?cb=20101113194841"  	 width="145"  	 height="193"  	 	 	 onload="if(typeof ImgLzy===&#39;object&#39;){ImgLzy.load(this)}"  	><noscript><img src="http://vignette4.wikia.nocookie.net/harrypotter/images/7/79/Kingsleydh.jpg/revision/latest/scale-to-width/145?cb=20101113194841" 	 alt="Kingsleydh"  	class="thumbimage " 	 	data-image-key="Kingsleydh.jpg" 	data-image-name="Kingsleydh.jpg" 	 	 width="145"  	 height="193"  	 	 	 	></noscript></a>  	<figcaption> 		 			<a href="/wiki/File:Kingsleydh.jpg" class="sprite info-icon"></a> 		 		 		 			<p class="caption"><a href="/wiki/Kingsley_Shacklebolt" title="Kingsley Shacklebolt">Kingsley Shacklebolt</a></p> 		 	</figcaption> </figure>
<p>Harry first met <a href="/wiki/Kingsley_Shacklebolt" title="Kingsley Shacklebolt">Kingsley Shacklebolt</a> when he and the rest of the <a href="/wiki/Advance_Guard" title="Advance Guard">Advance Guard</a> arrived at Privet Drive in <a href="/wiki/1995" title="1995">1995</a>. Kingsley was an <a href="/wiki/Auror" title="Auror">Auror</a> who believed in equality and fairness for all <a href="/wiki/Wizards" title="Wizards" class="mw-redirect">wizards, witches,</a> and <a href="/wiki/Muggle" title="Muggle">Muggles</a>. He later saved countless lives by sending his Patronus to warn the attendees of the <a href="/wiki/Wedding_of_William_Weasley_and_Fleur_Delacour" title="Wedding of William Weasley and Fleur Delacour">Weasley-Delacour Wedding</a> that the Ministry had fallen, and with it, the protections surrounding <a href="/wiki/The_Burrow" title="The Burrow">The Burrow</a>. After the <a href="/wiki/Second_Wizarding_War" title="Second Wizarding War">Second Wizarding War</a>, Kingsley became <a href="/wiki/Minister_for_Magic" title="Minister for Magic">Minister for Magic</a>.
</p><p>Before Harry had even known he was a wizard, <a href="/wiki/Dedalus_Diggle" title="Dedalus Diggle">Dedalus Diggle</a> had met and even publicly bowed to a bemused, young Harry, much to <a href="/wiki/Dursley_family" title="Dursley family">the Dursley</a>'s confusion and disgust. In <a href="/wiki/1997" title="1997">1997</a>, Diggle and <a href="/wiki/Hestia_Jones" title="Hestia Jones">Hestia Jones</a> took the Dursleys into hiding under the Order's protection from Voldemort and the Death Eaters. Hestia was furious when she realised how little Harry's Uncle and Aunt seemed to know or care about him, and was unimpressed by Dudley's attempt at reconciliation. Though Harry was mostly amused by Dudley's declaration that he didn't consider Harry a "waste of space", he probably appreciated Hestia's indignation on his behalf all the same.
</p><p>Harry thought <a href="/wiki/Arabella_Figg" title="Arabella Figg">Arabella Figg</a> was just his odd, cat-loving neighbour, until <a href="/wiki/1995" title="1995">1995</a>, when he learned she was a <a href="/wiki/Squib" title="Squib">Squib</a>, and a member of the Order. She was outraged to learn that <a href="/wiki/Mundungus_Fletcher" title="Mundungus Fletcher">Mundungus Fletcher</a> had abandoned his post when he was supposed to be guarding Harry, which left the boy and his cousin vulnerable when they were attacked by Dementors. Figg also participated in Harry Potter's trial, as a witness in Harry's defence. It is unknown if Figg fought in the Battle of Hogwarts, though it is likely that she didn't fight, as she lacked magical powers.
</p><p>Harry had learned from Moody that several members of the First Order had been killed during the <a href="/wiki/First_Wizarding_War" title="First Wizarding War">First Wizarding War</a>, including <a href="/wiki/Fabian_Prewett" title="Fabian Prewett">Fabian</a> and <a href="/wiki/Gideon_Prewett" title="Gideon Prewett">Gideon Prewett</a>, <a href="/wiki/Edgar_Bones" title="Edgar Bones">Edgar Bones</a> and his family, <a href="/wiki/Marlene_McKinnon" title="Marlene McKinnon">Marlene McKinnon</a> and her family, <a href="/wiki/Caradoc_Dearborn" title="Caradoc Dearborn">Caradoc Dearborn</a>, <a href="/wiki/Benjy_Fenwick" title="Benjy Fenwick">Benjy Fenwick</a> and <a href="/wiki/Dorcas_Meadowes" title="Dorcas Meadowes">Dorcas Meadowes</a>. In Harry's fourth year, Dumbledore told him that <a href="/wiki/Alice_and_Frank_Longbottom" title="Alice and Frank Longbottom">Alice and Frank Longbottom</a> had been tortured to insanity and were permanently incapacitated in <a href="/wiki/St_Mungo%27s_Hospital_for_Magical_Maladies_and_Injuries" title="St Mungo&#39;s Hospital for Magical Maladies and Injuries">St Mungo's Hospital for Magical Maladies and Injuries</a>, shortly after Voldemort's fall, by four Death Eaters who were attempting to discover their Master's whereabouts. Harry was later confused when he heard about the arrest of Order member <a href="/wiki/Sturgis_Podmore" title="Sturgis Podmore">Sturgis Podmore</a>, who had apparently been attempting to break into the Department of Mysteries in <a href="/wiki/1995" title="1995">1995</a>, but eventually realised that Podmore had been <a href="/wiki/Imperius_Curse" title="Imperius Curse">imperiused</a>. Harry also learned about the death of <a href="/wiki/Emmeline_Vance" title="Emmeline Vance">Emmeline Vance</a> in the Daily Prophet, when she was killed around the same as the murder of <a href="/wiki/Amelia_Bones" title="Amelia Bones">Amelia Bones</a>.
</p>
<figure class="article-thumb tleft show-info-icon" style="width: 132px"> 	<a href="http://vignette4.wikia.nocookie.net/harrypotter/images/8/8e/Mundungus.png/revision/latest?cb=20111211234051" 	class="image image-thumbnail" 	 	 	><img src="data:image/gif;base64,R0lGODlhAQABAIABAAAAAP///yH5BAEAAAEALAAAAAABAAEAQAICTAEAOw%3D%3D" 	 alt="Mundungus"  	class="thumbimage lzy lzyPlcHld " 	 	data-image-key="Mundungus.png" 	data-image-name="Mundungus.png" 	 data-src="http://vignette4.wikia.nocookie.net/harrypotter/images/8/8e/Mundungus.png/revision/latest/scale-to-width/132?cb=20111211234051"  	 width="132"  	 height="225"  	 	 	 onload="if(typeof ImgLzy===&#39;object&#39;){ImgLzy.load(this)}"  	><noscript><img src="http://vignette4.wikia.nocookie.net/harrypotter/images/8/8e/Mundungus.png/revision/latest/scale-to-width/132?cb=20111211234051" 	 alt="Mundungus"  	class="thumbimage " 	 	data-image-key="Mundungus.png" 	data-image-name="Mundungus.png" 	 	 width="132"  	 height="225"  	 	 	 	></noscript></a>  	<figcaption> 		 			<a href="/wiki/File:Mundungus.png" class="sprite info-icon"></a> 		 		 		 			<p class="caption">Mundungus Fletcher</p> 		 	</figcaption> </figure>
<p><a href="/wiki/Mundungus_Fletcher" title="Mundungus Fletcher">Mundungus Fletcher</a> was likely the member of the Order Harry liked least (barring, initially, <a href="/wiki/Severus_Snape" title="Severus Snape">Severus Snape</a>), as he was a criminal who callously pilfered many of Sirius' inherited possessions very shortly after his death. Harry attempted to strangle Fletcher when he saw him hawking Black family heirlooms outside of the <a href="/wiki/Three_Broomsticks_Inn" title="Three Broomsticks Inn">Three Broomsticks Inn</a>, in <a href="/wiki/1996" title="1996">1996</a>, and was disgusted to learn that Fletcher had abandoned Alastor Moody during the <a href="/wiki/Battle_of_the_Seven_Potters" title="Battle of the Seven Potters">Battle of the Seven Potters</a>. When Harry realised that one of the items Mundungus had stolen from <a href="/wiki/12_Grimmauld_Place" title="12 Grimmauld Place">12 Grimmauld Place</a> had been <a href="/wiki/Salazar_Slytherin" title="Salazar Slytherin">Salazar Slytherin</a>'s <a href="/wiki/Salazar_Slytherin%27s_Locket" title="Salazar Slytherin&#39;s Locket" class="mw-redirect">Locket</a>, he ordered <a href="/wiki/Kreacher" title="Kreacher">Kreacher</a>, the house-elf, to catch him. Kreacher did so, and it was with reluctance that Harry stopped the house-elf from beating Mundungus senseless, in order to learn that the locket had been taken from Mundungus by <a href="/wiki/Dolores_Umbridge" title="Dolores Umbridge">Dolores Umbridge</a>.
</p><p><a href="/wiki/Augusta_Longbottom" title="Augusta Longbottom">Augusta Longbottom</a>, the mother of <a href="/wiki/Frank_Longbottom" title="Frank Longbottom">Frank Longbottom</a>, mother-in-law of <a href="/wiki/Alice_Longbottom" title="Alice Longbottom">Alice Longbottom</a>, and grandmother of <a href="/wiki/Neville_Longbottom" title="Neville Longbottom">Neville Longbottom</a>, wasn't an original member of the Order, but she fought in both Wizarding Wars. She thought highly of Harry and his friends, and was immensely proud of her grandson. When Augusta arrived at the school to join in the final <a href="/wiki/Battle_of_Hogwarts" title="Battle of Hogwarts">battle</a>, she rushed off to find Neville, whom she was unsurprised to hear was off somewhere fighting Death Eaters.
</p><p><a href="/wiki/Andromeda_Tonks" title="Andromeda Tonks">Andromeda</a> and <a href="/wiki/Ted_Tonks" title="Ted Tonks" class="mw-redirect">Ted Tonks</a>, Nymphadora Tonks' parents, also weren't original members, but were crucial in transferring Harry safely to <a href="/wiki/The_Burrow" title="The Burrow">the Burrow</a>, after the <a href="/wiki/Sacrificial_protection" title="Sacrificial protection">Sacrificial protection</a> was broken. Harry liked the cheery-looking Ted Tonks immediately, though he was initially startled by the appearance of Andromeda, who at first glance greatly resembled her sister Bellatrix, but upon closer inspection, clearly had softer features, and wider, kinder eyes. In <a href="/wiki/1997" title="1997">1997</a>, after the <a href="/wiki/Battle_of_the_Seven_Potters" title="Battle of the Seven Potters">Battle of the Seven Potters</a>, Andromeda and Ted healed Harry's and Hagrid's injuries, before they took a <a href="/wiki/Portkey" title="Portkey">Portkey</a> to the Burrow. Harry was saddened by the news of Ted Tonks' death, and helped Andromeda raise her grandson, <a href="/wiki/Edward_Lupin" title="Edward Lupin">Teddy Lupin</a>, after Nymphadora's death.
</p>
<h3><span class="mw-headline" id="Hogwarts_residents">Hogwarts residents</span></h3>
<h4><span class="mw-headline" id="Filius_Flitwick_and_Pomona_Sprout">Filius Flitwick and Pomona Sprout</span></h4>
<figure class="article-thumb tright show-info-icon" style="width: 122px"> 	<a href="http://vignette1.wikia.nocookie.net/harrypotter/images/3/34/Flitwick_HBPoster.PNG/revision/latest?cb=20100111183429" 	class="image image-thumbnail" 	 	 	><img src="data:image/gif;base64,R0lGODlhAQABAIABAAAAAP///yH5BAEAAAEALAAAAAABAAEAQAICTAEAOw%3D%3D" 	 alt="Flitwick HBPoster"  	class="thumbimage lzy lzyPlcHld " 	 	data-image-key="Flitwick_HBPoster.PNG" 	data-image-name="Flitwick HBPoster.PNG" 	 data-src="http://vignette1.wikia.nocookie.net/harrypotter/images/3/34/Flitwick_HBPoster.PNG/revision/latest/scale-to-width/122?cb=20100111183429"  	 width="122"  	 height="208"  	 	 	 onload="if(typeof ImgLzy===&#39;object&#39;){ImgLzy.load(this)}"  	><noscript><img src="http://vignette1.wikia.nocookie.net/harrypotter/images/3/34/Flitwick_HBPoster.PNG/revision/latest/scale-to-width/122?cb=20100111183429" 	 alt="Flitwick HBPoster"  	class="thumbimage " 	 	data-image-key="Flitwick_HBPoster.PNG" 	data-image-name="Flitwick HBPoster.PNG" 	 	 width="122"  	 height="208"  	 	 	 	></noscript></a>  	<figcaption> 		 			<a href="/wiki/File:Flitwick_HBPoster.PNG" class="sprite info-icon"></a> 		 		 		 			<p class="caption"><a href="/wiki/Filius_Flitwick" title="Filius Flitwick">Professor Flitwick</a>, Charms master</p> 		 	</figcaption> </figure>Harry got along well with both Professor <a href="/wiki/Filius_Flitwick" title="Filius Flitwick">Filius Flitwick</a>, the <a href="/wiki/Charms_(class)" title="Charms (class)">Charms</a> professor and <a href="/wiki/Head_of_Ravenclaw_House" title="Head of Ravenclaw House">Head of Ravenclaw House</a>, and Professor <a href="/wiki/Pomona_Sprout" title="Pomona Sprout">Pomona Sprout</a>, the <a href="/wiki/Herbology" title="Herbology">Herbology</a> professor and <a href="/wiki/Head_of_Hufflepuff_House" title="Head of Hufflepuff House">Head of Hufflepuff House</a>, and received <a href="/wiki/Ordinary_Wizarding_Level" title="Ordinary Wizarding Level">O.W.L.s</a> in both of their subjects. Harry also witnessed both teachers rush to the aid of Professor <a href="/wiki/Minerva_McGonagall" title="Minerva McGonagall">Minerva McGonagall</a> shortly before <a href="/wiki/Severus_Snape" title="Severus Snape">Severus Snape</a>'s "sacking", prior to the start of the <a href="/wiki/Battle_of_Hogwarts" title="Battle of Hogwarts">Battle of Hogwarts</a>.
<h4><span class="mw-headline" id="Sybill_Trelawney">Sybill Trelawney</span></h4>
<div class="quote">
<dl><dd><span title="Source: Harry Potter and the Half-Blood Prince">"<i>I miss having you in my classes, Harry. You were never much of a Seer, but you were a wonderful Object </i>[...]<i> </i>"</span>
</dd><dd>&#8212;Professor Trelawney, referring to how she kept (falsely) predicting Harry's premature death<sup class="noprint"><a href="/wiki/Harry_Potter_and_the_Half-Blood_Prince" title="Harry Potter and the Half-Blood Prince">[src]</a></sup>
</dd><dd></div>
</dd></dl>
<figure class="article-thumb tleft show-info-icon" style="width: 140px"> 	<a href="http://vignette4.wikia.nocookie.net/harrypotter/images/8/8a/%D0%91%D0%B5%D0%B7%D1%8B%D0%BC%D1%8F%D0%BD%D0%BD%D1%8B%D0%B9.JPG/revision/latest?cb=20110108192301" 	class="image image-thumbnail" 	 	 	><img src="data:image/gif;base64,R0lGODlhAQABAIABAAAAAP///yH5BAEAAAEALAAAAAABAAEAQAICTAEAOw%3D%3D" 	 alt="Безымянный"  	class="thumbimage lzy lzyPlcHld " 	 	data-image-key="%D0%91%D0%B5%D0%B7%D1%8B%D0%BC%D1%8F%D0%BD%D0%BD%D1%8B%D0%B9.JPG" 	data-image-name="Безымянный.JPG" 	 data-src="http://vignette4.wikia.nocookie.net/harrypotter/images/8/8a/%D0%91%D0%B5%D0%B7%D1%8B%D0%BC%D1%8F%D0%BD%D0%BD%D1%8B%D0%B9.JPG/revision/latest/scale-to-width/140?cb=20110108192301"  	 width="140"  	 height="216"  	 	 	 onload="if(typeof ImgLzy===&#39;object&#39;){ImgLzy.load(this)}"  	><noscript><img src="http://vignette4.wikia.nocookie.net/harrypotter/images/8/8a/%D0%91%D0%B5%D0%B7%D1%8B%D0%BC%D1%8F%D0%BD%D0%BD%D1%8B%D0%B9.JPG/revision/latest/scale-to-width/140?cb=20110108192301" 	 alt="Безымянный"  	class="thumbimage " 	 	data-image-key="%D0%91%D0%B5%D0%B7%D1%8B%D0%BC%D1%8F%D0%BD%D0%BD%D1%8B%D0%B9.JPG" 	data-image-name="Безымянный.JPG" 	 	 width="140"  	 height="216"  	 	 	 	></noscript></a>  	<figcaption> 		 			<a href="/wiki/File:%D0%91%D0%B5%D0%B7%D1%8B%D0%BC%D1%8F%D0%BD%D0%BD%D1%8B%D0%B9.JPG" class="sprite info-icon"></a> 		 		 		 			<p class="caption"><a href="/wiki/Sybill_Trelawney" title="Sybill Trelawney">Sybill Trelawney</a>, Divination Professor</p> 		 	</figcaption> </figure>
<p>As <a href="/wiki/Sybill_Trelawney" title="Sybill Trelawney">Sybill Trelawney</a> had a tendency to predict various grim deaths for Harry every <a href="/wiki/Divination_(class)" title="Divination (class)">Divination class</a>, Harry was not especially fond of his <a href="/wiki/Divination" title="Divination">Divination</a> professor. Though most of Trelawney's predictions were nonsensical, in <a href="/wiki/1996" title="1996">1996</a>, Harry learned it was Trelawney who had made the <a href="/wiki/Sybill_Trelawney%27s_first_prophecy" title="Sybill Trelawney&#39;s first prophecy">prophecy</a> about him and <a href="/wiki/Tom_Riddle" title="Tom Riddle">Voldemort</a>, and another in <a href="/wiki/1994" title="1994">1994</a> regarding the return of <a href="/wiki/Peter_Pettigrew" title="Peter Pettigrew">Peter Pettigrew</a> to the service of Voldemort, though she was completely unaware of having done so.
</p><p>Though Harry wasn't a huge fan of the subject, in general, Harry liked the other Divination Professor, <a href="/wiki/Firenze" title="Firenze">Firenze</a>, a centaur who had saved Harry's life in <a href="/wiki/1991" title="1991">1991</a>. During the Battle of Hogwarts, Harry saw Trelawney spiking <a href="/wiki/Crystal_ball" title="Crystal ball">Crystal balls</a> at the invading <a href="/wiki/Death_Eaters" title="Death Eaters">Death Eaters</a>.
</p><p>Despite his general dislike of Sybill for being mostly a fraud who kept annoying him with nonsensical predictions of his death, Harry was nevertheless disgusted when Dolores Umbridge dismissed the Divination professor for inadequate performance, a dismissal that was utmost cruel and unceremonious.
</p>
<h4><span class="mw-headline" id="Other_residents">Other residents</span></h4>
<div class="quote">
<dl><dd><span title="Source: Harry Potter and the Chamber of Secrets (film)">"<i>Fame's a fickle friend, Harry. Celebrity is as celebrity does — remember that.</i>"</span>
</dd><dd>&#8212;One of Lockhart's many pieces of "advice" to Harry<sup class="noprint"><a href="/wiki/Harry_Potter_and_the_Chamber_of_Secrets_(film)" title="Harry Potter and the Chamber of Secrets (film)">[src]</a></sup>
</dd><dd></div>
</dd></dl>
<figure class="article-thumb tright show-info-icon" style="width: 130px"> 	<a href="http://vignette1.wikia.nocookie.net/harrypotter/images/6/66/LockhartCos.PNG/revision/latest?cb=20090730134528" 	class="image image-thumbnail" 	 	 	><img src="data:image/gif;base64,R0lGODlhAQABAIABAAAAAP///yH5BAEAAAEALAAAAAABAAEAQAICTAEAOw%3D%3D" 	 alt="LockhartCos"  	class="thumbimage lzy lzyPlcHld " 	 	data-image-key="LockhartCos.PNG" 	data-image-name="LockhartCos.PNG" 	 data-src="http://vignette1.wikia.nocookie.net/harrypotter/images/6/66/LockhartCos.PNG/revision/latest/scale-to-width/130?cb=20090730134528"  	 width="130"  	 height="223"  	 	 	 onload="if(typeof ImgLzy===&#39;object&#39;){ImgLzy.load(this)}"  	><noscript><img src="http://vignette1.wikia.nocookie.net/harrypotter/images/6/66/LockhartCos.PNG/revision/latest/scale-to-width/130?cb=20090730134528" 	 alt="LockhartCos"  	class="thumbimage " 	 	data-image-key="LockhartCos.PNG" 	data-image-name="LockhartCos.PNG" 	 	 width="130"  	 height="223"  	 	 	 	></noscript></a>  	<figcaption> 		 			<a href="/wiki/File:LockhartCos.PNG" class="sprite info-icon"></a> 		 		 		 			<p class="caption"><a href="/wiki/Gilderoy_Lockhart" title="Gilderoy Lockhart">Gilderoy Lockhart</a></p> 		 	</figcaption> </figure>
<p><a href="/wiki/Gilderoy_Lockhart" title="Gilderoy Lockhart">Gilderoy Lockhart</a> was Harry's <a href="/wiki/Defence_Against_the_Dark_Arts" title="Defence Against the Dark Arts">Defence Against the Dark Arts</a> professor in Harry's second year. Lockhart was a very handsome and famous author, who claimed he had done great deeds, but had in fact only taken credit for the deeds after erasing the memories of the actual doers: his only skill. Lockhart was extremely vain and highly self-obsessed; he assigned all of his own, very expensive, books for his class. Lockhart continually pulled Harry into the limelight against his will, often implying that Harry hoped to be as famous as Lockhart, which caused Harry a great deal of embarrassment and irritation.
</p><p>When <a href="/wiki/Ginevra_Weasley" title="Ginevra Weasley">Ginny Weasley</a> had been taken into the <a href="/wiki/Chamber_of_Secrets" title="Chamber of Secrets">Chamber of Secrets</a>, Lockhart boasted that he knew exactly how to enter the Chamber and defeat the monster within; though McGonagall only challenged him to do so in order to shut him up, Harry and <a href="/wiki/Ronald_Weasley" title="Ronald Weasley">Ron Weasley</a>, who actually did know how to get into the Chamber, tried to tell him what they knew, only to find him packing his things and getting ready to flee. Lockhart attempted to erase Harry and Ron's memories, but fortunately for everyone except him, Lockhart attempted to cast the <a href="/wiki/Memory_Charm" title="Memory Charm">Memory Charm</a> with Ron's broken wand, and the charm backfired. Harry, Ron, and <a href="/wiki/Hermione_Granger" title="Hermione Granger">Hermione Granger</a> encountered him again, with absolutely no memories but still using his battered peacock feather quill, as a permanent resident of <a href="/wiki/St_Mungo%27s_Hospital_for_Magical_Maladies_and_Injuries" title="St Mungo&#39;s Hospital for Magical Maladies and Injuries">St Mungo's Hospital for Magical Maladies and Injuries</a>. Harry didn't have much sympathy for Lockhart for the attempt was all Lockhart's fault to begin with.
</p>
<figure class="article-thumb tleft show-info-icon" style="width: 134px"> 	<a href="http://vignette2.wikia.nocookie.net/harrypotter/images/c/c4/Filch_and_mrs._Norris.png/revision/latest?cb=20131117144808" 	class="image image-thumbnail" 	 	 	><img src="data:image/gif;base64,R0lGODlhAQABAIABAAAAAP///yH5BAEAAAEALAAAAAABAAEAQAICTAEAOw%3D%3D" 	 alt="Filch and mrs. Norris"  	class="thumbimage lzy lzyPlcHld " 	 	data-image-key="Filch_and_mrs._Norris.png" 	data-image-name="Filch and mrs. Norris.png" 	 data-src="http://vignette2.wikia.nocookie.net/harrypotter/images/c/c4/Filch_and_mrs._Norris.png/revision/latest/scale-to-width/134?cb=20131117144808"  	 width="134"  	 height="189"  	 	 	 onload="if(typeof ImgLzy===&#39;object&#39;){ImgLzy.load(this)}"  	><noscript><img src="http://vignette2.wikia.nocookie.net/harrypotter/images/c/c4/Filch_and_mrs._Norris.png/revision/latest/scale-to-width/134?cb=20131117144808" 	 alt="Filch and mrs. Norris"  	class="thumbimage " 	 	data-image-key="Filch_and_mrs._Norris.png" 	data-image-name="Filch and mrs. Norris.png" 	 	 width="134"  	 height="189"  	 	 	 	></noscript></a>  	<figcaption> 		 			<a href="/wiki/File:Filch_and_mrs._Norris.png" class="sprite info-icon"></a> 		 		 		 			<p class="caption">Filch &amp; Mrs. Norris</p> 		 	</figcaption> </figure>
<p>Harry disliked <a href="/wiki/Argus_Filch" title="Argus Filch">Argus Filch</a> the caretaker, and his cat, <a href="/wiki/Mrs._Norris" title="Mrs. Norris" class="mw-redirect">Mrs. Norris</a>, as much as they seemed to dislike all Hogwarts students, though Filch did eventually help younger students and the <a href="/wiki/Slytherin" title="Slytherin">Slytherins</a> leave the school prior to the <a href="/wiki/Battle_of_Hogwarts" title="Battle of Hogwarts">Battle of Hogwarts</a>. Harry found himself at odds with <a href="/wiki/Irma_Pince" title="Irma Pince">Irma Pince</a>, the librarian, when she very loudly expressed her displeasure at seeing <a href="/wiki/Severus_Snape%27s_copy_of_Advanced_Potion-Making" title="Severus Snape&#39;s copy of Advanced Potion-Making">The Half-Blood Prince</a>'s marked up copy of <i><a href="/wiki/Advanced_Potion-Making" title="Advanced Potion-Making">Advanced Potion-Making</a></i>, and he found it impossible to pay attention to Professor <a href="/wiki/Cuthbert_Binns" title="Cuthbert Binns">Cuthbert Binns</a>'s very boring, droning <a href="/wiki/History_of_Magic" title="History of Magic">History of Magic</a> lectures.
</p>
<figure class="article-thumb tright show-info-icon" style="width: 140px"> 	<a href="http://vignette3.wikia.nocookie.net/harrypotter/images/d/dd/NicoFlamel.PNG/revision/latest?cb=20140329202349" 	class="image image-thumbnail" 	 	 	><img src="data:image/gif;base64,R0lGODlhAQABAIABAAAAAP///yH5BAEAAAEALAAAAAABAAEAQAICTAEAOw%3D%3D" 	 alt="NicoFlamel"  	class="thumbimage lzy lzyPlcHld " 	 	data-image-key="NicoFlamel.PNG" 	data-image-name="NicoFlamel.PNG" 	 data-src="http://vignette3.wikia.nocookie.net/harrypotter/images/d/dd/NicoFlamel.PNG/revision/latest/scale-to-width/140?cb=20140329202349"  	 width="140"  	 height="197"  	 	 	 onload="if(typeof ImgLzy===&#39;object&#39;){ImgLzy.load(this)}"  	><noscript><img src="http://vignette3.wikia.nocookie.net/harrypotter/images/d/dd/NicoFlamel.PNG/revision/latest/scale-to-width/140?cb=20140329202349" 	 alt="NicoFlamel"  	class="thumbimage " 	 	data-image-key="NicoFlamel.PNG" 	data-image-name="NicoFlamel.PNG" 	 	 width="140"  	 height="197"  	 	 	 	></noscript></a>  	<figcaption> 		 			<a href="/wiki/File:NicoFlamel.PNG" class="sprite info-icon"></a> 		 		 		 			<p class="caption">Nearly headless Nick</p> 		 	</figcaption> </figure>
<p>Harry became friends with <a href="/wiki/Sir_Nicholas_de_Mimsy-Porpington" title="Sir Nicholas de Mimsy-Porpington" class="mw-redirect">"Nearly-Headless" Nick</a>, ghost of the <a href="/wiki/Gryffindor" title="Gryffindor">Gryffindor</a> house, in Harry's first year. Nick invited Harry to <a href="/wiki/Nicholas_de_Mimsy-Porpington%27s_five-hundredth_Deathday_Party" title="Nicholas de Mimsy-Porpington&#39;s five-hundredth Deathday Party">his death-day party</a>, which Harry reluctantly attended, along with <a href="/wiki/Ronald_Weasley" title="Ronald Weasley">Ron Weasley</a> and <a href="/wiki/Hermione_Granger" title="Hermione Granger">Hermione Granger</a>, instead of the <a href="/wiki/Hallowe%27en_feast" title="Hallowe&#39;en feast" class="mw-redirect">Hallowe'en feast</a>. After <a href="/wiki/Sirius_Black" title="Sirius Black">Sirius Black</a>'s death in <a href="/wiki/1995" title="1995">1995</a>, they had a discussion about <a href="/wiki/Death" title="Death">death</a>, and Nick told him that very few wizards choose to come back as ghosts.
</p>
<div class="quote">
<dl><dd><span title="Source: Harry Potter and the Chamber of Secrets">"<i>Harry, if you die down there, you're welcome to share my toilet.</i>"</span>
</dd><dd>&#8212;Myrtle to Harry before he enters the Chamber of Secrets<sup class="noprint"><a href="/wiki/Harry_Potter_and_the_Chamber_of_Secrets" title="Harry Potter and the Chamber of Secrets">[src]</a></sup>
</dd><dd></div>
</dd></dl>
<figure class="article-thumb tleft show-info-icon" style="width: 140px"> 	<a href="http://vignette2.wikia.nocookie.net/harrypotter/images/0/03/Myrtle1.PNG/revision/latest?cb=20090822185712" 	class="image image-thumbnail" 	 	 	><img src="data:image/gif;base64,R0lGODlhAQABAIABAAAAAP///yH5BAEAAAEALAAAAAABAAEAQAICTAEAOw%3D%3D" 	 alt="Myrtle1"  	class="thumbimage lzy lzyPlcHld " 	 	data-image-key="Myrtle1.PNG" 	data-image-name="Myrtle1.PNG" 	 data-src="http://vignette2.wikia.nocookie.net/harrypotter/images/0/03/Myrtle1.PNG/revision/latest/scale-to-width/140?cb=20090822185712"  	 width="140"  	 height="208"  	 	 	 onload="if(typeof ImgLzy===&#39;object&#39;){ImgLzy.load(this)}"  	><noscript><img src="http://vignette2.wikia.nocookie.net/harrypotter/images/0/03/Myrtle1.PNG/revision/latest/scale-to-width/140?cb=20090822185712" 	 alt="Myrtle1"  	class="thumbimage " 	 	data-image-key="Myrtle1.PNG" 	data-image-name="Myrtle1.PNG" 	 	 width="140"  	 height="208"  	 	 	 	></noscript></a>  	<figcaption> 		 			<a href="/wiki/File:Myrtle1.PNG" class="sprite info-icon"></a> 		 		 		 			<p class="caption">Moaning Myrtle</p> 		 	</figcaption> </figure>
<p>Harry also met <a href="/wiki/Myrtle" title="Myrtle">Moaning Myrtle</a> at <a href="/wiki/Nicholas_de_Mimsy-Porpington%27s_five-hundredth_Deathday_Party" title="Nicholas de Mimsy-Porpington&#39;s five-hundredth Deathday Party">Nick's death-day party</a>. Myrtle was an unpleasant ghost of a girl that lived in the girls' toilet. Harry learned in <a href="/wiki/1993" title="1993">1993</a> that Myrtle had been killed by <a href="/wiki/Salazar_Slytherin%27s_Basilisk" title="Salazar Slytherin&#39;s Basilisk" class="mw-redirect">Salazar Slytherin's Basilisk</a>, which helped Harry find the location of the entrance to the <a href="/wiki/Chamber_of_Secrets" title="Chamber of Secrets">Chamber of Secrets</a>. She was disappointed when Harry survived his encounter with <a href="/wiki/Tom_Riddle" title="Tom Riddle">Tom Riddle</a> in the Chamber of Secrets, saying that she would have shared her toilet with him if he had died. Myrtle aided Harry twice while he was competing in the Triwizard Tournament. First, she helped him decipher the clue for the second task; and then she pointed him in the right direction while he was in the lake. The last time Harry saw Myrtle was when he a cast <a href="/wiki/Sectumsempra" title="Sectumsempra">Sectumsempra</a>, not knowing what it did, and hit <a href="/wiki/Draco_Malfoy" title="Draco Malfoy">Draco Malfoy</a>.
</p>
<figure class="article-thumb tright show-info-icon" style="width: 148px"> 	<a href="http://vignette2.wikia.nocookie.net/harrypotter/images/b/b5/376px-Helena.jpg/revision/latest?cb=20120206171507" 	class="image image-thumbnail" 	 	 	><img src="data:image/gif;base64,R0lGODlhAQABAIABAAAAAP///yH5BAEAAAEALAAAAAABAAEAQAICTAEAOw%3D%3D" 	 alt="376px-Helena"  	class="thumbimage lzy lzyPlcHld " 	 	data-image-key="376px-Helena.jpg" 	data-image-name="376px-Helena.jpg" 	 data-src="http://vignette2.wikia.nocookie.net/harrypotter/images/b/b5/376px-Helena.jpg/revision/latest/scale-to-width/148?cb=20120206171507"  	 width="148"  	 height="186"  	 	 	 onload="if(typeof ImgLzy===&#39;object&#39;){ImgLzy.load(this)}"  	><noscript><img src="http://vignette2.wikia.nocookie.net/harrypotter/images/b/b5/376px-Helena.jpg/revision/latest/scale-to-width/148?cb=20120206171507" 	 alt="376px-Helena"  	class="thumbimage " 	 	data-image-key="376px-Helena.jpg" 	data-image-name="376px-Helena.jpg" 	 	 width="148"  	 height="186"  	 	 	 	></noscript></a>  	<figcaption> 		 			<a href="/wiki/File:376px-Helena.jpg" class="sprite info-icon"></a> 		 		 		 			<p class="caption">Helenea Ravenclaw (Grey Lady)</p> 		 	</figcaption> </figure>
<p>Harry met the <a href="/wiki/Helena_Ravenclaw" title="Helena Ravenclaw">Grey Lady</a> in <a href="/wiki/1998" title="1998">1998</a>. He learned that, when she lived, she was <a href="/wiki/Helena_Ravenclaw" title="Helena Ravenclaw">Helena Ravenclaw</a>, and that she had been killed by the <a href="/wiki/Bloody_Baron" title="Bloody Baron">Bloody Baron</a>, who had subsequently killed himself, horrified at having killed the woman he loved. She hesitantly revealed to Harry that she had stolen <a href="/wiki/Rowena_Ravenclaw%27s_Diadem" title="Rowena Ravenclaw&#39;s Diadem" class="mw-redirect">her mother's Diadem</a> and hidden it in an <a href="/wiki/Albania" title="Albania">Albanian</a> forest; she even more reluctantly admitted that Harry was not the first person she had told. Her admitting she had in fact divulged its whereabouts to a young <a href="/wiki/Tom_Riddle" title="Tom Riddle">Tom Riddle</a> led Harry to realise where Riddle must have hidden it, and he assured Helena that she was neither the first nor the last to fall prey to Tom Riddle's charms.
</p>
<h3><span class="mw-headline" id="Ministry_of_Magic">Ministry of Magic</span></h3>
<div class="quote">
<dl><dd><span title="Source: Harry Potter and the Half-Blood Prince"><b>Dumbledore</b>: "<i>It was Fudge's idea originally, you know. During his last days in office, when he was desperately trying to cling to his post, he sought a meeting with you, hoping that you would give him your support —</i>"
</dd><dd><b>Harry</b>: "<i>After everything Fudge did last year? After Umbridge?</i>"</span>
</dd><dd>&#8212; Harry and Dumbledore talking about Harry's meeting with Rufus Scrimgeour<sup class="noprint"><a href="/wiki/Harry_Potter_and_the_Half-Blood_Prince" title="Harry Potter and the Half-Blood Prince">[src]</a></sup>
</dd></dl>
</div>
<p>Harry had a mixed relationship with the <a href="/wiki/British_Ministry_of_Magic" title="British Ministry of Magic">Ministry of Magic</a>. In <a href="/wiki/1992" title="1992">1992</a>, Harry had his first run-in with the Ministry after <a href="/wiki/Dobby" title="Dobby">Dobby</a> had smashed a pudding in his Aunt and Uncle’s house. Although the incident was not Harry’s fault, the Ministry believed that Harry had used magic illegally while under-age, and given him an official warning.
</p><p>A year later, Harry lost his temper and blew up his <a href="/wiki/Marjorie_Dursley" title="Marjorie Dursley">"Aunt" Marge</a>. Believing that this time he would surely be expelled from Hogwarts, Harry went on the run and boarded the <a href="/wiki/Knight_Bus" title="Knight Bus">Knight Bus</a>, but ran into <a href="/wiki/Cornelius_Fudge" title="Cornelius Fudge">Cornelius Fudge</a>, then Minister for Magic, who seemed strangely unconcerned by what Harry had done. Furthermore, Fudge treated Harry like a friend, although he did not sign Harry’s letter permitting to allow him to visit <a href="/wiki/Hogsmeade" title="Hogsmeade">Hogsmeade</a>.
</p>
<figure class="article-thumb tleft show-info-icon" style="width: 245px"> 	<a href="http://vignette3.wikia.nocookie.net/harrypotter/images/1/14/Tumblr_m0di8xuToO1qleyj1o2_r1_250.gif/revision/latest?cb=20140422150005" 	class="image image-thumbnail" 	 	 	><img src="data:image/gif;base64,R0lGODlhAQABAIABAAAAAP///yH5BAEAAAEALAAAAAABAAEAQAICTAEAOw%3D%3D" 	 alt="Tumblr m0di8xuToO1qleyj1o2 r1 250"  	class="thumbimage lzy lzyPlcHld " 	 	data-image-key="Tumblr_m0di8xuToO1qleyj1o2_r1_250.gif" 	data-image-name="Tumblr m0di8xuToO1qleyj1o2 r1 250.gif" 	 data-src="http://vignette3.wikia.nocookie.net/harrypotter/images/1/14/Tumblr_m0di8xuToO1qleyj1o2_r1_250.gif/revision/latest?cb=20140422150005"  	 width="245"  	 height="120"  	 	 	 onload="if(typeof ImgLzy===&#39;object&#39;){ImgLzy.load(this)}"  	><noscript><img src="http://vignette3.wikia.nocookie.net/harrypotter/images/1/14/Tumblr_m0di8xuToO1qleyj1o2_r1_250.gif/revision/latest?cb=20140422150005" 	 alt="Tumblr m0di8xuToO1qleyj1o2 r1 250"  	class="thumbimage " 	 	data-image-key="Tumblr_m0di8xuToO1qleyj1o2_r1_250.gif" 	data-image-name="Tumblr m0di8xuToO1qleyj1o2 r1 250.gif" 	 	 width="245"  	 height="120"  	 	 	 	></noscript></a>  	<figcaption> 		 			<a href="/wiki/File:Tumblr_m0di8xuToO1qleyj1o2_r1_250.gif" class="sprite info-icon"></a> 		 		 		 			<p class="caption">The Ministry of Magic</p> 		 	</figcaption> </figure>
<p>However, by <a href="/wiki/1995" title="1995">1995</a>, the relationship between Fudge and Harry was not so rosy. Harry had witnessed Voldemort’s return to power, which he told both <a href="/wiki/Albus_Dumbledore" title="Albus Dumbledore">Dumbledore</a> and Fudge. The latter stoutly refused to believe Harry, and branded Dumbledore and Harry as liars/nutters in a <a href="/wiki/Campaign_to_discredit_Albus_Dumbledore_and_Harry_Potter" title="Campaign to discredit Albus Dumbledore and Harry Potter">smear campaign</a>. In the summer of 1995, Harry performed a Patronus Charm to save <a href="/wiki/Dudley_Dursley" title="Dudley Dursley">Dudley Dursley</a> and himself from Dementors, for which Harry was unreasonably threatened with expulsion from <a href="/wiki/Hogwarts_School_of_Witchcraft_and_Wizardry" title="Hogwarts School of Witchcraft and Wizardry">Hogwarts</a>, tried by the entire <a href="/wiki/Wizengamot" title="Wizengamot">Wizengamot</a>. Though Harry was cleared of all charges, thanks to Dumbledore's defence and <a href="/wiki/Amelia_Bones" title="Amelia Bones">Amelia Bones</a>'s impartiality, Fudge took his revenge by employing his undersecretary <a href="/wiki/Dolores_Umbridge" title="Dolores Umbridge">Dolores Umbridge</a> as <a href="/wiki/Defence_Against_the_Dark_Arts" title="Defence Against the Dark Arts">Defence Against the Dark Arts</a> Professor and <a href="/wiki/Hogwarts_High_Inquisitor" title="Hogwarts High Inquisitor">High Inquisitor</a> of Hogwarts. Umbridge sadistically <a href="/wiki/Blood_Quill" title="Blood Quill" class="mw-redirect">tortured</a> Harry when he repeatedly contradicted the Ministry’s opinion that Voldemort had not returned. In <a href="/wiki/1996" title="1996">1996</a>, after Dumbledore’s Army was discovered, Fudge came to Hogwarts to expel Harry, but Dumbledore claimed the D.A. had been formed on his orders. Though Harry was allowed to remain at Hogwarts, Dumbledore was forced to go on the run after overpowering several ministry officials. Later that year, toward the end of <a href="/wiki/Battle_of_the_Department_of_Mysteries" title="Battle of the Department of Mysteries">Battle of the Department of Mysteries</a>, Fudge arrived at the Ministry in time to see Voldemort <a href="/wiki/Apparition" title="Apparition">disapparate</a> with <a href="/wiki/Bellatrix_Lestrange" title="Bellatrix Lestrange">Bellatrix Lestrange</a>, and was forced to acknowledge that Dumbledore and Harry had been telling the truth all along. As the wizarding community had lost all confidence in him, he was forced to resign as <a href="/wiki/Minister_for_Magic" title="Minister for Magic">Minister for Magic</a>.
</p><p>Fudge's successor, <a href="/wiki/Rufus_Scrimgeour" title="Rufus Scrimgeour">Rufus Scrimgeour</a>, did little to improve Harry's view of the Ministry. Scrimgeour asked Harry to essentially become the Ministry's mascot for the purpose of restoring public confidence, despite all they had done to Harry and the fact that Dolores Umbridge was still in their employ. Harry refused, stating he couldn't pretend to approve of the ministry's methods, showing Scrimgeour the scars on the back of his hand, and citing the fact that Scrimgeour was arresting innocent people like <a href="/wiki/Stanley_Shunpike" title="Stanley Shunpike">Stan Shunpike</a>. In <a href="/wiki/1997" title="1997">1997</a>, Voldemort and his Death Eaters took over the Ministry, and killed the Minister after torturing him in an attempt to ascertain Harry’s whereabouts. Although Harry did not like Scrimgeour, who hardly appeared to care at all about what actually happened to Harry or his friends, he was incredibly grateful that the Minister's final act had been to protect him.
</p><p>After <a href="/wiki/Fall_of_the_Ministry_of_Magic" title="Fall of the Ministry of Magic">Lord Voldemort’s takeover of the Ministry</a>, with an <a href="/wiki/Imperius_Curse" title="Imperius Curse">Imperiused</a> <a href="/wiki/Pius_Thicknesse" title="Pius Thicknesse">Pius Thicknesse</a> acting as Voldemort's puppet Minister for Magic, Harry’s relationship with the Ministry was worse than ever before. They named Harry Potter "Undesirable Number 1" and claimed he was wanted for questioning about the death of Albus Dumbledore.
</p><p>In <a href="/wiki/1998" title="1998">1998</a>, after Voldemort's death, the position of Minister of Magic went to <a href="/wiki/Order_of_the_Phoenix" title="Order of the Phoenix">Order of the Phoenix</a> member and Harry's friend <a href="/wiki/Kingsley_Shacklebolt" title="Kingsley Shacklebolt">Kingsley Shacklebolt</a>, who later employed Harry as an <a href="/wiki/Auror" title="Auror">Auror</a>.
</p>
<h3><span class="mw-headline" id="Death_Eaters_and_enemies">Death Eaters and enemies</span></h3>
<div class="quote">
<dl><dd><span title="Source: Harry Potter and the Half-Blood Prince">"<i>And they'd love to have me. We'd be best pals if they didn't keep trying to do me in </i>[...]<i> </i>"</span>
</dd><dd>&#8212;Harry sarcastically talking about his relationship with the Death Eaters<sup class="noprint"><a href="/wiki/Harry_Potter_and_the_Half-Blood_Prince" title="Harry Potter and the Half-Blood Prince">[src]</a></sup>
</dd><dd></div>
</dd></dl>
<figure class="article-thumb tright show-info-icon" style="width: 140px"> 	<a href="http://vignette2.wikia.nocookie.net/harrypotter/images/e/e1/Unidentified_Death_Eater.jpg/revision/latest?cb=20091129151608" 	class="image image-thumbnail" 	 	 	><img src="data:image/gif;base64,R0lGODlhAQABAIABAAAAAP///yH5BAEAAAEALAAAAAABAAEAQAICTAEAOw%3D%3D" 	 alt="Unidentified Death Eater"  	class="thumbimage lzy lzyPlcHld " 	 	data-image-key="Unidentified_Death_Eater.jpg" 	data-image-name="Unidentified Death Eater.jpg" 	 data-src="http://vignette2.wikia.nocookie.net/harrypotter/images/e/e1/Unidentified_Death_Eater.jpg/revision/latest/scale-to-width/140?cb=20091129151608"  	 width="140"  	 height="195"  	 	 	 onload="if(typeof ImgLzy===&#39;object&#39;){ImgLzy.load(this)}"  	><noscript><img src="http://vignette2.wikia.nocookie.net/harrypotter/images/e/e1/Unidentified_Death_Eater.jpg/revision/latest/scale-to-width/140?cb=20091129151608" 	 alt="Unidentified Death Eater"  	class="thumbimage " 	 	data-image-key="Unidentified_Death_Eater.jpg" 	data-image-name="Unidentified Death Eater.jpg" 	 	 width="140"  	 height="195"  	 	 	 	></noscript></a>  	<figcaption> 		 			<a href="/wiki/File:Unidentified_Death_Eater.jpg" class="sprite info-icon"></a> 		 		 		 			<p class="caption">Death Eater</p> 		 	</figcaption> </figure>
<p><a href="/wiki/Death_Eaters" title="Death Eaters">Death Eaters</a> were dark wizards under the orders of Voldemort during both wizarding wars; known Death Eaters included <a href="/wiki/Draco_Malfoy" title="Draco Malfoy">Draco Malfoy</a>, <a href="/wiki/Bellatrix_Lestrange" title="Bellatrix Lestrange">Bellatrix Lestrange</a>, and <a href="/wiki/Peter_Pettigrew" title="Peter Pettigrew">Peter Pettigrew</a>. Though not all of Harry's enemies were Death Eaters, the ones who most persistently and ferociously pursued Harry and his friends were part of Voldemort's inner circle.
</p><p>The first of Voldemort's servants to try to murder Harry was his <a href="/wiki/Defence_Against_the_Dark_Arts" title="Defence Against the Dark Arts">Defence Against the Dark Arts</a> Professor, <a href="/wiki/Quirinus_Quirrell" title="Quirinus Quirrell">Quirinus Quirrell</a>. Though not a Death Eater, he encountered Voldemort in the forests of <a href="/wiki/Albania" title="Albania">Albania</a>, and was seduced into the Dark Lord's service by promises of wealth and power. Harry found out about Quirrell's true loyalties at the end of his <a href="/wiki/1991-1992_school_year" title="1991-1992 school year" class="mw-redirect">first year</a>, in the seventh of the <a href="/wiki/Philosopher%27s_Stone_Chambers" title="Philosopher&#39;s Stone Chambers" class="mw-redirect">Philosopher's Stone Chambers</a>. This news also came with the discovery that Voldemort was actually sharing Quirrell's body, and the turban Quirrell wore was, in fact, hiding Voldemort's face on the back of Quirrell's head. When Quirrell attempted to grab Harry, he found he was unable to do so without experiencing unbearable pain, due to the power of Harry's mother's <a href="/wiki/Sacrificial_protection" title="Sacrificial protection">Sacrificial protection</a>. Voldemort detached himself from his servant to escape the pain and fled before <a href="/wiki/Albus_Dumbledore" title="Albus Dumbledore">Albus Dumbledore</a>'s arrival because Dumbledore could have killed him, leaving Quirrell to die.
</p>
<figure class="article-thumb tleft show-info-icon" style="width: 140px"> 	<a href="http://vignette4.wikia.nocookie.net/harrypotter/images/a/a0/Barty_Crouch%2C_Jr.jpg/revision/latest?cb=20100429165555" 	class="image image-thumbnail" 	 	 	><img src="data:image/gif;base64,R0lGODlhAQABAIABAAAAAP///yH5BAEAAAEALAAAAAABAAEAQAICTAEAOw%3D%3D" 	 alt="Barty Crouch, Jr"  	class="thumbimage lzy lzyPlcHld " 	 	data-image-key="Barty_Crouch%2C_Jr.jpg" 	data-image-name="Barty Crouch, Jr.jpg" 	 data-src="http://vignette4.wikia.nocookie.net/harrypotter/images/a/a0/Barty_Crouch%2C_Jr.jpg/revision/latest/scale-to-width/140?cb=20100429165555"  	 width="140"  	 height="220"  	 	 	 onload="if(typeof ImgLzy===&#39;object&#39;){ImgLzy.load(this)}"  	><noscript><img src="http://vignette4.wikia.nocookie.net/harrypotter/images/a/a0/Barty_Crouch%2C_Jr.jpg/revision/latest/scale-to-width/140?cb=20100429165555" 	 alt="Barty Crouch, Jr"  	class="thumbimage " 	 	data-image-key="Barty_Crouch%2C_Jr.jpg" 	data-image-name="Barty Crouch, Jr.jpg" 	 	 width="140"  	 height="220"  	 	 	 	></noscript></a>  	<figcaption> 		 			<a href="/wiki/File:Barty_Crouch,_Jr.jpg" class="sprite info-icon"></a> 		 		 		 			<p class="caption">Barty Crouch Jr., a fanatically loyal Death Eater</p> 		 	</figcaption> </figure>
<div class="quote">
<dl><dd><span title="Source: Harry Potter and the Goblet of Fire"><b>Harry</b>: "<i>You're mad!</i>"
