</dd><dd><b>Barty Crouch</b>: "<i>Mad, am I? We'll see! We'll see who's mad, now that the Dark Lord has returned, with me at his side! He's back, Harry Potter, you did not conquer him — and now — I conquer </i>you<i>!</i>"</span>
</dd><dd>&#8212; Harry Potter and Barty Crouch Jr., after Voldemort's return<sup class="noprint"><a href="/wiki/Harry_Potter_and_the_Goblet_of_Fire" title="Harry Potter and the Goblet of Fire">[src]</a></sup>
</dd></dl>
</div>
<p>Harry first learned about the <a href="/wiki/Death_Eaters" title="Death Eaters">Death Eaters</a> after the <a href="/wiki/Riot_at_the_Quidditch_World_Cup" title="Riot at the Quidditch World Cup" class="mw-redirect">1994 Quidditch World Cup Riot</a>, where <a href="/wiki/Bartemius_Crouch_Jr." title="Bartemius Crouch Jr.">Barty Crouch Jr.</a> raised the <a href="/wiki/Dark_Mark" title="Dark Mark">Dark Mark</a> in the sky. At the end of Harry's <a href="/wiki/1994%E2%80%931995_school_year" title="1994–1995 school year">fourth year</a>, he realised that the man he thought was <a href="/wiki/Alastor_Moody" title="Alastor Moody">Alastor Moody</a> was actually Barty Crouch Jr., disguised by way of <a href="/wiki/Polyjuice_Potion" title="Polyjuice Potion">Polyjuice Potion</a>. Crouch attempted to kill Harry, but Professors <a href="/wiki/Albus_Dumbledore" title="Albus Dumbledore">Dumbledore</a>, <a href="/wiki/Minerva_McGonagall" title="Minerva McGonagall">McGonagall</a> and <a href="/wiki/Severus_Snape" title="Severus Snape">Snape</a> rushed into Moody's office and stunned him. When Dumbledore forced Crouch to drink Veritaserum, he revealed how he had escaped from <a href="/wiki/Azkaban" title="Azkaban">Azkaban</a> with the help his father and dying mother, and told Dumbledore about how Voldemort had helped him overpower his father, allowing Crouch to later <a href="/wiki/Confundus_Charm" title="Confundus Charm">confund</a> the <a href="/wiki/Goblet_of_Fire" title="Goblet of Fire">Goblet of Fire</a> to declare Harry a Triwizard Champion. Cornelius Fudge arrived at Hogwarts soon after with a <a href="/wiki/Dementor" title="Dementor">Dementor</a> for a bodyguard, and the latter subsequently gave Crouch the <a href="/wiki/Dementor%27s_Kiss" title="Dementor&#39;s Kiss">Dementor's Kiss</a>.
</p>
<figure class="article-thumb tright show-info-icon" style="width: 140px"> 	<a href="http://vignette1.wikia.nocookie.net/harrypotter/images/9/9c/Lucius_Malfoy_Profile.JPG/revision/latest?cb=20081103100238" 	class="image image-thumbnail" 	 	 	><img src="data:image/gif;base64,R0lGODlhAQABAIABAAAAAP///yH5BAEAAAEALAAAAAABAAEAQAICTAEAOw%3D%3D" 	 alt="Lucius Malfoy Profile"  	class="thumbimage lzy lzyPlcHld " 	 	data-image-key="Lucius_Malfoy_Profile.JPG" 	data-image-name="Lucius Malfoy Profile.JPG" 	 data-src="http://vignette1.wikia.nocookie.net/harrypotter/images/9/9c/Lucius_Malfoy_Profile.JPG/revision/latest/scale-to-width/140?cb=20081103100238"  	 width="140"  	 height="203"  	 	 	 onload="if(typeof ImgLzy===&#39;object&#39;){ImgLzy.load(this)}"  	><noscript><img src="http://vignette1.wikia.nocookie.net/harrypotter/images/9/9c/Lucius_Malfoy_Profile.JPG/revision/latest/scale-to-width/140?cb=20081103100238" 	 alt="Lucius Malfoy Profile"  	class="thumbimage " 	 	data-image-key="Lucius_Malfoy_Profile.JPG" 	data-image-name="Lucius Malfoy Profile.JPG" 	 	 width="140"  	 height="203"  	 	 	 	></noscript></a>  	<figcaption> 		 			<a href="/wiki/File:Lucius_Malfoy_Profile.JPG" class="sprite info-icon"></a> 		 		 		 			<p class="caption">Lucius Malfoy</p> 		 	</figcaption> </figure>
<p>Harry first saw <a href="/wiki/Lucius_Malfoy" title="Lucius Malfoy">Lucius Malfoy</a> in <a href="/wiki/1992" title="1992">1992</a> at <a href="/wiki/Borgin_and_Burkes" title="Borgin and Burkes">Borgin and Burkes</a>, though they didn't officially meet until Lucius got into a fist fight with <a href="/wiki/Arthur_Weasley" title="Arthur Weasley">Arthur Weasley</a> at <a href="/wiki/Flourish_and_Blotts" title="Flourish and Blotts">Flourish and Blotts</a>, over Malfoy's many insults aimed at the Weasley family. Though Harry didn't know it till much later, after a good deal of damage had been done, Malfoy had used the scuffle as a pretext for handing <a href="/wiki/Ginny_Weasley" title="Ginny Weasley" class="mw-redirect">Ginny Weasley</a> a book that turned out to be <a href="/wiki/Tom_Riddle%27s_Diary" title="Tom Riddle&#39;s Diary" class="mw-redirect">Tom Riddle's Diary</a>. Harry and Malfoy met again at the end of the same year, when Harry tricked Malfoy into freeing his <a href="/wiki/House-elf" title="House-elf">House-elf</a>, Dobby; when Lucius threatened Harry in his anger at having lost his servant, Dobby demonstrating the might of his <a href="/wiki/House-elf_magic" title="House-elf magic">House-elf magic</a> to protect Harry. They would eventually meet again in the <a href="/wiki/British_Ministry_of_Magic" title="British Ministry of Magic">Ministry of Magic</a>, in <a href="/wiki/1995" title="1995">1995</a>, after which Lucius was outed as an active Death Eater and arrested. Following his failure at the Ministry, and Voldemort's discovery of the fact that Lucius had allowed one of his <a href="/wiki/Horcrux" title="Horcrux">Horcruxes</a> to be destroyed, Voldemort punished him by giving his son the seemingly impossible task of assassinating <a href="/wiki/Albus_Dumbledore" title="Albus Dumbledore">Albus Dumbledore</a>. When Harry and his friends escaped on Lucius' watch after the <a href="/wiki/Skirmish_at_Malfoy_Manor" title="Skirmish at Malfoy Manor">Skirmish at Malfoy Manor</a>, in <a href="/wiki/1998" title="1998">1998</a>, the Malfoys fell further out of Voldemort's favour. During the <a href="/wiki/Battle_of_Hogwarts" title="Battle of Hogwarts">Battle of Hogwarts</a>, Lucius and his wife both deserted the Death Eaters, placing greater importance in the safety of their son, and Narcissa's crucial act of lying to Voldemort about Harry's death insured that the Malfoy family was not sent to <a href="/wiki/Azkaban" title="Azkaban">Azkaban</a>.
</p><p>Throughout the <a href="/wiki/Second_Wizarding_War" title="Second Wizarding War">Second Wizarding War</a>, Harry encountered a number of other Death Eaters: <a href="/wiki/Antonin_Dolohov" title="Antonin Dolohov">Antonin Dolohov</a>, who murdered the Prewetts and Remus Lupin, and almost killed <a href="/wiki/Hermione_Granger" title="Hermione Granger">Hermione Granger</a> during the <a href="/wiki/Battle_of_the_Department_of_Mysteries" title="Battle of the Department of Mysteries">Battle of the Department of Mysteries</a>; <a href="/wiki/Travers" title="Travers">Travers</a>, who killed the McKinnons; <a href="/wiki/Augustus_Rookwood" title="Augustus Rookwood">Augustus Rookwood</a>, who was possibly responsible for the explosion that killed <a href="/wiki/Fred_Weasley" title="Fred Weasley">Fred Weasley</a>; <a href="/wiki/Yaxley" title="Yaxley">Yaxley</a>, who imprisoned innocent Muggle-borns with the <a href="/wiki/Muggle-Born_Registration_Commission" title="Muggle-Born Registration Commission">Muggle-Born Registration Commission</a>; <a href="/wiki/Walden_Macnair" title="Walden Macnair">Walden Macnair</a>, who was violent and bloodthirsty, and almost killed <a href="/wiki/Buckbeak" title="Buckbeak">Buckbeak</a> in <a href="/wiki/1993" title="1993">1993</a>; <a href="/wiki/Alecto_Carrow" title="Alecto Carrow">Alecto</a> and <a href="/wiki/Amycus_Carrow" title="Amycus Carrow">Amycus Carrow</a>, who tortured the students of Hogwarts when they had been appointed Deputy Headmasters; <a href="/wiki/Thorfinn_Rowle" title="Thorfinn Rowle">Thorfinn Rowle</a>, who indiscriminately cast Killing Curses all around him during the <a href="/wiki/Battle_of_the_Astronomy_Tower" title="Battle of the Astronomy Tower">Battle of the Astronomy Tower</a> and took part in the <a href="/wiki/Luchino_Caffe_Duel" title="Luchino Caffe Duel">skirmish</a> at the <a href="/wiki/Luchino_Caffe" title="Luchino Caffe">Luchino Caffe</a>, and <a href="/wiki/Rodolphus_Lestrange" title="Rodolphus Lestrange">Rodolphus</a> and <a href="/wiki/Rabastan_Lestrange" title="Rabastan Lestrange">Rabastan Lestrange</a>, who participated in the torture of <a href="/wiki/Alice_Longbottom" title="Alice Longbottom">Alice</a> and <a href="/wiki/Frank_Longbottom" title="Frank Longbottom">Frank Longbottom</a>. Lucius Malfoy, Rookwood, Dolohov, MacNair, and the Lestranges (including <a href="/wiki/Bellatrix_Lestrange" title="Bellatrix Lestrange">Bellatrix</a>), all took part in the <a href="/wiki/Battle_of_the_Department_of_Mysteries" title="Battle of the Department of Mysteries">Battle of the Department of Mysteries</a>, along with <a href="/wiki/Vincent_Crabbe%27s_father" title="Vincent Crabbe&#39;s father" class="mw-redirect">Mr Crabbe</a> and <a href="/wiki/Gregory_Goyle%27s_father" title="Gregory Goyle&#39;s father" class="mw-redirect">Mr Goyle</a> (fathers of <a href="/wiki/Vincent_Crabbe" title="Vincent Crabbe">Vincent Crabbe</a> and <a href="/wiki/Gregory_Goyle" title="Gregory Goyle">Gregory Goyle</a>), <a href="/wiki/Theodore_Nott%27s_father" title="Theodore Nott&#39;s father" class="mw-redirect">Mr Nott</a>, <a href="/wiki/Jugson" title="Jugson">Jugson</a>, <a href="/wiki/Avery_(Riddle-era)" title="Avery (Riddle-era)">Avery</a> and <a href="/wiki/Mulciber_(Riddle-era)" title="Mulciber (Riddle-era)">Mulciber</a>.
</p>
<figure class="article-thumb tleft show-info-icon" style="width: 140px"> 	<a href="http://vignette2.wikia.nocookie.net/harrypotter/images/2/27/Fenrir_Greyback_%28HBP_promo%29_1.jpg/revision/latest?cb=20090817193840" 	class="image image-thumbnail" 	 	 	><img src="data:image/gif;base64,R0lGODlhAQABAIABAAAAAP///yH5BAEAAAEALAAAAAABAAEAQAICTAEAOw%3D%3D" 	 alt="Fenrir Greyback (HBP promo) 1"  	class="thumbimage lzy lzyPlcHld " 	 	data-image-key="Fenrir_Greyback_%28HBP_promo%29_1.jpg" 	data-image-name="Fenrir Greyback (HBP promo) 1.jpg" 	 data-src="http://vignette2.wikia.nocookie.net/harrypotter/images/2/27/Fenrir_Greyback_%28HBP_promo%29_1.jpg/revision/latest/scale-to-width/140?cb=20090817193840"  	 width="140"  	 height="187"  	 	 	 onload="if(typeof ImgLzy===&#39;object&#39;){ImgLzy.load(this)}"  	><noscript><img src="http://vignette2.wikia.nocookie.net/harrypotter/images/2/27/Fenrir_Greyback_%28HBP_promo%29_1.jpg/revision/latest/scale-to-width/140?cb=20090817193840" 	 alt="Fenrir Greyback (HBP promo) 1"  	class="thumbimage " 	 	data-image-key="Fenrir_Greyback_%28HBP_promo%29_1.jpg" 	data-image-name="Fenrir Greyback (HBP promo) 1.jpg" 	 	 width="140"  	 height="187"  	 	 	 	></noscript></a>  	<figcaption> 		 			<a href="/wiki/File:Fenrir_Greyback_(HBP_promo)_1.jpg" class="sprite info-icon"></a> 		 		 		 			<p class="caption">Fenrir Greyback</p> 		 	</figcaption> </figure>
<p>In <a href="/wiki/1997" title="1997">1997</a>, during the <a href="/wiki/Battle_of_the_Astronomy_Tower" title="Battle of the Astronomy Tower">Battle of the Astronomy Tower</a>, Harry got his first glimpse of <a href="/wiki/Fenrir_Greyback" title="Fenrir Greyback">Fenrir Greyback</a>, who was known for craving human flesh even out of <a href="/wiki/Werewolf" title="Werewolf">Werewolf</a> form, as well for planning his attacks by positioning himself near his intended victims prior to the full moon (typically the children of his employer's enemies). Harry, Ron and Hermione were taken hostage by Greyback and a gang of <a href="/wiki/Snatchers" title="Snatchers">Snatchers</a> just before the <a href="/wiki/Skirmish_at_Malfoy_Manor" title="Skirmish at Malfoy Manor">Skirmish at Malfoy Manor</a>, during which time Greyback expressed a disturbing interest in Hermione. Though he wasn't a Death Eater, and lacked the <a href="/wiki/Dark_Mark" title="Dark Mark">Dark Mark</a> <a href="/wiki/Tattoo" title="Tattoo">tattoo</a>, Greyback was allowed to wear Death Eater's robes whenever Voldemort made use of him.
</p>
<figure class="article-thumb tright show-info-icon" style="width: 140px"> 	<a href="http://vignette2.wikia.nocookie.net/harrypotter/images/4/4e/IgorKarkaroff.jpg/revision/latest?cb=20100724115703" 	class="image image-thumbnail" 	 	 	><img src="data:image/gif;base64,R0lGODlhAQABAIABAAAAAP///yH5BAEAAAEALAAAAAABAAEAQAICTAEAOw%3D%3D" 	 alt="IgorKarkaroff"  	class="thumbimage lzy lzyPlcHld " 	 	data-image-key="IgorKarkaroff.jpg" 	data-image-name="IgorKarkaroff.jpg" 	 data-src="http://vignette2.wikia.nocookie.net/harrypotter/images/4/4e/IgorKarkaroff.jpg/revision/latest/scale-to-width/140?cb=20100724115703"  	 width="140"  	 height="212"  	 	 	 onload="if(typeof ImgLzy===&#39;object&#39;){ImgLzy.load(this)}"  	><noscript><img src="http://vignette2.wikia.nocookie.net/harrypotter/images/4/4e/IgorKarkaroff.jpg/revision/latest/scale-to-width/140?cb=20100724115703" 	 alt="IgorKarkaroff"  	class="thumbimage " 	 	data-image-key="IgorKarkaroff.jpg" 	data-image-name="IgorKarkaroff.jpg" 	 	 width="140"  	 height="212"  	 	 	 	></noscript></a>  	<figcaption> 		 			<a href="/wiki/File:IgorKarkaroff.jpg" class="sprite info-icon"></a> 		 		 		 			<p class="caption">Igor Karkaroff</p> 		 	</figcaption> </figure>
<p>Harry met <a href="/wiki/Durmstrang_Institute" title="Durmstrang Institute">Durmstrang Institute</a>'s Headmaster, <a href="/wiki/Igor_Karkaroff" title="Igor Karkaroff">Igor Karkaroff</a>, in <a href="/wiki/1994" title="1994">1994</a>, during the <a href="/wiki/Triwizard_Tournament" title="Triwizard Tournament">Triwizard Tournament</a>. Harry later saw Karkaroff in Dumbledore's <a href="/wiki/Albus_Dumbledore%27s_Pensieve" title="Albus Dumbledore&#39;s Pensieve" class="mw-redirect">pensieve</a> bearing witness against several of his fellow Death Eaters, in exchange for his own freedom. Karkaroff fled after Voldemort's resurrection in <a href="/wiki/1995" title="1995">1995</a>. Two years later, Harry learned that Karkaroff's corpse was found in a shack in the north of Britain.
</p><p>Harry didn't initially think highly of <a href="/wiki/Sirius_Black" title="Sirius Black">Sirius Black</a>'s younger brother, <a href="/wiki/Regulus_Black" title="Regulus Black">Regulus</a>, who followed the family tradition of zealous pure-blood supremacy for most of his life. However, <a href="/wiki/Kreacher" title="Kreacher">Kreacher</a> later revealed to Harry, Ron and Hermione that Regulus had likely been the first to deduce the existence of Voldemort's <a href="/wiki/Horcrux" title="Horcrux">Horcruxes</a>, and subsequently attempted to find and destroy them. When he located the hiding place of <a href="/wiki/Salazar_Slytherin%27s_locket" title="Salazar Slytherin&#39;s locket">Salazar Slytherin's locket</a>, rather than force Kreacher to consume the <a href="/wiki/Drink_of_Despair" title="Drink of Despair">Drink of Despair</a> as Voldemort had done, Regulus drank it himself after ordering Kreacher to take and destroy the locket, resulting in Regulus' death. In all likelihood, Harry came to appreciate Regulus' bravery, and respect the level of compassion he had for beings that had long been ill-treated by wizarding kind.
</p>
<h2><span class="mw-headline" id="Media">Media</span></h2>
<h3><span class="mw-headline" id="Harry_Potter_and_the_Philosopher.27s_Stone">Harry Potter and the Philosopher's Stone</span></h3>

<h3><span class="mw-headline" id="Harry_Potter_and_the_Chamber_of_Secrets">Harry Potter and the Chamber of Secrets</span></h3>

<h2><span class="mw-headline" id="Etymology">Etymology</span></h2>
<figure class="article-thumb tleft show-info-icon" style="width: 160px"> 	<a href="http://vignette3.wikia.nocookie.net/harrypotter/images/9/99/Harrypotter_dormwindow.jpg/revision/latest?cb=20100322235457" 	class="image image-thumbnail" 	 	 	><img src="data:image/gif;base64,R0lGODlhAQABAIABAAAAAP///yH5BAEAAAEALAAAAAABAAEAQAICTAEAOw%3D%3D" 	 alt="Harrypotter dormwindow"  	class="thumbimage lzy lzyPlcHld " 	 	data-image-key="Harrypotter_dormwindow.jpg" 	data-image-name="Harrypotter dormwindow.jpg" 	 data-src="http://vignette3.wikia.nocookie.net/harrypotter/images/9/99/Harrypotter_dormwindow.jpg/revision/latest/scale-to-width/160?cb=20100322235457"  	 width="160"  	 height="224"  	 	 	 onload="if(typeof ImgLzy===&#39;object&#39;){ImgLzy.load(this)}"  	><noscript><img src="http://vignette3.wikia.nocookie.net/harrypotter/images/9/99/Harrypotter_dormwindow.jpg/revision/latest/scale-to-width/160?cb=20100322235457" 	 alt="Harrypotter dormwindow"  	class="thumbimage " 	 	data-image-key="Harrypotter_dormwindow.jpg" 	data-image-name="Harrypotter dormwindow.jpg" 	 	 width="160"  	 height="224"  	 	 	 	></noscript></a>  	<figcaption> 		 			<a href="/wiki/File:Harrypotter_dormwindow.jpg" class="sprite info-icon"></a> 		 		 		 			<p class="caption">Harry Potter in his dormitory with <a href="/wiki/Hedwig" title="Hedwig">Hedwig</a></p> 		 	</figcaption> </figure>
<p><a href="http://en.wikipedia.org/wiki/Harry_(name)" class="extiw exitstitial" title="wikipedia:Harry (name)">Harry</a> is the Middle English form of the name <a href="http://en.wikipedia.org/wiki/Henry_(given_name)" class="extiw exitstitial" title="wikipedia:Henry (given name)">Henry</a>, derived from the Germanic name <i>Heinrich,</i> from the words <i>heim,</i> meaning "home", and <i>ric</i>, meaning "power, ruler". It has been a very popular name in the English-speaking world for centuries. Harry can also be a diminutive form of the name Harold, from the Old English name <i>Hereweald</i>, meaning "leader of the army". It has been the name of five kings of Norway, three kings of Denmark, and two kings of England.<sup id="cite_ref-83" class="reference"><a href="#cite_note-83">[84]</a></sup><sup id="cite_ref-84" class="reference"><a href="#cite_note-84">[85]</a></sup> In an interview J. K. Rowling stated that 'Harry' had always been one of her favourite boy's names and that if her daughter had been a son she would have named him 'Harry', although then she would have to have come up with a different name for the books as it <i>"would have been too cruel to name him after my own son".</i> <sup id="cite_ref-accio-quote.org_85-0" class="reference"><a href="#cite_note-accio-quote.org-85">[86]</a></sup>
</p><p><a href="http://en.wikipedia.org/wiki/James_(name)" class="extiw exitstitial" title="wikipedia:James (name)">James</a> is derived from the same Hebrew name as Jacob, meaning “holds the heel” (in the Genesis narrative, Jacob was born grasping Esau′s heel and later bought his birthright). The name came into English language from the French variation of the Late Latin name Iacomus, a dialect variant of Iacobus, from the New Testament Greek Ἰάκωβος (Iakōbos), from Hebrew word יעקב (Yaʻaqov). James is Harry's middle name, James was the name of his father and is also the name of his first son.
</p><p><a href="http://en.wikipedia.org/wiki/Potter" class="extiw exitstitial" title="wikipedia:Potter">Potter</a> is a very common surname of English origin.<sup id="cite_ref-86" class="reference"><a href="#cite_note-86">[87]</a></sup> It traditionally refers to the occupation of making pottery. <a href="http://en.wikipedia.org/wiki/Beatrix_Potter" class="extiw exitstitial" title="wikipedia:Beatrix Potter">Beatrix Potter</a> was a well-known English children's author. <a href="http://en.wikipedia.org/wiki/Potter%27s_Field" class="extiw exitstitial" title="wikipedia:Potter&#39;s Field">Potter's Field</a> is the name for a burial ground for the unknown or unclaimed dead, particularly soldiers and orphans; the Potter family had many members that fit that description. The <a href="http://en.wikipedia.org/wiki/Potter_Box" class="extiw exitstitial" title="wikipedia:Potter Box">Potter Box</a> is a model for making ethical decisions developed at Harvard University. <a href="/wiki/J._K._Rowling" title="J. K. Rowling">J. K. Rowling</a> has also commented that she has liked the name since childhood, as a family that had lived near her carried this surname.<sup id="cite_ref-accio-quote.org_85-1" class="reference"><a href="#cite_note-accio-quote.org-85">[86]</a></sup><sup id="cite_ref-87" class="reference"><a href="#cite_note-87">[88]</a></sup>
</p>
<h2><span class="mw-headline" id="Behind_the_scenes">Behind the scenes</span></h2>
<div class="quote">
<dl><dd><span title="Source: J.K.Rowling Official Site">"<i>There are quite a few real Harry Potters out there. So far I have heard of a newborn baby who actually has Harry's full name (Harry James Potter), a barrister in London, a grandfather who was very pleased that he had become cool in his grandchildren's eyes, a soldier who died in the second world war (I was sent a picture of his tombstone) and a clockmaker who worked in London in the last century.</i>"</span>
</dd><dd>&#8212;<a href="/wiki/J._K._Rowling" title="J. K. Rowling">J. K. Rowling</a><sup class="noprint"><a href="/wiki/J.K.Rowling_Official_Site" title="J.K.Rowling Official Site" class="mw-redirect">[src]</a></sup>
</dd><dd></div>
</dd></dl>
<figure class="article-thumb tright show-info-icon" style="width: 155px"> 	<a href="http://vignette3.wikia.nocookie.net/harrypotter/images/9/94/Harrypotterdeathlyhallowspart1.jpg/revision/latest?cb=20121103172902" 	class="image image-thumbnail" 	 	 	><img src="data:image/gif;base64,R0lGODlhAQABAIABAAAAAP///yH5BAEAAAEALAAAAAABAAEAQAICTAEAOw%3D%3D" 	 alt="Harrypotterdeathlyhallowspart1"  	class="thumbimage lzy lzyPlcHld " 	 	data-image-key="Harrypotterdeathlyhallowspart1.jpg" 	data-image-name="Harrypotterdeathlyhallowspart1.jpg" 	 data-src="http://vignette3.wikia.nocookie.net/harrypotter/images/9/94/Harrypotterdeathlyhallowspart1.jpg/revision/latest/scale-to-width/155?cb=20121103172902"  	 width="155"  	 height="189"  	 	 	 onload="if(typeof ImgLzy===&#39;object&#39;){ImgLzy.load(this)}"  	><noscript><img src="http://vignette3.wikia.nocookie.net/harrypotter/images/9/94/Harrypotterdeathlyhallowspart1.jpg/revision/latest/scale-to-width/155?cb=20121103172902" 	 alt="Harrypotterdeathlyhallowspart1"  	class="thumbimage " 	 	data-image-key="Harrypotterdeathlyhallowspart1.jpg" 	data-image-name="Harrypotterdeathlyhallowspart1.jpg" 	 	 width="155"  	 height="189"  	 	 	 	></noscript></a>  	<figcaption> 		 			<a href="/wiki/File:Harrypotterdeathlyhallowspart1.jpg" class="sprite info-icon"></a> 		 		 		 			<p class="caption">Harry Potter in "Deathly Hallows Part 1"</p> 		 	</figcaption> </figure>
<ul><li>Harry is portrayed by British actor <a href="/wiki/Daniel_Radcliffe" title="Daniel Radcliffe">Daniel Radcliffe</a> in the <a href="/wiki/Harry_Potter_films" title="Harry Potter films" class="mw-redirect">film adaptations</a> of <i><a href="/wiki/Harry_Potter_and_the_Philosopher%27s_Stone_(film)" title="Harry Potter and the Philosopher&#39;s Stone (film)">Harry Potter and the Philosopher's Stone</a></i>, <i><a href="/wiki/Harry_Potter_and_the_Chamber_of_Secrets_(film)" title="Harry Potter and the Chamber of Secrets (film)">Chamber of Secrets</a></i>, <i><a href="/wiki/Harry_Potter_and_the_Prisoner_of_Azkaban_(film)" title="Harry Potter and the Prisoner of Azkaban (film)">Prisoner of Azkaban</a></i>, <i><a href="/wiki/Harry_Potter_and_the_Goblet_of_Fire_(film)" title="Harry Potter and the Goblet of Fire (film)">Goblet of Fire</a></i>, <i><a href="/wiki/Harry_Potter_and_the_Order_of_the_Phoenix_(film)" title="Harry Potter and the Order of the Phoenix (film)">Order of the Phoenix</a></i>, <i><a href="/wiki/Harry_Potter_and_the_Half-Blood_Prince_(film)" title="Harry Potter and the Half-Blood Prince (film)">Half-Blood Prince</a></i> and <i><a href="/wiki/Harry_Potter_and_the_Deathly_Hallows:_Part_1" title="Harry Potter and the Deathly Hallows: Part 1">Deathly Hallows: Part 1</a></i> and <i><a href="/wiki/Harry_Potter_and_the_Deathly_Hallows:_Part_2" title="Harry Potter and the Deathly Hallows: Part 2">Part 2</a></i> and so is one of the 13 characters to appear in all 8 film adaptations. By the time <i><a href="/wiki/Harry_Potter_and_the_Deathly_Hallows:_Part_2" title="Harry Potter and the Deathly Hallows: Part 2">Deathly Hallows: Part 2</a></i> was released, Radcliffe had played the role for ten years consecutively.
</li><li>Interestingly, Harry and <a href="/wiki/Ginevra_Weasley" title="Ginevra Weasley">Ginny</a> share the same star sign: the Leo, also the sign of their house, Gryffindor. Even <a href="/wiki/J._K._Rowling" title="J. K. Rowling">J. K. Rowling</a> and <a href="/wiki/Daniel_Radcliffe" title="Daniel Radcliffe">Daniel Radcliffe</a> both share the same star sign.
</li><li>Harry's first friends were Rubeus Hagrid and Ronald Weasley. Interestingly, both had names that start with the letter "R".
</li><li><a href="/wiki/Daniel_Radcliffe" title="Daniel Radcliffe">Daniel Radcliffe</a> never appears in the Harry Potter Video Games. Harry is instead played by <a href="/wiki/Joe_Sowerbutts" title="Joe Sowerbutts">Joe Sowerbutts</a> in the <a href="/wiki/Harry_Potter_and_the_Philosopher%27s_Stone_(video_game)" title="Harry Potter and the Philosopher&#39;s Stone (video game)">Harry Potter and the Philosopher's Stone Video Game</a>, <a href="/wiki/Tom_Attenborough" title="Tom Attenborough">Tom Attenborough</a> in the <a href="/wiki/Harry_Potter_and_the_Chamber_of_Secrets_(video_game)" title="Harry Potter and the Chamber of Secrets (video game)">Harry Potter and the Chamber of Secrets Video Game</a>, Both <a href="/wiki/Tom_Attenborough" title="Tom Attenborough">Tom Attenborough</a> and <a href="/wiki/Harry_Robinson" title="Harry Robinson">Harry Robinson</a> in the <a href="/wiki/Harry_Potter_and_the_Prisoner_of_Azkaban_(video_game)" title="Harry Potter and the Prisoner of Azkaban (video game)">Harry Potter and the Prisoner of Azkaban Video Game</a>, <a href="/wiki/Daniel_Larner" title="Daniel Larner">Daniel Larner</a> in the <a href="/wiki/Harry_Potter_and_the_Goblet_of_Fire_(video_game)" title="Harry Potter and the Goblet of Fire (video game)">Harry Potter and the Goblet of Fire Video Game</a>, Both <a href="/wiki/Daniel_Larner" title="Daniel Larner">Daniel Larner</a> and <a href="/wiki/Adam_Sopp" title="Adam Sopp">Adam Sopp</a> in the <a href="/wiki/Harry_Potter_and_the_Order_of_the_Phoenix_(video_game)" title="Harry Potter and the Order of the Phoenix (video game)">Harry Potter and the Order of the Phoenix Video Game</a> and again by <a href="/wiki/Adam_Sopp" title="Adam Sopp">Adam Sopp</a> in the <a href="/wiki/Harry_Potter_and_the_Half_Blood_Prince_(video_game)" title="Harry Potter and the Half Blood Prince (video game)" class="mw-redirect">Harry Potter and the Half Blood Prince Video Game</a>, <a href="/wiki/Harry_Potter_and_the_Deathly_Hallows:_Part_1_(video_game)" title="Harry Potter and the Deathly Hallows: Part 1 (video game)">Harry Potter and the Deathly Hallows: Part 1 Video Game</a> and <a href="/wiki/Harry_Potter_and_the_Deathly_Hallows:_Part_2_(video_game)" title="Harry Potter and the Deathly Hallows: Part 2 (video game)">Harry Potter and the Deathly Hallows: Part 2 Video Game</a>.
</li><li>In the whole Harry Potter series, Harry has only called Draco Malfoy by just his first name two times.
<ul><li>The first time was when they were in detention in the Forbidden Forest in their first year.
</li><li>The second and last time he called Draco Malfoy by his first name was during the final duel with Voldemort in the Great Hall, when Harry talked about the mastery of the Elder wand. He said that Voldemort wasn't the master of the Elder Wand, Draco was.
</li></ul>
</li><li>Harry is right-handed. He tells this to Mr Ollivander in <i><a href="/wiki/Harry_Potter_and_the_Philosopher%27s_Stone" title="Harry Potter and the Philosopher&#39;s Stone">Harry Potter and the Philosopher's Stone</a></i>. He is also seen writing with this hand throughout the film series.
</li><li>He often describes various parts of his anatomy as feeling like <a href="/wiki/Lead" title="Lead">lead</a>.
</li><li><a href="/wiki/Josh_Herdman" title="Josh Herdman">Josh Herdman</a> plays Harry when he is disguised as <a href="/wiki/Gregory_Goyle" title="Gregory Goyle">Gregory Goyle</a> in <i><a href="/wiki/Harry_Potter_and_the_Chamber_of_Secrets_(film)" title="Harry Potter and the Chamber of Secrets (film)">Chamber of Secrets</a>,</i> as does <a href="/wiki/David_O%27Hara" title="David O&#39;Hara">David O'Hara</a> when he is disguised as <a href="/wiki/Albert_Runcorn" title="Albert Runcorn">Albert Runcorn</a> in <i><a href="/wiki/Harry_Potter_and_the_Deathly_Hallows:_Part_1" title="Harry Potter and the Deathly Hallows: Part 1">Deathly Hallows: Part 1</a></i>. The <a href="/wiki/Saunders_Triplets" title="Saunders Triplets" class="mw-redirect">Saunders Triplets</a> play Harry as an infant in <i><a href="/wiki/Harry_Potter_and_the_Philosopher%27s_Stone_(film)" title="Harry Potter and the Philosopher&#39;s Stone (film)">Philosopher's Stone</a></i> and <a href="/wiki/Toby_Papworth" title="Toby Papworth">Toby Papworth</a> plays Harry as an infant in <i><a href="/wiki/Harry_Potter_and_the_Deathly_Hallows:_Part_2" title="Harry Potter and the Deathly Hallows: Part 2">Harry Potter and the Deathly Hallows: Part 2</a></i>.
</li><li>In a deleted scene of <i><a href="/wiki/Harry_Potter_and_the_Deathly_Hallows:_Part_1" title="Harry Potter and the Deathly Hallows: Part 1">Harry Potter and the Deathly Hallows: Part 1</a></i>, when he is disguised as <a href="/wiki/Albert_Runcorn" title="Albert Runcorn">Albert Runcorn</a>, Harry calls <a href="/wiki/Arthur_Weasley" title="Arthur Weasley">Arthur Weasley</a> by his first name. This is the only time Harry does this.
</li><li>Daniel Radcliffe and Harry were both born in July — Harry on the 31st and Daniel on the 23rd.
</li><li>Harry has green eyes, but in the films he has blue eyes. This is due to the fact that Daniel Radcliffe was allergic to the contact lenses. Radcliffe also has brown hair, as opposed to Harry's black hair, and also has a strong physical body, rather than the slim frame Harry is described as having. However Harry is only described as having an uncommonly 'slim' frame in the earlier installments, so it is possible that he bulked out a little into a lean frame as he matured.
</li><li>Harry's birthday of 31 July is also the birthday of <i>Harry Potter</i> author, <a href="/wiki/J._K._Rowling" title="J. K. Rowling">J. K. Rowling</a>, and actor <a href="/wiki/Richard_Griffiths" title="Richard Griffiths">Richard Griffiths</a> who plays Harry's Uncle <a href="/wiki/Vernon_Dursley" title="Vernon Dursley">Vernon Dursley</a> in the Harry Potter films.
</li><li>In the <a href="/wiki/Mirror_of_Erised" title="Mirror of Erised">Mirror of Erised</a>, Harry saw his family, a lot of people with untidy black hair, his own noses, mouths and knees. However, he also saw some people with almond-shaped green eyes, which could indicate that he saw his <a href="/wiki/Muggle" title="Muggle">Muggle</a> family as well, even though he did not see the <a href="/wiki/Dursley_family" title="Dursley family">Dursley family</a>. All people were smiling at him, so there is a thought that all of his family, Wizards and Muggles, are proud of him.
</li></ul>
<figure class="article-thumb tleft show-info-icon" style="width: 155px"> 	<a href="http://vignette2.wikia.nocookie.net/harrypotter/images/0/0a/N1470647049_210604_3030.jpg/revision/latest?cb=20091010170256" 	class="image image-thumbnail" 	 	 	><img src="data:image/gif;base64,R0lGODlhAQABAIABAAAAAP///yH5BAEAAAEALAAAAAABAAEAQAICTAEAOw%3D%3D" 	 alt="N1470647049 210604 3030"  	class="thumbimage lzy lzyPlcHld " 	 	data-image-key="N1470647049_210604_3030.jpg" 	data-image-name="N1470647049 210604 3030.jpg" 	 data-src="http://vignette2.wikia.nocookie.net/harrypotter/images/0/0a/N1470647049_210604_3030.jpg/revision/latest/scale-to-width/155?cb=20091010170256"  	 width="155"  	 height="207"  	 	 	 onload="if(typeof ImgLzy===&#39;object&#39;){ImgLzy.load(this)}"  	><noscript><img src="http://vignette2.wikia.nocookie.net/harrypotter/images/0/0a/N1470647049_210604_3030.jpg/revision/latest/scale-to-width/155?cb=20091010170256" 	 alt="N1470647049 210604 3030"  	class="thumbimage " 	 	data-image-key="N1470647049_210604_3030.jpg" 	data-image-name="N1470647049 210604 3030.jpg" 	 	 width="155"  	 height="207"  	 	 	 	></noscript></a>  	<figcaption> 		 			<a href="/wiki/File:N1470647049_210604_3030.jpg" class="sprite info-icon"></a> 		 		 		 			<p class="caption">Harry Potter in deep thought</p> 		 	</figcaption> </figure>
<ul><li>In the <a href="/wiki/Harry_Potter_and_the_Prisoner_of_Azkaban_(film)" title="Harry Potter and the Prisoner of Azkaban (film)">film version</a> of <i><a href="/wiki/Harry_Potter_and_the_Prisoner_of_Azkaban" title="Harry Potter and the Prisoner of Azkaban">Harry Potter and the Prisoner of Azkaban</a></i>, Harry is seen practising <a href="/wiki/Lumos_Maxima" title="Lumos Maxima">Lumos Maxima</a> under the covers in his bedroom, but Harry does not get a letter from the <a href="/wiki/Improper_Use_of_Magic_Office" title="Improper Use of Magic Office">Improper Use of Magic Office</a> even though he is under-age, however, judging by the book he is reading, his reason for doing so is most likely for homework. In the book he is simply using a torch (or flashlight if you're American) while writing his homework for <a href="/wiki/History_of_Magic" title="History of Magic">History of Magic</a>.
</li><li>While Harry repeatedly states <a href="/wiki/Hermione_Granger" title="Hermione Granger">Hermione</a> is the best student in his year in all classes, he has beaten her in two of the three Defence Against the Dark Arts exams they had together, with Hermione only beating him in their first year exam. In addition, <a href="/wiki/J._K._Rowling" title="J. K. Rowling">J. K. Rowling</a> has said that Harry could have beat Hermione in a magical duel halfway through Prisoner of Azkaban.<sup id="cite_ref-88" class="reference"><a href="#cite_note-88">[89]</a></sup> Part of this can be put down to <a href="/wiki/Remus_Lupin" title="Remus Lupin">Professor Lupin</a>'s way of teaching, as it seemed to help bring out Harry's own talent at the subject. It is probably more accurate to say that Hermione is the best student in every subject but DADA, in which Harry is strongest; hence, in Harry's mind she is the best student overall.
</li><li>Harry's niece and nephew, <a href="/wiki/Rose_Weasley" title="Rose Weasley">Rose</a> and <a href="/wiki/Hugo_Weasley" title="Hugo Weasley">Hugo</a>, have some of the same heritage of Harry. A <a href="/wiki/Muggle-born" title="Muggle-born">Muggle-born</a> mother, <a href="/wiki/Lily_Evans" title="Lily Evans">Lily</a> and <a href="/wiki/Hermione_Granger" title="Hermione Granger">Hermione</a>, and a <a href="/wiki/Pure-blood" title="Pure-blood">pure-blood</a> father, <a href="/wiki/James_Potter_I" title="James Potter I">James</a> and <a href="/wiki/Ronald_Weasley" title="Ronald Weasley">Ron</a>. This makes Rose, Hugo and Harry all half-bloods.
</li><li>When Harry is cleaning out his school trunk in 1997, he finds a "Support Cedric Diggory!" badge in there. Considering the badges were only created by <a href="/wiki/Draco_Malfoy" title="Draco Malfoy">Draco Malfoy</a> to get a rise out of Harry in 1994, it seems out of place that Harry has it, although he may have it by accident, or out of respect for Cedric. He could also have kept one as a memento from the Tournament.
</li><li>Throughout the films, Harry's hair grows longer and longer (the longest point was in the Goblet of Fire) until it was cut for the Order of the Phoenix. It has since grown to about the same length as it was for the Prisoner of Azkaban.
</li><li>In the films, <a href="/wiki/Harry_Potter%27s_scars" title="Harry Potter&#39;s scars">Harry's scar</a> is off-centre on his forehead; this was apparently done at <a href="/wiki/J._K._Rowling" title="J. K. Rowling">J. K. Rowling</a>'s request: because of the books' artwork, many fans believe the scar is in the centre of his head. But it is never explicitly mentioned where the scar is located. On all the U.S. book covers (illustrations), the scar on Harry's forehead is located in the centre. The same is definitely true of the last two U.K. instalments; however, on early U.K. book covers, Harry's scar tends to appear slightly off-centre. It is somewhat hard to tell on most of these covers, as Harry's face is only visible in profile. However, on the U.K. cover of Chamber of Secrets, Harry's scar is decidedly off-centre. It is perhaps of this book that Rowling was thinking.
</li></ul>
<figure class="article-thumb tright show-info-icon" style="width: 135px"> 	<a href="http://vignette2.wikia.nocookie.net/harrypotter/images/e/e6/Harry-lego_y_5-7.jpg/revision/latest?cb=20110909103627" 	class="image image-thumbnail" 	 	 	><img src="data:image/gif;base64,R0lGODlhAQABAIABAAAAAP///yH5BAEAAAEALAAAAAABAAEAQAICTAEAOw%3D%3D" 	 alt="Harry-lego y 5-7"  	class="thumbimage lzy lzyPlcHld " 	 	data-image-key="Harry-lego_y_5-7.jpg" 	data-image-name="Harry-lego y 5-7.jpg" 	 data-src="http://vignette2.wikia.nocookie.net/harrypotter/images/e/e6/Harry-lego_y_5-7.jpg/revision/latest/scale-to-width/135?cb=20110909103627"  	 width="135"  	 height="226"  	 	 	 onload="if(typeof ImgLzy===&#39;object&#39;){ImgLzy.load(this)}"  	><noscript><img src="http://vignette2.wikia.nocookie.net/harrypotter/images/e/e6/Harry-lego_y_5-7.jpg/revision/latest/scale-to-width/135?cb=20110909103627" 	 alt="Harry-lego y 5-7"  	class="thumbimage " 	 	data-image-key="Harry-lego_y_5-7.jpg" 	data-image-name="Harry-lego y 5-7.jpg" 	 	 width="135"  	 height="226"  	 	 	 	></noscript></a>  	<figcaption> 		 			<a href="/wiki/File:Harry-lego_y_5-7.jpg" class="sprite info-icon"></a> 		 		 		 			<p class="caption">The Harry Potter LEGO mini-figure</p> 		 	</figcaption> </figure>
<ul><li>The <a href="/wiki/Marauders" title="Marauders">Marauders</a> were said to have discovered more secret places than anyone else in the history of <a href="/wiki/Hogwarts_School_of_Witchcraft_and_Wizardry" title="Hogwarts School of Witchcraft and Wizardry">Hogwarts</a>. This is not necessarily true, as unlike Harry and <a href="/wiki/Tom_Riddle" title="Tom Riddle">Tom Riddle</a>, they did not discover the <a href="/wiki/Chamber_of_Secrets" title="Chamber of Secrets">Chamber of Secrets</a> or the <a href="/wiki/Room_of_Requirement" title="Room of Requirement">Room of Requirement</a>. However, as they discovered an untold number of secret passages and hidden rooms, they did discover more numerous secrets than Riddle or Harry, just not the same ones.
</li><li>In <i><a href="/wiki/Harry,_A_History:_The_True_Story_of_a_Boy_Wizard,_His_Fans,_and_Life_Inside_the_Harry_Potter_Phenomenon" title="Harry, A History: The True Story of a Boy Wizard, His Fans, and Life Inside the Harry Potter Phenomenon">Harry, A History</a></i>, Rowling discussed how <a href="/wiki/Steve_Kloves" title="Steve Kloves">Steve Kloves</a> suspected that something might happen between Harry and Hermione in <i>Deathly Hallows</i>. She replied: "I had always planned that Harry's true soul mate, which I stand by, is Ginny, and that Ron and Hermione have this combative but mutual attraction. They will always bicker, there will always be rough edges there, but they are pulled together, each has something the other needs. [Kloves] felt a certain pull between them at that point. And I think he's right. There are moments when [Harry and Hermione] touch, which are charged moments. One when she touches his hair as he sits on the hilltop reading about Dumbledore and Grindelwald, and [two] the moment when they walk out of the graveyard with their arms around each other. Now the fact is that Hermione shares moments with Harry that Ron will never be able to participate in. He walked out. She shared something very intense with Harry. So I think it could have gone that way".<sup id="cite_ref-HAH_81-1" class="reference"><a href="#cite_note-HAH-81">[82]</a></sup>
</li><li>The only person Harry ever considered killing by use of curse was <a href="/wiki/Sirius_Black" title="Sirius Black">Sirius Black</a> and possibly <a href="/wiki/Bellatrix_Lestrange" title="Bellatrix Lestrange">Bellatrix Lestrange</a>, ironically to avenge Sirius. It is, however, unclear if Harry knew how to cast the <a href="/wiki/Killing_Curse" title="Killing Curse">Avada Kedavra</a> curse since he was not taught the <a href="/wiki/Unforgivable_Curses" title="Unforgivable Curses">Unforgivable Curses</a> until his fourth year. Furthermore, when Harry found out that <a href="/wiki/Peter_Pettigrew" title="Peter Pettigrew">Peter Pettigrew</a> was the one who had betrayed his parents to Voldemort, he did not want Sirius and <a href="/wiki/Remus_Lupin" title="Remus Lupin">Remus Lupin</a> to kill Pettigrew in revenge. Even during the <a href="/wiki/Battle_of_Hogwarts" title="Battle of Hogwarts">Battle of Hogwarts</a>, in which Harry defeated <a href="/wiki/Tom_Riddle" title="Tom Riddle">Lord Voldemort</a>, Harry did not do so by use of any curse intended to do harm to his opponent, but rather he used his "trademark", <a href="/wiki/Disarming_Charm" title="Disarming Charm">Expelliarmus</a>. Harry finished Voldemort by reflecting a curse Harry would never use on another, even his mortal enemy. This suggests the <a href="/wiki/Love" title="Love">love</a>, which is "the power the Dark Lord knows not..." makes it difficult for Harry to kill. Even during the <a href="/wiki/Battle_of_the_Seven_Potters" title="Battle of the Seven Potters">Battle of the Seven Potters</a>, Harry illustrated his unwillingness to kill <a href="/wiki/Death_Eaters" title="Death Eaters">Death Eaters</a>. During that battle the Death Eaters were masked at the time, he could not know who was a willing follower and who was a controlled drone. However in the example with Voldemort, Harry knew Voldemort's <a href="/wiki/Killing_Curse" title="Killing Curse">killing curse</a> would backfire, so rather than use the same curse which would make him look somewhat bad, he instead decided to use the <a href="/wiki/Disarming_Charm" title="Disarming Charm">Disarming Charm</a> to gain possession of the wand.
</li><li>Harry usually has the last line in every Harry Potter film. Though it could be debatable on whether he has the last line of the second film since the closed captions say that Dean said, "Yes!", so he may have had the last line.
<ul><li><i>"I'm not going home...not really.."</i> (<a href="/wiki/Harry_Potter_and_the_Philosopher%27s_Stone_(film)" title="Harry Potter and the Philosopher&#39;s Stone (film)">PS/SS</a>)
</li><li><i>"There's no <a href="/wiki/Hogwarts_School_of_Witchcraft_and_Wizardry" title="Hogwarts School of Witchcraft and Wizardry">Hogwarts</a> without you, <a href="/wiki/Rubeus_Hagrid" title="Rubeus Hagrid">Hagrid</a>."</i> (<a href="/wiki/Harry_Potter_and_the_Chamber_of_Secrets_(film)" title="Harry Potter and the Chamber of Secrets (film)">CS</a>)
</li><li><i>"<a href="/wiki/Wand-Lighting_Charm" title="Wand-Lighting Charm">Lumos</a>. <a href="/wiki/Marauder%27s_Map" title="Marauder&#39;s Map">I solemnly swear that I am up to no good</a>"/"<a href="/wiki/Wand-Extinguishing_Charm" title="Wand-Extinguishing Charm">Nox</a>.""</i> (<a href="/wiki/Harry_Potter_and_the_Prisoner_of_Azkaban_(film)" title="Harry Potter and the Prisoner of Azkaban (film)">POA</a>)
</li><li><i>"Yeah. Every week."</i> (<a href="/wiki/Harry_Potter_and_the_Goblet_of_Fire_(film)" title="Harry Potter and the Goblet of Fire (film)">GOF</a>)
</li><li><i>"<a href="/wiki/Love" title="Love">Something worth fighting for</a>."</i> (<a href="/wiki/Harry_Potter_and_the_Order_of_the_Phoenix_(film)" title="Harry Potter and the Order of the Phoenix (film)">OOTP</a>)
</li><li><i>"I never realised how beautiful <a href="/wiki/Hogwarts_School_of_Witchcraft_and_Wizardry" title="Hogwarts School of Witchcraft and Wizardry">this place</a> was."</i> (<a href="/wiki/Harry_Potter_and_the_Half-Blood_Prince_(film)" title="Harry Potter and the Half-Blood Prince (film)">HBP</a>)
</li><li><i>"I want to bury him [ <a href="/wiki/Dobby" title="Dobby">Dobby</a> ]... without magic."</i> (<a href="/wiki/Harry_Potter_and_the_Deathly_Hallows:_Part_1" title="Harry Potter and the Deathly Hallows: Part 1">DHPt1</a>)
</li><li><i><a href="/wiki/Harry_Potter_and_the_Deathly_Hallows:_Part_2" title="Harry Potter and the Deathly Hallows: Part 2">Harry Potter and the Deathly Hallows: Part 2</a></i> is the only film in which Harry does not speak the final line. It is spoken by his son <a href="/wiki/Albus_Potter" title="Albus Potter">Albus</a>: <i>"Ready."</i> However, it is also obvious that it's mostly Harry's other son <a href="/wiki/James_Potter_II" title="James Potter II">James II</a> who says the last line in this film to Albus just before he (Albus) sits down next to his brother: <i>"Come on."</i>
</li></ul>
</li><li>Harry also has the last line in many of the books, and if not, he makes the last gesture.
<ul><li><i>"I'm going to have a lot of fun with <a href="/wiki/Dudley" title="Dudley">Dudley</a> this summer." </i><a href="/wiki/Philosopher%27s_Stone" title="Philosopher&#39;s Stone">(PS)</a>
</li><li><i>"All those times I could've died and I didn't</i> <i>manage it? They [ <a href="/wiki/The_Dursleys" title="The Dursleys" class="mw-redirect">The Dursleys</a> ] will be furious" </i><a href="/wiki/Chamber_of_Secrets" title="Chamber of Secrets">(CS)</a>
</li><li><i>"He likes to keep in touch with me, ...keep up with my news...check I'm happy." </i><a href="/wiki/Prisoner_of_Azkaban" title="Prisoner of Azkaban" class="mw-redirect">(POA)</a>
</li><li><i>"Harry-thanks." Harry winked at them. (Spoken by <a href="/wiki/George_Weasley" title="George Weasley">George Weasley</a>)</i> <a href="/wiki/Goblet_of_Fire" title="Goblet of Fire">(GOF)</a>
</li><li><i>"Really soon Harry, we promise." Harry nodded. (Spoken by <a href="/wiki/Hermione_Granger" title="Hermione Granger">Hermione Granger</a>)</i> <a href="/wiki/Order_of_the_Phoenix" title="Order of the Phoenix">(OOTP)</a>
</li><li><i>"Yeah we shouldn't miss that [ <a href="/wiki/Wedding_of_Bill_Weasley_and_Fleur_Delacour" title="Wedding of Bill Weasley and Fleur Delacour" class="mw-redirect">Bill and Fleur's Wedding</a> ]."</i> <a href="/wiki/Half-Blood_Prince" title="Half-Blood Prince" class="mw-redirect">(HBP)</a>
</li><li><i>"I know he [ <a href="/wiki/Albus_Potter" title="Albus Potter">Albus Potter</a> ] will"</i> <a href="/wiki/Deathly_Hallows" title="Deathly Hallows">(DH)</a>
</li></ul>
</li><li>Harry was <a href="/wiki/Wizard_of_the_Month" title="Wizard of the Month">Wizard of the Month</a> on <a href="/wiki/J._K._Rowling" title="J. K. Rowling">J. K. Rowling</a>'s website for the month of October 2007.
</li><li>Harry is the inspiration for the <a href="/wiki/Wizard_rock" title="Wizard rock">Wizard rock</a> band, <a href="/wiki/Harry_and_the_Potters" title="Harry and the Potters">Harry and the Potters</a>.
</li><li>The makers of the film <i><a href="http://en.wikipedia.org/wiki/X-Men:_First_Class" class="extiw exitstitial" title="wikipedia:X-Men: First Class">X-Men: First Class</a></i> used Harry Potter as their role model.<sup id="cite_ref-89" class="reference"><a href="#cite_note-89">[90]</a></sup>
</li><li>Harry Potter's former romantic relationship with <a href="/wiki/Cho_Chang" title="Cho Chang">Cho Chang</a> is well known for being his first crush, first kiss and first girlfriend in the Harry Potter series.
</li></ul>
<ul><li>Harry Potter and <a href="/wiki/Ginevra_Weasley" title="Ginevra Weasley">Ginny Weasley</a>'s romantic relationship is told in a different way in the films series from the novel versions of <i>Harry Potter and the Half-Blood Prince</i> and <i>Harry Potter and the Deathly Hallows</i>:
<ul><li><figure class="article-thumb tright show-info-icon" style="width: 117px"> 	<a href="http://vignette4.wikia.nocookie.net/harrypotter/images/d/d4/Dhharryroomhighreso.jpg/revision/latest?cb=20141126202316" 	class="image image-thumbnail" 	 	 	><img src="data:image/gif;base64,R0lGODlhAQABAIABAAAAAP///yH5BAEAAAEALAAAAAABAAEAQAICTAEAOw%3D%3D" 	 alt="Dhharryroomhighreso"  	class="thumbimage lzy lzyPlcHld " 	 	data-image-key="Dhharryroomhighreso.jpg" 	data-image-name="Dhharryroomhighreso.jpg" 	 data-src="http://vignette4.wikia.nocookie.net/harrypotter/images/d/d4/Dhharryroomhighreso.jpg/revision/latest/scale-to-width/117?cb=20141126202316"  	 width="117"  	 height="244"  	 	 	 onload="if(typeof ImgLzy===&#39;object&#39;){ImgLzy.load(this)}"  	><noscript><img src="http://vignette4.wikia.nocookie.net/harrypotter/images/d/d4/Dhharryroomhighreso.jpg/revision/latest/scale-to-width/117?cb=20141126202316" 	 alt="Dhharryroomhighreso"  	class="thumbimage " 	 	data-image-key="Dhharryroomhighreso.jpg" 	data-image-name="Dhharryroomhighreso.jpg" 	 	 width="117"  	 height="244"  	 	 	 	></noscript></a>  	<figcaption> 		 			<a href="/wiki/File:Dhharryroomhighreso.jpg" class="sprite info-icon"></a> 		 		 		 			<p class="caption">Harry Potter</p> 		 	</figcaption> </figure>In the <a href="/wiki/Harry_Potter_and_the_Half-Blood_Prince" title="Harry Potter and the Half-Blood Prince">novel version of Harry Potter and the Half-Blood Prince</a>, Harry shares his first kiss with Ginny in front of <a href="/wiki/Gryffindor" title="Gryffindor">Gryffindor</a> students in the <a href="/wiki/Gryffindor_Tower" title="Gryffindor Tower">Gryffindor Common Room</a> after the <a href="/wiki/Gryffindor_Quidditch_team" title="Gryffindor Quidditch team">Gryffindor Quidditch team</a> won the Quidditch Cup. He also breaks it off with her at Dumbledore's funeral.
</li><li>In the <a href="/wiki/Harry_Potter_and_the_Half-Blood_Prince_(film)" title="Harry Potter and the Half-Blood Prince (film)">film adaptation of Harry Potter and the Half-Blood Prince</a>, Harry and <a href="/wiki/Ginevra_Weasley" title="Ginevra Weasley">Ginny</a> go to the Room of Requirement together to hide Harry's copy of the Advanced Potion-Making book, which previously belong to the <a href="/wiki/Severus_Snape" title="Severus Snape">Half-Blood Prince</a>, after he hurts <a href="/wiki/Draco_Malfoy" title="Draco Malfoy">Draco Malfoy</a>. While there Ginny asked Harry to close his eyes while she goes and hides the Half-Blood Prince book so that he and other students can not find it, when she returned to him, Ginny kisses Harry. Harry was very much delighted and surprised that he received a kiss from her. It is implied that they are still dating at the end of the film.
</li><li>In the <a href="/wiki/Harry_Potter_and_the_Deathly_Hallows" title="Harry Potter and the Deathly Hallows">novel version of Harry Potter and the Deathly Hallows</a>, Harry and Ginny kiss on Harry's seventeenth birthday in Ginny's bedroom at <a href="/wiki/The_Burrow" title="The Burrow">The Burrow</a>, and Ron interrupts them when he opens the door.
</li><li>In the <a href="/wiki/Harry_Potter_and_the_Deathly_Hallows:_Part_1" title="Harry Potter and the Deathly Hallows: Part 1">film version of Harry Potter and the Deathly Hallows: Part One</a>, Harry was in the kitchen at the <a href="/wiki/Weasley_family" title="Weasley family">Weasley family</a> home, on the day of the <a href="/wiki/Wedding_of_William_Weasley_and_Fleur_Delacour" title="Wedding of William Weasley and Fleur Delacour">wedding</a> of <a href="/wiki/William_Weasley" title="William Weasley">Bill Weasley</a> and <a href="/wiki/Fleur_Delacour" title="Fleur Delacour">Fleur Delacour</a>. <a href="/wiki/Ginevra_Weasley" title="Ginevra Weasley">Ginny</a> arrives into the room, she asked him to fasten the zip of her bridesmaid dress. Harry and <a href="/wiki/Ginevra_Weasley" title="Ginevra Weasley">Ginny</a> talked and shared a kiss, while they were kissing Ginny's brother <a href="/wiki/George_Weasley" title="George Weasley">George Weasley</a> comes into the room and interrupts them.
</li><li>In the film of <a href="/wiki/Harry_Potter_and_the_Deathly_Hallows:_Part_2" title="Harry Potter and the Deathly Hallows: Part 2">Harry Potter and the Deathly Hallows: Part 2</a>, <a href="/wiki/Ginevra_Weasley" title="Ginevra Weasley">Ginevra Weasley</a> and <a href="/wiki/Neville_Longbottom" title="Neville Longbottom">Neville Longbottom</a> are both climbing up on one of the staircases, and run into Harry during the battle. <a href="/wiki/Neville_Longbottom" title="Neville Longbottom">Neville</a> ask Harry if he has seen <a href="/wiki/Luna_Lovegood" title="Luna Lovegood">Luna Lovegood</a>, then <a href="/wiki/Neville_Longbottom" title="Neville Longbottom">he</a> confesses to <a href="/wiki/Ginevra_Weasley" title="Ginevra Weasley">Ginny</a> and Harry that he as feelings for <a href="/wiki/Luna_Lovegood" title="Luna Lovegood">Luna</a>, <a href="/wiki/Neville_Longbottom" title="Neville Longbottom">he</a> went away to find and tell <a href="/wiki/Luna_Lovegood" title="Luna Lovegood">Luna</a>. Harry and <a href="/wiki/Ginevra_Weasley" title="Ginevra Weasley">Ginny</a> share a quick kiss, Harry was going to tell Ginny that he loved her, but Ginny quickly told him that she knows, and they both went back to what they were doing before they met up. This did not happen in <a href="/wiki/Harry_Potter_and_the_Deathly_Hallows" title="Harry Potter and the Deathly Hallows">Harry Potter and the Deathly Hallows</a> book.
</li></ul>
</li><li>A running gag in the books is the messiness of Harry's hair. In the films, this is not mentioned except for a reference in the fourth film. Harry notices that Hagrid has combed his hair so he will look good for <a href="/wiki/Olympe_Maxime" title="Olympe Maxime">Olympe Maxime</a>. When Harry says to him, <i>"Hagrid, have you combed your hair?!"</i> Hagrid states, <i>"As a matter of fact, I have. You might wanna try the same thing now and again".</i>
</li><li>Harry Potter is still the only wizard to this day that has had all three Unforgivable Curses cast on him and survived.
</li><li>Both <a href="/wiki/Michael_Corner" title="Michael Corner">Michael Corner</a> and Harry have dated the same girls, but in a different order, Cho Chang and Ginny Weasley.
</li><li>Despite being a talented Quidditch player (and the team Seeker, considered the most important player on the team), Harry never played a full season (every minute of all three matches):
<ul><li>In his first year, he was recuperating in the hospital wing after saving the Philosopher's Stone, and thus missed the final match.
</li><li>In his second year, the final match of the season was cancelled due to the attack on Hermione and <a href="/wiki/Penelope_Clearwater" title="Penelope Clearwater">Penelope Clearwater</a>.
</li><li>In his third year, Harry came closest to playing a full season, but spent the last few seconds of the opening Gryffindor vs. Hufflepuff match unconscious after being attacked by Dementors.
</li><li>In his fourth year, the Quidditch Cup was cancelled due to the Triwizard Tournament.
</li><li>In his fifth year, Harry was banned by Dolores Umbridge after the opening Gryffindor vs. Slytherin match.
</li><li>In his sixth year, Harry was knocked unconscious partway through the second match of the season against Hufflepuff, and then held in detention for the final match against Ravenclaw.
</li></ul>
</li><li>J.K. Rowling has said that because of the demands of his life, Harry has had less sexual experience than boys of his age might have had.<sup id="cite_ref-90" class="reference"><a href="#cite_note-90">[91]</a></sup>
</li><li>J.K. Rowling has said that Harry's glasses are a clue to his vulnerability.<sup id="cite_ref-91" class="reference"><a href="#cite_note-91">[92]</a></sup>
</li><li>J.K. Rowling has said that the character of Wart from <a href="http://en.wikipedia.org/wiki/T._H._White" class="extiw exitstitial" title="wikipedia:T. H. White">T. H. White</a>'s <i><a href="http://en.wikipedia.org/wiki/The_Sword_in_the_Stone" class="extiw exitstitial" title="wikipedia:The Sword in the Stone">The Sword in the Stone</a></i> is "Harry's spiritual ancestor".<sup id="cite_ref-92" class="reference"><a href="#cite_note-92">[93]</a></sup>
</li><li>Like his parents, Harry personally defied Voldemort three times before defeating him the fourth time: once in the Philosopher's Stone Chambers, once at the cemetery in Little Hangleton, and once again during the Battle of the Department of Mysteries. However, there were five previous encounters, if one counts the events of Harry's second year with <a href="/wiki/Tom_Riddle%27s_Diary" title="Tom Riddle&#39;s Diary" class="mw-redirect">Tom Riddle's Diary</a>, though that was a memory instead of the real Voldemort, and the night his parents were killed in <a href="/wiki/Godric%27s_Hallow" title="Godric&#39;s Hallow" class="mw-redirect">Godric's Hallow</a>.
</li><li>Harry learns a new mode of transportation in every book.
<ul><li>In his first year, he learns to travel by <a href="/wiki/Broomstick" title="Broomstick">broomstick</a>.
</li><li>In his second year, he travels by <a href="/wiki/Floo_Powder" title="Floo Powder">Floo Powder</a>.
</li><li>In his third year, he travels on the <a href="/wiki/Knight_Bus" title="Knight Bus">Knight Bus</a> and <a href="/wiki/Buckbeak" title="Buckbeak">Buckbeak</a> the <a href="/wiki/Hippogriff" title="Hippogriff">hippogriff</a> lets him take a ride on his back.
</li><li>In his fourth year, he gets to the <a href="/wiki/Quidditch_World_Cup" title="Quidditch World Cup">Quidditch World Cup</a> by <a href="/wiki/Portkey" title="Portkey">portkey</a>.
</li><li>In his fifth year, he travels to the <a href="/wiki/British_Ministry_of_Magic" title="British Ministry of Magic">Ministry of Magic</a> by <a href="/wiki/Thestral" title="Thestral">thestral</a>.
</li><li>In his sixth year, he learns to <a href="/wiki/Apparation" title="Apparation" class="mw-redirect">Apparate</a>.
</li><li>In the seventh book, he breaks into <a href="/wiki/Gringotts_Wizarding_Bank" title="Gringotts Wizarding Bank">Gringotts</a> and flies out on a <a href="/wiki/Dragon" title="Dragon">dragon</a>.
</li></ul>
</li><li>The only autograph he ever gave out was to <a href="/wiki/Colin_Creevey" title="Colin Creevey">Colin Creevey</a>.
</li><li>In <i>Harry Potter and the Deathly Hallows Part 2: Behind the Magic</i>, the person who makes all the wands for the films revealed that Dan has gone through over 80 wands over the course of the ten years because he drums with them.
</li><li>A variant of Harry is available in the "Downloadable Character Pack" <a href="http://en.wikipedia.org/wiki/Downloadable_content" class="extiw exitstitial" title="wikipedia:Downloadable content">DLC</a> for <i><a href="/wiki/LEGO_Harry_Potter:_Years_5-7" title="LEGO Harry Potter: Years 5-7">LEGO Harry Potter: Years 5-7</a></i>. The variant is called "Harry (Yule Ball)" because it portrays Harry wearing the <a href="/wiki/Harry_Potter%27s_dress_robes" title="Harry Potter&#39;s dress robes">dress robes</a> he wore to the <a href="/wiki/Yule_Ball" title="Yule Ball">Yule Ball</a>.
</li><li>In the <i>Half-Blood Prince</i> film, Harry tells Dumbledore at the train station that he likes riding around on trains as it takes his mind off things.
</li><li>Interestingly, in several meanings of his name, Harry, it is something to do with ruling, mighty in war or war chief; this pretty much describes his character.
</li><li>Daniel Radcliffe said in an interview that Daphne seemed to have adopted him like another father. Interestingly, Daphne plays Daniel's (Harry's) daughter.<sup class="noprint">&#91;<a href="http://en.wikipedia.org/wiki/Wikipedia:Citing_sources" class="extiw exitstitial" title="wikipedia:Wikipedia:Citing sources"><i><span title="The material in the vicinity of this tag needs references to reliable sources." style="white-space: nowrap;">citation needed</span></i></a>&#93;</sup>
</li><li>Harry Potter is J. K. Rowling's favourite character, though she feels that she is unusual in this, as she finds that Ron is generally more popular.<sup id="cite_ref-infosheet_93-0" class="reference"><a href="#cite_note-infosheet-93">[94]</a></sup>
</li><li>in the upcoming Broadway musical, the role will be played by Kyle Dean Massey.
</li></ul>

</p>

<h2><span class="mw-headline" id="Appearances">Appearances</span></h2>

<h2><span class="mw-headline" id="Notes_and_references">Notes and references</span></h2>
<div class="references-small">
<ol class="references"><li id="cite_note-0"><a href="#cite_ref-0">↑</a> <span class="reference-text">Known as this by a paper in <a href="/wiki/Dolores_Umbridge" title="Dolores Umbridge">Dolores Umbridge</a>'s office in [[British Ministry of Magic<a href="/wiki/Ministry_of_Magic" title="Ministry of Magic">Ministry of Magic</a> in <a href="/wiki/1997%E2%80%931998_school_year" title="1997–1998 school year">1997–1998 school year</a>.</span>
</li>
<li id="cite_note-1"><a href="#cite_ref-1">↑</a> <span class="reference-text">Known as this in <a href="/wiki/1992%E2%80%931993_school_year" title="1992–1993 school year">1992–1993 school year</a></span>
</li>
<li id="cite_note-2"><a href="#cite_ref-2">↑</a> <span class="reference-text">Used this name when disguised as a <a href="/wiki/Weasley_family" title="Weasley family">Weasley</a> relative through the means of <a href="/wiki/Polyjuice_Potion" title="Polyjuice Potion">Polyjuice Potion</a></span>
</li>
<li id="cite_note-3"><a href="#cite_ref-3">↑</a> <span class="reference-text"><i><a href="/wiki/Harry_Potter_and_the_Chamber_of_Secrets_(film)" title="Harry Potter and the Chamber of Secrets (film)">Harry Potter and the Chamber of Secrets (film)</a></i></span>
</li>
<li id="cite_note-4"><a href="#cite_ref-4">↑</a> <span class="reference-text">Made up this alias when caught by <a href="/wiki/Snatchers" title="Snatchers">Snatchers</a>, he took the first names from his uncle and cousin</span>
</li>
<li id="cite_note-5"><a href="#cite_ref-5">↑</a> <span class="reference-text">Disguised as him using Polyjuice Potion to infiltrate the <a href="/wiki/British_Ministry_of_Magic" title="British Ministry of Magic">Ministry</a></span>
</li>
<li id="cite_note-6"><a href="#cite_ref-6">↑</a> <span class="reference-text">He tells Peeves he's the Bloody Baron when he was under the Invisibility cloak during his first year.</span>
</li>
<li id="cite_note-7"><a href="#cite_ref-7">↑</a> <span class="reference-text">Used this name to avoid attention on the Knight Bus</span>
</li>
<li id="cite_note-8"><a href="#cite_ref-8">↑</a> <span class="reference-text">While trying to hide the fact that he had <a href="/wiki/Severus_Snape%27s_copy_of_Advanced_Potion-Making" title="Severus Snape&#39;s copy of Advanced Potion-Making">Snape's copy of <i>Advanced Potion-Making</i></a></span>
</li>
<li id="cite_note-9"><a href="#cite_ref-9">↑</a> <span class="reference-text">In <i><a href="/wiki/Harry_Potter_and_the_Order_of_the_Phoenix" title="Harry Potter and the Order of the Phoenix">Harry Potter and the Order of the Phoenix</a></i></span>
</li>
<li id="cite_note-10"><a href="#cite_ref-10">↑</a> <span class="reference-text">Harry was banned from participating in Quidditch games by Professor Umbridge in his fifth year, along with Fred and George Weasley. Therefore, he was not on the team when they won the cup that year.</span>
</li>
<li id="cite_note-11"><a href="#cite_ref-11">↑</a> <span class="reference-text"><a href="/wiki/House_of_Black" title="House of Black">Black family tree</a></span>
</li>
<li id="cite_note-12"><a href="#cite_ref-12">↑</a> <span class="reference-text">On the Black family tree released for charity by J.K. Rowling, it shows a Charlus Potter, with one son, but there is no proof that Charlus Potter is related to Harry.</span>
</li>
<li id="cite_note-13"><a href="#cite_ref-13">↑</a> <span class="reference-text"><i><a href="/wiki/.K._Rowling:_A_Year_in_the_Life?action=edit&amp;redlink=1" class="new" title=".K. </li>
<li id="cite_note-14"><a href="#cite_ref-14">↑</a> <span class="reference-text">Nagini was not made a Horcrux until Voldemort's return, when he killed the old Muggle caretaker of the Riddle home just prior to the Triwizard Tournament, and Harry himself did not contain part of Voldemort's soul until the time of the failed Killing Curse.</span>
</li>
<li id="cite_note-15"><a href="#cite_ref-15">↑</a> <span class="reference-text">Rowling never specified the environment within it, but it was presumably even worse than St. Grogory's in terms of what he might have expected as treatment.</span>

	</div>
